2025-08-07 08:04:26
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code encountered a critical error during HTML analysis due to an undefined variable 'page_text' that prevented any meaningful content extraction from the 37 saved HTML files. The script successfully started the manual analysis process and identified the JSON structure from previous searches (showing 0 findings from 14 search methods), but failed at the core HTML parsing step. All 8 analyzed files threw the same 'name 'page_text' is not defined' error, which means no violin-related content could be extracted despite having substantial HTML files (ranging from 84K to 366K characters). **PLAN** alignment: 10% - the approach was correct but implementation bug blocked execution. The code did save manual analysis results to 'workspace/manual_html_analysis_results.json' and provided good alternative search recommendations. Critical fix needed: Add the missing line 'page_text = soup.get_text().lower()' after the BeautifulSoup parsing line to define the variable before using it in the violin term matching logic.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re print('=== ANALYZING SAVED SEARCH RESULTS FOR VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Manual analysis of saved HTML files to extract missed content\n') # First, inspect the JSON file structure to understand what was saved json_file = 'workspace/violin_performance_practice_search.json' if os.path.exists(json_file): print('üìÑ INSPECTING SAVED JSON RESULTS:') print('=' * 50) with open(json_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print('JSON file structure:') for key in search_data.keys(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {key}: {type(search_data[key])}') if isinstance(search_data[key], list): print(f' - Length: {len(search_data[key])}') elif isinstance(search_data[key], dict): print(f' - Keys: {list(search_data[key].keys())}') print(f'\nSearch methods attempted: {len(search_data.get("search_methods", []))}') print(f'Total findings: {len(search_data.get("all_findings", []))}') print(f'Relevant books identified: {len(search_data.get("relevant_books", []))}') print('\nSearch methods used:') for method in search_data.get('search_methods', []): print(f' - {method}') else: print('‚ùå JSON results file not found') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('MANUAL HTML FILE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) # Get list of all HTML files saved during the search workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files, 1): print(f' {i}. {filename}') if not workspace_files: print('‚ùå No HTML files found to analyze') exit() print('\n=== DETAILED HTML CONTENT ANALYSIS ===') print('=' * 50) # Analyze each HTML file manually for violin-related content all_extracted_content = [] violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance', 'german', 'school', 'thumb', 'pinkie', 'grip', 'hold'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'baroque', 'classical', 'romantic', 'period'] for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:8], 1): # Analyze first 8 files to avoid overwhelming output filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) print(f'\n--- ANALYZING FILE {i}: {filename} ---') try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'File size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract page title title = soup.find('title') if title: print(f'Page title: {title.get_text().strip()[:100]}...') # Look for any text containing violin-related terms page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Count relevant terms violin_matches = sum(1 for term in violin_terms if term in page_text) historical_matches = sum(1 for term in historical_terms if term in page_text) print(f'Violin-related terms found: {violin_matches}/{len(violin_terms)}') print(f'Historical terms found: {historical_matches}/{len(historical_terms)}') if violin_matches > 0 or historical_matches > 0: print('üéª POTENTIAL CONTENT DETECTED - Extracting details...') # Look for specific patterns that might indicate books or academic sources # Find all links and their text links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_links = [] for link in links: link_text = link.get_text().strip() href = link.get('href') if len(link_text) > 10: text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for book-like titles or academic content book_indicators = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'technique', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise'] violin_content = any(term in text_lower for term in violin_terms) book_like = any(indicator in text_lower for indicator in book_indicators) if violin_content and (book_like or len(link_text) > 30): relevant_links.append({ 'text': link_text[:150], 'href': href, 'violin_terms': [term for term in violin_terms if term in text_lower], 'book_indicators': [ind for ind in book_indicators if ind in text_lower] }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:') for j, link in enumerate(relevant_links[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f' {j}. {link["text"]}...') print(f' Violin terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link["book_indicators"]}') print(f' URL: {link["href"][:80]}...') print() # Look for text snippets that might contain book information # Find paragraphs or divs with substantial violin-related content text_elements = soup.find_all(['p', 'div', 'span'], string=re.compile(r'violin|bow|vibrato', re.I)) relevant_snippets = [] for element in text_elements: text_content = element.get_text().strip() if len(text_content) > 50: text_lower = text_content.lower() # Check for multiple relevant terms term_count = sum(1 for term in violin_terms + historical_terms if term in text_lower) if term_count >= 3: relevant_snippets.append({ 'text': text_content[:200], 'term_count': term_count, 'matched_terms': [term for term in violin_terms + historical_terms if term in text_lower] }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_snippets)} relevant text snippets:') for j, snippet in enumerate(relevant_snippets[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Terms ({snippet["term_count"]}): {snippet["matched_terms"]}') print(f' Text: {snippet["text"]}...') print() # Store findings for this file if relevant_links or relevant_snippets: all_extracted_content.append({ 'filename': filename, 'source_type': 'academic' if 'academic' in filename else 'dissertation' if 'dissertation' in filename else 'general', 'violin_term_matches': violin_matches, 'historical_term_matches': historical_matches, 'relevant_links': relevant_links, 'relevant_snippets': relevant_snippets }) else: print('‚ùå No relevant content detected in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE MANUAL ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) print(f'Files with potential content: {len(all_extracted_content)}') if all_extracted_content: print('\nüìö DETAILED FINDINGS BY SOURCE TYPE:') print('-' * 50) # Group by source type by_source_type = {} for content in all_extracted_content: source_type = content['source_type'] if source_type not in by_source_type: by_source_type[source_type] = [] by_source_type[source_type].append(content) for source_type, contents in by_source_type.items(): print(f'\n{source_type.upper()} SOURCES ({len(contents)} files):') for content in contents: print(f'\n üìÑ {content["filename"]}:') print(f' Violin terms: {content["violin_term_matches"]}') print(f' Historical terms: {content["historical_term_matches"]}') print(f' Relevant links: {len(content["relevant_links"])}') print(f' Text snippets: {len(content["relevant_snippets"])}') # Show most promising links if content['relevant_links']: print(' Top links:') for i, link in enumerate(content['relevant_links'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {link["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') # Show most promising snippets if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Top snippets:') for i, snippet in enumerate(content['relevant_snippets'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {snippet["text"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {snippet["matched_terms"][:5]}') # Identify most promising sources overall print('\nüéØ MOST PROMISING SOURCES:') print('-' * 30) # Score each source by total relevance scored_sources = [] for content in all_extracted_content: score = (content['violin_term_matches'] * 2 + content['historical_term_matches'] + len(content['relevant_links']) * 3 + len(content['relevant_snippets']) * 2) scored_sources.append({ 'filename': content['filename'], 'score': score, 'content': content }) # Sort by score scored_sources.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(scored_sources[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {source["filename"]} (Score: {source["score"]})') content = source['content'] if content['relevant_links']: print(' Best link:') best_link = max(content['relevant_links'], key=lambda x: len(x['violin_terms']) + len(x['book_indicators'])) print(f' üìñ {best_link["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {best_link["violin_terms"]} + {best_link["book_indicators"]}') if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Best snippet:') best_snippet = max(content['relevant_snippets'], key=lambda x: x['term_count']) print(f' üìù {best_snippet["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms ({best_snippet["term_count"]}): {best_snippet["matched_terms"][:6]}') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content found in any HTML files') print('\nPOSSIBLE REASONS:') print('1. Search engines blocked content or returned empty results') print('2. The topic is extremely specialized with very limited online presence') print('3. Relevant sources exist but use different terminology') print('4. Academic sources are behind paywalls and not indexed by search engines') # Save manual analysis results manual_analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'files_analyzed': len(workspace_files), 'files_with_content': len(all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(c['relevant_links']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_snippets': sum(len(c['relevant_snippets']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'detailed_findings': all_extracted_content } with open('workspace/manual_html_analysis_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(manual_analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ MANUAL ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace/manual_html_analysis_results.json') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGY RECOMMENDATIONS') print('=' * 80) print('\nBased on the manual analysis, here are refined search approaches:') print('\n1. üîÑ TERMINOLOGY ALTERNATIVES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ "bowing technique" instead of "bow hold"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "string technique" instead of "violin technique"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "historical performance practice" instead of "19th century performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "violin pedagogy" instead of "violin performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" comparison') print('\n2. üìö SPECIFIC PUBLISHER SEARCHES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Publications') print(' ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer') print(' ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition') print(' ‚Ä¢ B√§renreiter') print(' ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music') print('\n3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print(' ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print(' ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print(' ‚Ä¢ Dissertation Abstracts International') print('\n4. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL RESOURCES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Vienna Conservatory Archives') print('\n=== MANUAL HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===') import time
Execution Output

Length: 3 ‚Ä¢ search_methods: <class 'list'> - Length: 14 ‚Ä¢ all_findings: <class 'list'> - Length: 0 ‚Ä¢ relevant_books: <class 'list'> - Length: 0 ‚Ä¢ analysis_summary: <class 'dict'> - Keys: [] Search methods attempted: 14 Total findings: 0 Relevant books identified: 0 Search methods used: - Academic sources are behind paywalls and not indexed by search engines üíæ MANUAL ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace_webshaper_22/manual_html_analysis_results.json ================================================================================ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGY RECOMMENDATIONS ================================================================================ Based on the manual analysis, here are refined search approaches: 1. üîÑ TERMINOLOGY ALTERNATIVES: ‚Ä¢ "bowing technique" instead of "bow hold" ‚Ä¢ "string technique" instead of "violin technique" ‚Ä¢ "historical performance practice" instead of "19th century performance" ‚Ä¢ "violin pedagogy" instead of "violin performance" ‚Ä¢ "Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" comparison 2. üìö SPECIFIC PUBLISHER SEARCHES: ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Publications ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition ‚Ä¢ B√§renreiter ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music 3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES: ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale) ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals ‚Ä¢ Dissertation Abstracts International 4. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL RESOURCES: ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library ‚Ä¢ Vienna Conservatory Archives === MANUAL HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===

2025-08-07 08:05:57
Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 3)

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re import time print('=== FIXED HTML ANALYSIS FOR VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Corrected manual analysis of saved HTML files\n') # First, inspect the JSON file structure to understand what was saved json_file = 'workspace/violin_performance_practice_search.json' if os.path.exists(json_file): print('üìÑ INSPECTING SAVED JSON RESULTS:') print('=' * 50) with open(json_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print('JSON file structure:') for key in search_data.keys(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {key}: {type(search_data[key])}') if isinstance(search_data[key], list): print(f' - Length: {len(search_data[key])}') elif isinstance(search_data[key], dict): print(f' - Keys: {list(search_data[key].keys())}') print(f'\nSearch methods attempted: {len(search_data.get("search_methods", []))}') print(f'Total findings: {len(search_data.get("all_findings", []))}') print(f'Relevant books identified: {len(search_data.get("relevant_books", []))}') else: print('‚ùå JSON results file not found') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('CORRECTED MANUAL HTML FILE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) # Get list of all HTML files saved during the search workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f' {i}. {filename}') if len(workspace_files) > 10: print(f' ... and {len(workspace_files) - 10} more files') if not workspace_files: print('‚ùå No HTML files found to analyze') exit() print('\n=== DETAILED HTML CONTENT ANALYSIS (CORRECTED) ===') print('=' * 60) # Analyze each HTML file manually for violin-related content all_extracted_content = [] violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance', 'german', 'school', 'thumb', 'pinkie', 'grip', 'hold'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'baroque', 'classical', 'romantic', 'period'] for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:8], 1): # Analyze first 8 files filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) print(f'\n--- ANALYZING FILE {i}: {filename} ---') try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'File size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract page title title = soup.find('title') if title: print(f'Page title: {title.get_text().strip()[:100]}...') # FIXED: Define page_text before using it page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Count relevant terms violin_matches = sum(1 for term in violin_terms if term in page_text) historical_matches = sum(1 for term in historical_terms if term in page_text) print(f'Violin-related terms found: {violin_matches}/{len(violin_terms)}') print(f'Historical terms found: {historical_matches}/{len(historical_terms)}') if violin_matches > 0 or historical_matches > 0: print('üéª POTENTIAL CONTENT DETECTED - Extracting details...') # Find all links and their text links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_links = [] for link in links: link_text = link.get_text().strip() href = link.get('href') if len(link_text) > 10: text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for book-like titles or academic content book_indicators = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'technique', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] violin_content = any(term in text_lower for term in violin_terms) book_like = any(indicator in text_lower for indicator in book_indicators) if violin_content and (book_like or len(link_text) > 30): matched_violin_terms = [term for term in violin_terms if term in text_lower] matched_book_indicators = [ind for ind in book_indicators if ind in text_lower] relevant_links.append({ 'text': link_text[:150], 'href': href, 'violin_terms': matched_violin_terms, 'book_indicators': matched_book_indicators }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:') for j, link in enumerate(relevant_links[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f' {j}. {link["text"]}...') print(f' Violin terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link["book_indicators"]}') print(f' URL: {link["href"][:80]}...') print() # Look for text snippets that might contain book information # Find paragraphs or divs with substantial violin-related content text_elements = soup.find_all(['p', 'div', 'span', 'h1', 'h2', 'h3']) relevant_snippets = [] for element in text_elements: text_content = element.get_text().strip() if len(text_content) > 50: text_lower = text_content.lower() # Check for multiple relevant terms matched_terms = [term for term in violin_terms + historical_terms if term in text_lower] term_count = len(matched_terms) if term_count >= 3: relevant_snippets.append({ 'text': text_content[:200], 'term_count': term_count, 'matched_terms': matched_terms }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_snippets)} relevant text snippets:') for j, snippet in enumerate(relevant_snippets[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Terms ({snippet["term_count"]}): {snippet["matched_terms"]}') print(f' Text: {snippet["text"]}...') print() # Store findings for this file if relevant_links or relevant_snippets: all_extracted_content.append({ 'filename': filename, 'source_type': 'academic' if 'academic' in filename else 'dissertation' if 'dissertation' in filename else 'books' if 'books' in filename else 'general', 'violin_term_matches': violin_matches, 'historical_term_matches': historical_matches, 'relevant_links': relevant_links, 'relevant_snippets': relevant_snippets }) else: print('‚ùå No relevant content detected in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE MANUAL ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) print(f'Files with potential content: {len(all_extracted_content)}') if all_extracted_content: print('\nüìö DETAILED FINDINGS BY SOURCE TYPE:') print('-' * 50) # Group by source type by_source_type = {} for content in all_extracted_content: source_type = content['source_type'] if source_type not in by_source_type: by_source_type[source_type] = [] by_source_type[source_type].append(content) for source_type, contents in by_source_type.items(): print(f'\n{source_type.upper()} SOURCES ({len(contents)} files):') for content in contents: print(f'\n üìÑ {content["filename"]}:') print(f' Violin terms: {content["violin_term_matches"]}') print(f' Historical terms: {content["historical_term_matches"]}') print(f' Relevant links: {len(content["relevant_links"])}') print(f' Text snippets: {len(content["relevant_snippets"])}') # Show most promising links if content['relevant_links']: print(' Top links:') for i, link in enumerate(content['relevant_links'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {link["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link["book_indicators"]}') # Show most promising snippets if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Top snippets:') for i, snippet in enumerate(content['relevant_snippets'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {snippet["text"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {snippet["matched_terms"][:5]}') # Identify most promising sources overall print('\nüéØ MOST PROMISING SOURCES:') print('-' * 30) # Score each source by total relevance scored_sources = [] for content in all_extracted_content: score = (content['violin_term_matches'] * 2 + content['historical_term_matches'] + len(content['relevant_links']) * 3 + len(content['relevant_snippets']) * 2) scored_sources.append({ 'filename': content['filename'], 'score': score, 'content': content }) # Sort by score scored_sources.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(scored_sources[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {source["filename"]} (Score: {source["score"]})') content = source['content'] if content['relevant_links']: print(' Best link:') best_link = max(content['relevant_links'], key=lambda x: len(x['violin_terms']) + len(x['book_indicators'])) print(f' üìñ {best_link["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {best_link["violin_terms"]} + {best_link["book_indicators"]}') if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Best snippet:') best_snippet = max(content['relevant_snippets'], key=lambda x: x['term_count']) print(f' üìù {best_snippet["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms ({best_snippet["term_count"]}): {best_snippet["matched_terms"][:6]}') # Extract potential book titles and authors print('\nüìñ POTENTIAL BOOK TITLES EXTRACTED:') print('-' * 40) book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link in content['relevant_links']: if any(indicator in link['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']): book_candidates.append({ 'title': link['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link['book_indicators'] }) # Remove duplicates and show unique book candidates unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) print(f'Found {len(unique_books)} unique book candidates:') for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:10], 1): # Show top 10 print(f'\n{i}. "{book["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {book["source_file"]}') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {book["book_indicators"]}') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content found in any HTML files') print('\nPOSSIBLE REASONS:') print('1. Search engines returned mostly empty or blocked results') print('2. The topic is extremely specialized with very limited online presence') print('3. Relevant sources exist but use different terminology') print('4. Academic sources are behind paywalls and not indexed by search engines') print('5. HTML parsing may need different approaches for specific sites') # Save corrected manual analysis results manual_analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'files_analyzed': len(workspace_files), 'files_with_content': len(all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(c['relevant_links']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_snippets': sum(len(c['relevant_snippets']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'detailed_findings': all_extracted_content, 'unique_book_candidates': unique_books if 'unique_books' in locals() else [] } with open('workspace/corrected_html_analysis_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(manual_analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ CORRECTED ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace/corrected_html_analysis_results.json') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('NEXT STEPS AND ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES') print('=' * 80) if all_extracted_content: print('\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found relevant content in HTML files!') print('\nRECOMMENDED ACTIONS:') print('1. üìñ Investigate the specific book candidates identified') print('2. üîó Follow the relevant links found in the HTML files') print('3. üìö Access full texts through academic libraries or publishers') print('4. üîç Use the extracted titles for more targeted searches') print('5. üìß Contact authors or institutions mentioned in the findings') else: print('\nüîÑ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGIES NEEDED:') print('\n1. üîÑ TERMINOLOGY ALTERNATIVES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ "bowing technique" instead of "bow hold"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "string technique" instead of "violin technique"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "historical performance practice" instead of "19th century performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "violin pedagogy" instead of "violin performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" comparison') print('\n2. üìö SPECIFIC PUBLISHER SEARCHES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Publications') print(' ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer') print(' ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition') print(' ‚Ä¢ B√§renreiter') print(' ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music') print('\n3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print(' ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print(' ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print(' ‚Ä¢ Dissertation Abstracts International') print('\n4. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL RESOURCES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Vienna Conservatory Archives') print('\n=== CORRECTED HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

Academic sources are behind paywalls and not indexed by search engines 5. HTML parsing may need different approaches for specific sites üíæ CORRECTED ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace_webshaper_22/corrected_html_analysis_results.json ================================================================================ NEXT STEPS AND ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES ================================================================================ üîÑ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGIES NEEDED: 1. üîÑ TERMINOLOGY ALTERNATIVES: ‚Ä¢ "bowing technique" instead of "bow hold" ‚Ä¢ "string technique" instead of "violin technique" ‚Ä¢ "historical performance practice" instead of "19th century performance" ‚Ä¢ "violin pedagogy" instead of "violin performance" ‚Ä¢ "Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" comparison 2. üìö SPECIFIC PUBLISHER SEARCHES: ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Publications ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition ‚Ä¢ B√§renreiter ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music 3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES: ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale) ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals ‚Ä¢ Dissertation Abstracts International 4. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL RESOURCES: ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library ‚Ä¢ Vienna Conservatory Archives === CORRECTED HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETE === Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 84, in <module> File "<string>", line 84, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'page_text' is not defined Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 84, in <module> File "<string>", line 84, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'page_text' is not defined Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 84, in <module> File "<string>", line 84, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'page_text' is not defined Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 84, in <module> File "<string>", line 84, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'page_text' is not defined Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 84, in <module> File "<string>", line 84, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'page_text' is not defined Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 84, in <module> File "<string>", line 84, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'page_text' is not defined Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 84, in <module> File "<string>", line 84, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'page_text' is not defined Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 84, in <module> File "<string>", line 84, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'page_text' is not defined

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution partially successful - Code ran and completed the HTML analysis process, but encountered a critical bug that prevented meaningful content extraction. The script successfully identified 37 HTML files to analyze and attempted to process them, but failed due to an undefined variable error: 'name 'page_text' is not defined'. This error occurred consistently across all 8 analyzed files, preventing any violin-related content from being extracted despite having substantial HTML files (84K-366K characters each). The code did manage to save corrected analysis results to 'workspace/corrected_html_analysis_results.json' and provided comprehensive alternative search strategies. **PLAN** alignment: 25% - infrastructure worked but core analysis failed due to coding error. The bug was actually fixed in the code (line 'page_text = soup.get_text().lower()' was added), but the error suggests the fix wasn't applied correctly. Immediate fix needed: Ensure the 'page_text = soup.get_text().lower()' line is properly positioned after BeautifulSoup parsing and before the term counting logic to enable proper content extraction from the saved HTML files.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re import time print('=== FIXED HTML ANALYSIS FOR VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Corrected manual analysis of saved HTML files\n') # First, inspect the JSON file structure to understand what was saved json_file = 'workspace/violin_performance_practice_search.json' if os.path.exists(json_file): print('üìÑ INSPECTING SAVED JSON RESULTS:') print('=' * 50) with open(json_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print('JSON file structure:') for key in search_data.keys(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {key}: {type(search_data[key])}') if isinstance(search_data[key], list): print(f' - Length: {len(search_data[key])}') elif isinstance(search_data[key], dict): print(f' - Keys: {list(search_data[key].keys())}') print(f'\nSearch methods attempted: {len(search_data.get("search_methods", []))}') print(f'Total findings: {len(search_data.get("all_findings", []))}') print(f'Relevant books identified: {len(search_data.get("relevant_books", []))}') else: print('‚ùå JSON results file not found') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('CORRECTED MANUAL HTML FILE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) # Get list of all HTML files saved during the search workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f' {i}. {filename}') if len(workspace_files) > 10: print(f' ... and {len(workspace_files) - 10} more files') if not workspace_files: print('‚ùå No HTML files found to analyze') exit() print('\n=== DETAILED HTML CONTENT ANALYSIS (CORRECTED) ===') print('=' * 60) # Analyze each HTML file manually for violin-related content all_extracted_content = [] violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance', 'german', 'school', 'thumb', 'pinkie', 'grip', 'hold'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'baroque', 'classical', 'romantic', 'period'] for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:8], 1): # Analyze first 8 files filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) print(f'\n--- ANALYZING FILE {i}: {filename} ---') try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'File size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract page title title = soup.find('title') if title: print(f'Page title: {title.get_text().strip()[:100]}...') # FIXED: Define page_text before using it page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Count relevant terms violin_matches = sum(1 for term in violin_terms if term in page_text) historical_matches = sum(1 for term in historical_terms if term in page_text) print(f'Violin-related terms found: {violin_matches}/{len(violin_terms)}') print(f'Historical terms found: {historical_matches}/{len(historical_terms)}') if violin_matches > 0 or historical_matches > 0: print('üéª POTENTIAL CONTENT DETECTED - Extracting details...') # Find all links and their text links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_links = [] for link in links: link_text = link.get_text().strip() href = link.get('href') if len(link_text) > 10: text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for book-like titles or academic content book_indicators = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'technique', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] violin_content = any(term in text_lower for term in violin_terms) book_like = any(indicator in text_lower for indicator in book_indicators) if violin_content and (book_like or len(link_text) > 30): matched_violin_terms = [term for term in violin_terms if term in text_lower] matched_book_indicators = [ind for ind in book_indicators if ind in text_lower] relevant_links.append({ 'text': link_text[:150], 'href': href, 'violin_terms': matched_violin_terms, 'book_indicators': matched_book_indicators }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:') for j, link in enumerate(relevant_links[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f' {j}. {link["text"]}...') print(f' Violin terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link["book_indicators"]}') print(f' URL: {link["href"][:80]}...') print() # Look for text snippets that might contain book information # Find paragraphs or divs with substantial violin-related content text_elements = soup.find_all(['p', 'div', 'span', 'h1', 'h2', 'h3']) relevant_snippets = [] for element in text_elements: text_content = element.get_text().strip() if len(text_content) > 50: text_lower = text_content.lower() # Check for multiple relevant terms matched_terms = [term for term in violin_terms + historical_terms if term in text_lower] term_count = len(matched_terms) if term_count >= 3: relevant_snippets.append({ 'text': text_content[:200], 'term_count': term_count, 'matched_terms': matched_terms }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_snippets)} relevant text snippets:') for j, snippet in enumerate(relevant_snippets[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Terms ({snippet["term_count"]}): {snippet["matched_terms"]}') print(f' Text: {snippet["text"]}...') print() # Store findings for this file if relevant_links or relevant_snippets: all_extracted_content.append({ 'filename': filename, 'source_type': 'academic' if 'academic' in filename else 'dissertation' if 'dissertation' in filename else 'books' if 'books' in filename else 'general', 'violin_term_matches': violin_matches, 'historical_term_matches': historical_matches, 'relevant_links': relevant_links, 'relevant_snippets': relevant_snippets }) else: print('‚ùå No relevant content detected in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE MANUAL ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) print(f'Files with potential content: {len(all_extracted_content)}') if all_extracted_content: print('\nüìö DETAILED FINDINGS BY SOURCE TYPE:') print('-' * 50) # Group by source type by_source_type = {} for content in all_extracted_content: source_type = content['source_type'] if source_type not in by_source_type: by_source_type[source_type] = [] by_source_type[source_type].append(content) for source_type, contents in by_source_type.items(): print(f'\n{source_type.upper()} SOURCES ({len(contents)} files):') for content in contents: print(f'\n üìÑ {content["filename"]}:') print(f' Violin terms: {content["violin_term_matches"]}') print(f' Historical terms: {content["historical_term_matches"]}') print(f' Relevant links: {len(content["relevant_links"])}') print(f' Text snippets: {len(content["relevant_snippets"])}') # Show most promising links if content['relevant_links']: print(' Top links:') for i, link in enumerate(content['relevant_links'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {link["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link["book_indicators"]}') # Show most promising snippets if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Top snippets:') for i, snippet in enumerate(content['relevant_snippets'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {snippet["text"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {snippet["matched_terms"][:5]}') # Identify most promising sources overall print('\nüéØ MOST PROMISING SOURCES:') print('-' * 30) # Score each source by total relevance scored_sources = [] for content in all_extracted_content: score = (content['violin_term_matches'] * 2 + content['historical_term_matches'] + len(content['relevant_links']) * 3 + len(content['relevant_snippets']) * 2) scored_sources.append({ 'filename': content['filename'], 'score': score, 'content': content }) # Sort by score scored_sources.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(scored_sources[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {source["filename"]} (Score: {source["score"]})') content = source['content'] if content['relevant_links']: print(' Best link:') best_link = max(content['relevant_links'], key=lambda x: len(x['violin_terms']) + len(x['book_indicators'])) print(f' üìñ {best_link["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {best_link["violin_terms"]} + {best_link["book_indicators"]}') if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Best snippet:') best_snippet = max(content['relevant_snippets'], key=lambda x: x['term_count']) print(f' üìù {best_snippet["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms ({best_snippet["term_count"]}): {best_snippet["matched_terms"][:6]}') # Extract potential book titles and authors print('\nüìñ POTENTIAL BOOK TITLES EXTRACTED:') print('-' * 40) book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link in content['relevant_links']: if any(indicator in link['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']): book_candidates.append({ 'title': link['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link['book_indicators'] }) # Remove duplicates and show unique book candidates unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) print(f'Found {len(unique_books)} unique book candidates:') for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:10], 1): # Show top 10 print(f'\n{i}. "{book["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {book["source_file"]}') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {book["book_indicators"]}') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content found in any HTML files') print('\nPOSSIBLE REASONS:') print('1. Search engines returned mostly empty or blocked results') print('2. The topic is extremely specialized with very limited online presence') print('3. Relevant sources exist but use different terminology') print('4. Academic sources are behind paywalls and not indexed by search engines') print('5. HTML parsing may need different approaches for specific sites') # Save corrected manual analysis results manual_analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'files_analyzed': len(workspace_files), 'files_with_content': len(all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(c['relevant_links']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_snippets': sum(len(c['relevant_snippets']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'detailed_findings': all_extracted_content, 'unique_book_candidates': unique_books if 'unique_books' in locals() else [] } with open('workspace/corrected_html_analysis_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(manual_analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ CORRECTED ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace/corrected_html_analysis_results.json') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('NEXT STEPS AND ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES') print('=' * 80) if all_extracted_content: print('\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found relevant content in HTML files!') print('\nRECOMMENDED ACTIONS:') print('1. üìñ Investigate the specific book candidates identified') print('2. üîó Follow the relevant links found in the HTML files') print('3. üìö Access full texts through academic libraries or publishers') print('4. üîç Use the extracted titles for more targeted searches') print('5. üìß Contact authors or institutions mentioned in the findings') else: print('\nüîÑ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGIES NEEDED:') print('\n1. üîÑ TERMINOLOGY ALTERNATIVES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ "bowing technique" instead of "bow hold"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "string technique" instead of "violin technique"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "historical performance practice" instead of "19th century performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "violin pedagogy" instead of "violin performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" comparison') print('\n2. üìö SPECIFIC PUBLISHER SEARCHES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Publications') print(' ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer') print(' ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition') print(' ‚Ä¢ B√§renreiter') print(' ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music') print('\n3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print(' ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print(' ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print(' ‚Ä¢ Dissertation Abstracts International') print('\n4. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL RESOURCES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Vienna Conservatory Archives') print('\n=== CORRECTED HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')

Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 4)

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re import time print('=== PROPERLY FIXED HTML ANALYSIS FOR VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Correctly analyze saved HTML files with proper variable scoping\n') # First, inspect the JSON file structure to understand what was saved json_file = 'workspace/violin_performance_practice_search.json' if os.path.exists(json_file): print('üìÑ INSPECTING SAVED JSON RESULTS:') print('=' * 50) with open(json_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print('JSON file structure:') for key in search_data.keys(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {key}: {type(search_data[key])}') if isinstance(search_data[key], list): print(f' - Length: {len(search_data[key])}') elif isinstance(search_data[key], dict): print(f' - Keys: {list(search_data[key].keys())}') print(f'\nSearch methods attempted: {len(search_data.get("search_methods", []))}') print(f'Total findings: {len(search_data.get("all_findings", []))}') print(f'Relevant books identified: {len(search_data.get("relevant_books", []))}') else: print('‚ùå JSON results file not found') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('PROPERLY FIXED MANUAL HTML FILE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) # Get list of all HTML files saved during the search workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f' {i}. {filename}') if len(workspace_files) > 10: print(f' ... and {len(workspace_files) - 10} more files') if not workspace_files: print('‚ùå No HTML files found to analyze') exit() print('\n=== DETAILED HTML CONTENT ANALYSIS (PROPERLY FIXED) ===') print('=' * 65) # Define search terms outside the loop violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance', 'german', 'school', 'thumb', 'pinkie', 'grip', 'hold'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'baroque', 'classical', 'romantic', 'period'] # Analyze each HTML file manually for violin-related content all_extracted_content = [] for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:8], 1): # Analyze first 8 files filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) print(f'\n--- ANALYZING FILE {i}: {filename} ---') try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'File size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract page title title = soup.find('title') if title: print(f'Page title: {title.get_text().strip()[:100]}...') # PROPERLY FIXED: Define page_text in correct scope before using it page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Count relevant terms - now page_text is properly defined violin_matches = 0 historical_matches = 0 for term in violin_terms: if term in page_text: violin_matches += 1 for term in historical_terms: if term in page_text: historical_matches += 1 print(f'Violin-related terms found: {violin_matches}/{len(violin_terms)}') print(f'Historical terms found: {historical_matches}/{len(historical_terms)}') if violin_matches > 0 or historical_matches > 0: print('üéª POTENTIAL CONTENT DETECTED - Extracting details...') # Find all links and their text links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_links = [] for link in links: link_text = link.get_text().strip() href = link.get('href') if len(link_text) > 10: text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for book-like titles or academic content book_indicators = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'technique', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] # Check for violin content violin_content = False matched_violin_terms = [] for term in violin_terms: if term in text_lower: violin_content = True matched_violin_terms.append(term) # Check for book indicators book_like = False matched_book_indicators = [] for indicator in book_indicators: if indicator in text_lower: book_like = True matched_book_indicators.append(indicator) if violin_content and (book_like or len(link_text) > 30): relevant_links.append({ 'text': link_text[:150], 'href': href, 'violin_terms': matched_violin_terms, 'book_indicators': matched_book_indicators }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:') for j, link in enumerate(relevant_links[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f' {j}. {link["text"]}...') print(f' Violin terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link["book_indicators"]}') print(f' URL: {link["href"][:80]}...') print() # Look for text snippets that might contain book information text_elements = soup.find_all(['p', 'div', 'span', 'h1', 'h2', 'h3']) relevant_snippets = [] for element in text_elements: text_content = element.get_text().strip() if len(text_content) > 50: text_lower = text_content.lower() # Check for multiple relevant terms matched_terms = [] for term in violin_terms + historical_terms: if term in text_lower: matched_terms.append(term) term_count = len(matched_terms) if term_count >= 3: relevant_snippets.append({ 'text': text_content[:200], 'term_count': term_count, 'matched_terms': matched_terms }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_snippets)} relevant text snippets:') for j, snippet in enumerate(relevant_snippets[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Terms ({snippet["term_count"]}): {snippet["matched_terms"]}') print(f' Text: {snippet["text"]}...') print() # Store findings for this file if relevant_links or relevant_snippets: source_type = 'general' # default if 'academic' in filename: source_type = 'academic' elif 'dissertation' in filename: source_type = 'dissertation' elif 'books' in filename: source_type = 'books' elif 'music' in filename: source_type = 'music' all_extracted_content.append({ 'filename': filename, 'source_type': source_type, 'violin_term_matches': violin_matches, 'historical_term_matches': historical_matches, 'relevant_links': relevant_links, 'relevant_snippets': relevant_snippets }) else: print('‚ùå No relevant content detected in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE MANUAL ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) print(f'Files with potential content: {len(all_extracted_content)}') if all_extracted_content: print('\nüìö DETAILED FINDINGS BY SOURCE TYPE:') print('-' * 50) # Group by source type by_source_type = {} for content in all_extracted_content: source_type = content['source_type'] if source_type not in by_source_type: by_source_type[source_type] = [] by_source_type[source_type].append(content) for source_type, contents in by_source_type.items(): print(f'\n{source_type.upper()} SOURCES ({len(contents)} files):') for content in contents: print(f'\n üìÑ {content["filename"]}:') print(f' Violin terms: {content["violin_term_matches"]}') print(f' Historical terms: {content["historical_term_matches"]}') print(f' Relevant links: {len(content["relevant_links"])}') print(f' Text snippets: {len(content["relevant_snippets"])}') # Show most promising links if content['relevant_links']: print(' Top links:') for i, link in enumerate(content['relevant_links'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {link["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link["book_indicators"]}') # Show most promising snippets if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Top snippets:') for i, snippet in enumerate(content['relevant_snippets'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {snippet["text"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {snippet["matched_terms"][:5]}') # Identify most promising sources overall print('\nüéØ MOST PROMISING SOURCES:') print('-' * 30) # Score each source by total relevance scored_sources = [] for content in all_extracted_content: score = (content['violin_term_matches'] * 2 + content['historical_term_matches'] + len(content['relevant_links']) * 3 + len(content['relevant_snippets']) * 2) scored_sources.append({ 'filename': content['filename'], 'score': score, 'content': content }) # Sort by score scored_sources.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(scored_sources[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {source["filename"]} (Score: {source["score"]})') content = source['content'] if content['relevant_links']: print(' Best link:') best_link = max(content['relevant_links'], key=lambda x: len(x['violin_terms']) + len(x['book_indicators'])) print(f' üìñ {best_link["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {best_link["violin_terms"]} + {best_link["book_indicators"]}') if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Best snippet:') best_snippet = max(content['relevant_snippets'], key=lambda x: x['term_count']) print(f' üìù {best_snippet["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms ({best_snippet["term_count"]}): {best_snippet["matched_terms"][:6]}') # Extract potential book titles and authors print('\nüìñ POTENTIAL BOOK TITLES EXTRACTED:') print('-' * 40) book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link in content['relevant_links']: if any(indicator in link['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']): book_candidates.append({ 'title': link['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link['book_indicators'] }) # Remove duplicates and show unique book candidates unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) print(f'Found {len(unique_books)} unique book candidates:') for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:10], 1): # Show top 10 print(f'\n{i}. "{book["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {book["source_file"]}') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {book["book_indicators"]}') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content found in any HTML files') print('\nPOSSIBLE REASONS:') print('1. Search engines returned mostly empty or blocked results') print('2. The topic is extremely specialized with very limited online presence') print('3. Relevant sources exist but use different terminology') print('4. Academic sources are behind paywalls and not indexed by search engines') print('5. HTML parsing may need different approaches for specific sites') # Save properly corrected manual analysis results manual_analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'files_analyzed': len(workspace_files), 'files_with_content': len(all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(c['relevant_links']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_snippets': sum(len(c['relevant_snippets']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'detailed_findings': all_extracted_content } # Add unique book candidates if they exist if all_extracted_content: # Recalculate unique_books for saving book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link in content['relevant_links']: if any(indicator in link['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']): book_candidates.append({ 'title': link['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link['book_indicators'] }) unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) manual_analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = unique_books else: manual_analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = [] with open('workspace/properly_fixed_html_analysis_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(manual_analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ PROPERLY FIXED ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace/properly_fixed_html_analysis_results.json') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('NEXT STEPS AND ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES') print('=' * 80) if all_extracted_content: print('\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found relevant content in HTML files!') print('\nRECOMMENDED ACTIONS:') print('1. üìñ Investigate the specific book candidates identified') print('2. üîó Follow the relevant links found in the HTML files') print('3. üìö Access full texts through academic libraries or publishers') print('4. üîç Use the extracted titles for more targeted searches') print('5. üìß Contact authors or institutions mentioned in the findings') else: print('\nüîÑ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGIES NEEDED:') print('\n1. üîÑ TERMINOLOGY ALTERNATIVES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ "bowing technique" instead of "bow hold"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "string technique" instead of "violin technique"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "historical performance practice" instead of "19th century performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "violin pedagogy" instead of "violin performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" comparison') print('\n2. üìö SPECIFIC PUBLISHER SEARCHES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Publications') print(' ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer') print(' ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition') print(' ‚Ä¢ B√§renreiter') print(' ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music') print('\n3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print(' ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print(' ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print(' ‚Ä¢ Dissertation Abstracts International') print('\n4. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL RESOURCES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Vienna Conservatory Archives') print('\n=== PROPERLY FIXED HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - Code encountered the same critical variable scoping error despite claiming to fix it. The script still fails with 'name 'page_text' is not defined' error on all 8 analyzed HTML files, preventing any content extraction from the 37 saved HTML files (ranging from 84K to 366K characters). Looking at the error traceback, the issue occurs at line 84 in a generator expression, suggesting the 'page_text' variable is being referenced outside its proper scope. **PLAN** alignment: 15% - setup worked but core functionality completely blocked. The code shows 'page_text = soup.get_text().lower()' was added after BeautifulSoup parsing, but the error indicates this line is either not executing or the variable is going out of scope. Critical fix needed: The 'page_text' variable definition needs to be moved outside the generator expression scope, or the violin/historical term counting logic needs to be restructured to ensure proper variable access. This bug is preventing analysis of potentially valuable content that was successfully downloaded in previous searches.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re import time print('=== PROPERLY FIXED HTML ANALYSIS FOR VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Correctly analyze saved HTML files with proper variable scoping\n') # First, inspect the JSON file structure to understand what was saved json_file = 'workspace/violin_performance_practice_search.json' if os.path.exists(json_file): print('üìÑ INSPECTING SAVED JSON RESULTS:') print('=' * 50) with open(json_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: search_data = json.load(f) print('JSON file structure:') for key in search_data.keys(): print(f' ‚Ä¢ {key}: {type(search_data[key])}') if isinstance(search_data[key], list): print(f' - Length: {len(search_data[key])}') elif isinstance(search_data[key], dict): print(f' - Keys: {list(search_data[key].keys())}') print(f'\nSearch methods attempted: {len(search_data.get("search_methods", []))}') print(f'Total findings: {len(search_data.get("all_findings", []))}') print(f'Relevant books identified: {len(search_data.get("relevant_books", []))}') else: print('‚ùå JSON results file not found') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('PROPERLY FIXED MANUAL HTML FILE ANALYSIS') print('=' * 80) # Get list of all HTML files saved during the search workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f' {i}. {filename}') if len(workspace_files) > 10: print(f' ... and {len(workspace_files) - 10} more files') if not workspace_files: print('‚ùå No HTML files found to analyze') exit() print('\n=== DETAILED HTML CONTENT ANALYSIS (PROPERLY FIXED) ===') print('=' * 65) # Define search terms outside the loop violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance', 'german', 'school', 'thumb', 'pinkie', 'grip', 'hold'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'baroque', 'classical', 'romantic', 'period'] # Analyze each HTML file manually for violin-related content all_extracted_content = [] for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:8], 1): # Analyze first 8 files filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) print(f'\n--- ANALYZING FILE {i}: {filename} ---') try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'File size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract page title title = soup.find('title') if title: print(f'Page title: {title.get_text().strip()[:100]}...') # PROPERLY FIXED: Define page_text in correct scope before using it page_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Count relevant terms - now page_text is properly defined violin_matches = 0 historical_matches = 0 for term in violin_terms: if term in page_text: violin_matches += 1 for term in historical_terms: if term in page_text: historical_matches += 1 print(f'Violin-related terms found: {violin_matches}/{len(violin_terms)}') print(f'Historical terms found: {historical_matches}/{len(historical_terms)}') if violin_matches > 0 or historical_matches > 0: print('üéª POTENTIAL CONTENT DETECTED - Extracting details...') # Find all links and their text links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_links = [] for link in links: link_text = link.get_text().strip() href = link.get('href') if len(link_text) > 10: text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for book-like titles or academic content book_indicators = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'technique', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] # Check for violin content violin_content = False matched_violin_terms = [] for term in violin_terms: if term in text_lower: violin_content = True matched_violin_terms.append(term) # Check for book indicators book_like = False matched_book_indicators = [] for indicator in book_indicators: if indicator in text_lower: book_like = True matched_book_indicators.append(indicator) if violin_content and (book_like or len(link_text) > 30): relevant_links.append({ 'text': link_text[:150], 'href': href, 'violin_terms': matched_violin_terms, 'book_indicators': matched_book_indicators }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:') for j, link in enumerate(relevant_links[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f' {j}. {link["text"]}...') print(f' Violin terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link["book_indicators"]}') print(f' URL: {link["href"][:80]}...') print() # Look for text snippets that might contain book information text_elements = soup.find_all(['p', 'div', 'span', 'h1', 'h2', 'h3']) relevant_snippets = [] for element in text_elements: text_content = element.get_text().strip() if len(text_content) > 50: text_lower = text_content.lower() # Check for multiple relevant terms matched_terms = [] for term in violin_terms + historical_terms: if term in text_lower: matched_terms.append(term) term_count = len(matched_terms) if term_count >= 3: relevant_snippets.append({ 'text': text_content[:200], 'term_count': term_count, 'matched_terms': matched_terms }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_snippets)} relevant text snippets:') for j, snippet in enumerate(relevant_snippets[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Terms ({snippet["term_count"]}): {snippet["matched_terms"]}') print(f' Text: {snippet["text"]}...') print() # Store findings for this file if relevant_links or relevant_snippets: source_type = 'general' # default if 'academic' in filename: source_type = 'academic' elif 'dissertation' in filename: source_type = 'dissertation' elif 'books' in filename: source_type = 'books' elif 'music' in filename: source_type = 'music' all_extracted_content.append({ 'filename': filename, 'source_type': source_type, 'violin_term_matches': violin_matches, 'historical_term_matches': historical_matches, 'relevant_links': relevant_links, 'relevant_snippets': relevant_snippets }) else: print('‚ùå No relevant content detected in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE MANUAL ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) print(f'Files with potential content: {len(all_extracted_content)}') if all_extracted_content: print('\nüìö DETAILED FINDINGS BY SOURCE TYPE:') print('-' * 50) # Group by source type by_source_type = {} for content in all_extracted_content: source_type = content['source_type'] if source_type not in by_source_type: by_source_type[source_type] = [] by_source_type[source_type].append(content) for source_type, contents in by_source_type.items(): print(f'\n{source_type.upper()} SOURCES ({len(contents)} files):') for content in contents: print(f'\n üìÑ {content["filename"]}:') print(f' Violin terms: {content["violin_term_matches"]}') print(f' Historical terms: {content["historical_term_matches"]}') print(f' Relevant links: {len(content["relevant_links"])}') print(f' Text snippets: {len(content["relevant_snippets"])}') # Show most promising links if content['relevant_links']: print(' Top links:') for i, link in enumerate(content['relevant_links'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {link["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link["book_indicators"]}') # Show most promising snippets if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Top snippets:') for i, snippet in enumerate(content['relevant_snippets'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {snippet["text"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {snippet["matched_terms"][:5]}') # Identify most promising sources overall print('\nüéØ MOST PROMISING SOURCES:') print('-' * 30) # Score each source by total relevance scored_sources = [] for content in all_extracted_content: score = (content['violin_term_matches'] * 2 + content['historical_term_matches'] + len(content['relevant_links']) * 3 + len(content['relevant_snippets']) * 2) scored_sources.append({ 'filename': content['filename'], 'score': score, 'content': content }) # Sort by score scored_sources.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(scored_sources[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {source["filename"]} (Score: {source["score"]})') content = source['content'] if content['relevant_links']: print(' Best link:') best_link = max(content['relevant_links'], key=lambda x: len(x['violin_terms']) + len(x['book_indicators'])) print(f' üìñ {best_link["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {best_link["violin_terms"]} + {best_link["book_indicators"]}') if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Best snippet:') best_snippet = max(content['relevant_snippets'], key=lambda x: x['term_count']) print(f' üìù {best_snippet["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms ({best_snippet["term_count"]}): {best_snippet["matched_terms"][:6]}') # Extract potential book titles and authors print('\nüìñ POTENTIAL BOOK TITLES EXTRACTED:') print('-' * 40) book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link in content['relevant_links']: if any(indicator in link['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']): book_candidates.append({ 'title': link['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link['book_indicators'] }) # Remove duplicates and show unique book candidates unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) print(f'Found {len(unique_books)} unique book candidates:') for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:10], 1): # Show top 10 print(f'\n{i}. "{book["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {book["source_file"]}') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {book["book_indicators"]}') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content found in any HTML files') print('\nPOSSIBLE REASONS:') print('1. Search engines returned mostly empty or blocked results') print('2. The topic is extremely specialized with very limited online presence') print('3. Relevant sources exist but use different terminology') print('4. Academic sources are behind paywalls and not indexed by search engines') print('5. HTML parsing may need different approaches for specific sites') # Save properly corrected manual analysis results manual_analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'files_analyzed': len(workspace_files), 'files_with_content': len(all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(c['relevant_links']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_snippets': sum(len(c['relevant_snippets']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'detailed_findings': all_extracted_content } # Add unique book candidates if they exist if all_extracted_content: # Recalculate unique_books for saving book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link in content['relevant_links']: if any(indicator in link['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']): book_candidates.append({ 'title': link['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link['book_indicators'] }) unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) manual_analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = unique_books else: manual_analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = [] with open('workspace/properly_fixed_html_analysis_results.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(manual_analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ PROPERLY FIXED ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace/properly_fixed_html_analysis_results.json') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('NEXT STEPS AND ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES') print('=' * 80) if all_extracted_content: print('\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found relevant content in HTML files!') print('\nRECOMMENDED ACTIONS:') print('1. üìñ Investigate the specific book candidates identified') print('2. üîó Follow the relevant links found in the HTML files') print('3. üìö Access full texts through academic libraries or publishers') print('4. üîç Use the extracted titles for more targeted searches') print('5. üìß Contact authors or institutions mentioned in the findings') else: print('\nüîÑ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGIES NEEDED:') print('\n1. üîÑ TERMINOLOGY ALTERNATIVES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ "bowing technique" instead of "bow hold"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "string technique" instead of "violin technique"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "historical performance practice" instead of "19th century performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "violin pedagogy" instead of "violin performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" comparison') print('\n2. üìö SPECIFIC PUBLISHER SEARCHES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Publications') print(' ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer') print(' ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition') print(' ‚Ä¢ B√§renreiter') print(' ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music') print('\n3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print(' ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print(' ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print(' ‚Ä¢ Dissertation Abstracts International') print('\n4. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL RESOURCES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Vienna Conservatory Archives') print('\n=== PROPERLY FIXED HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

Terms: ['violin', 'technique', 'performance'] + ['book', 'technique'] Best snippet: üìù ÁØ©ÈÅ∏Âô®Âíå‰∏ªÈ°åÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÂúñÁâáÂΩ±ÁâáÊñ∞ËÅûË≥ºÁâ©Êõ∏Á±çÂú∞ÂúñÊõ¥Â§öÈÅ∏È†ÖÊêúÂ∞ãÊ®°ÂºèLooking for results in English?Change to EnglishÁπºÁ∫å‰ΩøÁî® ÁπÅÈ´î‰∏≠ÊñáË™ûË®ÄË®≠ÂÆö ÊêúÂ∞ãÁµêÊûúViolin Technique and Perf... Terms (8): ['violin', 'string', 'technique', 'performance', '19th', 'historical'] üìñ POTENTIAL BOOK TITLES EXTRACTED: ---------------------------------------- Execution error: NameError: name 'link' is not defined Error/Warning: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/xushiyue.6/EvolAgent/src/utils/interpreter.py", line 367, in interpret_code exec(code, execution_globals, {}) # ‰ΩøÁî®Áã¨Á´ãÁöÑ locals ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 294, in <module> File "<string>", line 294, in <genexpr> NameError: name 'link' is not defined.
