2025-08-07 08:09:03
Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 5)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re import time print('=== FINAL WORKING HTML ANALYSIS FOR VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Successfully extract content from saved HTML files with proper implementation\n') # Get list of all HTML files saved during the search workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f' {i}. {filename}') if len(workspace_files) > 10: print(f' ... and {len(workspace_files) - 10} more files') if not workspace_files: print('‚ùå No HTML files found to analyze') exit() print('\n=== WORKING HTML CONTENT ANALYSIS ===') print('=' * 45) # Define search terms clearly violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance', 'german', 'school', 'thumb', 'pinkie', 'grip', 'hold'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'baroque', 'classical', 'romantic', 'period'] book_indicators = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'technique', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] # Storage for extracted content all_extracted_content = [] # Analyze each HTML file for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:8], 1): # Analyze first 8 files filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) print(f'\n--- ANALYZING FILE {i}: {filename} ---') try: # Read HTML file with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'File size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract page title title_elem = soup.find('title') page_title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' print(f'Page title: {page_title[:100]}...') # Get all text content and convert to lowercase for searching full_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Count violin-related terms violin_count = 0 found_violin_terms = [] for term in violin_terms: if term in full_text: violin_count += 1 found_violin_terms.append(term) # Count historical terms historical_count = 0 found_historical_terms = [] for term in historical_terms: if term in full_text: historical_count += 1 found_historical_terms.append(term) print(f'Violin-related terms found: {violin_count}/{len(violin_terms)} - {found_violin_terms}') print(f'Historical terms found: {historical_count}/{len(historical_terms)} - {found_historical_terms}') # If we found relevant terms, extract detailed information if violin_count > 0 or historical_count > 0: print('üéª RELEVANT CONTENT DETECTED - Extracting details...') # Extract relevant links relevant_links = [] all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link_elem in all_links: link_text = link_elem.get_text().strip() link_href = link_elem.get('href') if len(link_text) > 10: # Only consider substantial link text link_text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for violin terms in link link_violin_terms = [] for term in violin_terms: if term in link_text_lower: link_violin_terms.append(term) # Check for book indicators in link link_book_indicators = [] for indicator in book_indicators: if indicator in link_text_lower: link_book_indicators.append(indicator) # If link has violin content and either book indicators or is substantial if link_violin_terms and (link_book_indicators or len(link_text) > 30): relevant_links.append({ 'text': link_text[:150], 'href': link_href[:100], 'violin_terms': link_violin_terms, 'book_indicators': link_book_indicators }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:') for j, link_data in enumerate(relevant_links[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f' {j}. {link_data["text"]}...') print(f' Violin terms: {link_data["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link_data["book_indicators"]}') print(f' URL: {link_data["href"]}...') print() # Extract relevant text snippets relevant_snippets = [] text_elements = soup.find_all(['p', 'div', 'span', 'h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'li']) for element in text_elements: element_text = element.get_text().strip() if len(element_text) > 50: # Only consider substantial text element_text_lower = element_text.lower() # Count matching terms in this element element_matched_terms = [] for term in violin_terms + historical_terms: if term in element_text_lower: element_matched_terms.append(term) # If element has multiple relevant terms if len(element_matched_terms) >= 3: relevant_snippets.append({ 'text': element_text[:200], 'term_count': len(element_matched_terms), 'matched_terms': element_matched_terms }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_snippets)} relevant text snippets:') for j, snippet_data in enumerate(relevant_snippets[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Terms ({snippet_data["term_count"]}): {snippet_data["matched_terms"]}') print(f' Text: {snippet_data["text"]}...') print() # Determine source type source_type = 'general' # default if 'academic' in filename: source_type = 'academic' elif 'dissertation' in filename: source_type = 'dissertation' elif 'books' in filename: source_type = 'books' elif 'music' in filename: source_type = 'music' # Store findings for this file if we found anything if relevant_links or relevant_snippets: all_extracted_content.append({ 'filename': filename, 'source_type': source_type, 'page_title': page_title, 'violin_term_matches': violin_count, 'historical_term_matches': historical_count, 'found_violin_terms': found_violin_terms, 'found_historical_terms': found_historical_terms, 'relevant_links': relevant_links, 'relevant_snippets': relevant_snippets }) else: print('‚ùå No relevant content detected in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) print(f'Files with relevant content: {len(all_extracted_content)}') if all_extracted_content: print('\nüìö DETAILED FINDINGS BY SOURCE TYPE:') print('-' * 50) # Group by source type by_source_type = {} for content in all_extracted_content: source_type = content['source_type'] if source_type not in by_source_type: by_source_type[source_type] = [] by_source_type[source_type].append(content) for source_type, contents in by_source_type.items(): print(f'\n{source_type.upper()} SOURCES ({len(contents)} files):') for content in contents: print(f'\n üìÑ {content["filename"]}:') print(f' Page title: {content["page_title"][:80]}...') print(f' Violin terms ({content["violin_term_matches"]}): {content["found_violin_terms"]}') print(f' Historical terms ({content["historical_term_matches"]}): {content["found_historical_terms"]}') print(f' Relevant links: {len(content["relevant_links"])}') print(f' Text snippets: {len(content["relevant_snippets"])}') # Show most promising links if content['relevant_links']: print(' Top links:') for i, link_data in enumerate(content['relevant_links'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {link_data["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Violin terms: {link_data["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link_data["book_indicators"]}') # Show most promising snippets if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Top snippets:') for i, snippet_data in enumerate(content['relevant_snippets'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {snippet_data["text"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {snippet_data["matched_terms"][:5]}') # Score and rank sources print('\nüéØ MOST PROMISING SOURCES:') print('-' * 30) scored_sources = [] for content in all_extracted_content: score = (content['violin_term_matches'] * 2 + content['historical_term_matches'] + len(content['relevant_links']) * 3 + len(content['relevant_snippets']) * 2) scored_sources.append({ 'filename': content['filename'], 'score': score, 'content': content }) # Sort by score scored_sources.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(scored_sources[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {source["filename"]} (Score: {source["score"]})') content = source['content'] if content['relevant_links']: # Find best link best_link = None best_link_score = 0 for link_data in content['relevant_links']: link_score = len(link_data['violin_terms']) + len(link_data['book_indicators']) if link_score > best_link_score: best_link_score = link_score best_link = link_data if best_link: print(' Best link:') print(f' üìñ {best_link["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {best_link["violin_terms"]} + {best_link["book_indicators"]}') if content['relevant_snippets']: # Find best snippet best_snippet = max(content['relevant_snippets'], key=lambda x: x['term_count']) print(' Best snippet:') print(f' üìù {best_snippet["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms ({best_snippet["term_count"]}): {best_snippet["matched_terms"][:6]}') # Extract book candidates print('\nüìñ POTENTIAL BOOK TITLES EXTRACTED:') print('-' * 40) book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link_data in content['relevant_links']: # Check if link has book indicators has_book_indicator = any(indicator in link_data['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']) if has_book_indicator: book_candidates.append({ 'title': link_data['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link_data['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link_data['book_indicators'], 'url': link_data['href'] }) # Remove duplicates unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) print(f'Found {len(unique_books)} unique book candidates:') for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:10], 1): # Show top 10 print(f'\n{i}. "{book["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {book["source_file"]}') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {book["book_indicators"]}') print(f' URL: {book["url"]}...') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content found in any HTML files') print('\nPOSSIBLE REASONS:') print('1. Search engines returned mostly empty or blocked results') print('2. The topic is extremely specialized with very limited online presence') print('3. Relevant sources exist but use different terminology') print('4. Academic sources are behind paywalls and not indexed by search engines') # Save results analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'files_analyzed': len(workspace_files), 'files_with_content': len(all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(c['relevant_links']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_snippets': sum(len(c['relevant_snippets']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'detailed_findings': all_extracted_content } # Add book candidates if they exist if all_extracted_content: # Recalculate book candidates for saving book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link_data in content['relevant_links']: has_book_indicator = any(indicator in link_data['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']) if has_book_indicator: book_candidates.append({ 'title': link_data['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link_data['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link_data['book_indicators'], 'url': link_data['href'] }) unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = unique_books else: analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = [] with open('workspace/final_working_html_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace/final_working_html_analysis.json') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('NEXT STEPS AND RECOMMENDATIONS') print('=' * 80) if all_extracted_content: print('\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found relevant content in HTML files!') print('\nRECOMMENDED ACTIONS:') print('1. üìñ Investigate the specific book candidates identified') print('2. üîó Follow the relevant links found in the HTML files') print('3. üìö Access full texts through academic libraries or publishers') print('4. üîç Use the extracted titles for more targeted searches') print('5. üìß Contact authors or institutions mentioned in the findings') print('6. üéØ Focus on the highest-scoring sources for detailed investigation') else: print('\nüîÑ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGIES NEEDED:') print('\n1. üîÑ TERMINOLOGY ALTERNATIVES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ "bowing technique" instead of "bow hold"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "string technique" instead of "violin technique"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "historical performance practice" instead of "19th century performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "violin pedagogy" instead of "violin performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" comparison') print('\n2. üìö SPECIFIC PUBLISHER SEARCHES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Publications') print(' ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer') print(' ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition') print(' ‚Ä¢ B√§renreiter') print(' ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music') print('\n3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print(' ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print(' ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print(' ‚Ä¢ Dissertation Abstracts International') print('\n4. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL RESOURCES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Vienna Conservatory Archives') print('\n=== FINAL WORKING HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')

Êåâ‰∏ã / ‰æøÂèØË∑≥Ëá≥ÊêúÂ∞ãÊ°ÜRobin Stowell "Violin Technique and Performance Practice" Âà™Èô§È°ØÁ§∫Êõ¥Â§öÂà™Èô§È°ØÁ§∫Êõ¥Â§öËàâÂ†±‰∏çÁï∂ÁöÑÈ†êÊ∏¨ ... Terms: ['violin', 'technique', 'performance'] 2. Terms: ['violin', 'technique', 'performance'] + ['book', 'technique'] Best snippet: üìù ÁØ©ÈÅ∏Âô®Âíå‰∏ªÈ°åÂÖ®ÈÉ®ÂúñÁâáÂΩ±ÁâáÊñ∞ËÅûË≥ºÁâ©Êõ∏Á±çÂú∞ÂúñÊõ¥Â§öÈÅ∏È†ÖÊêúÂ∞ãÊ®°ÂºèLooking for results in English?Change to EnglishÁπºÁ∫å‰ΩøÁî® ÁπÅÈ´î‰∏≠ÊñáË™ûË®ÄË®≠ÂÆö ÊêúÂ∞ãÁµêÊûúViolin Technique and Perf... Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution partially successful - Code ran and completed the HTML analysis process, successfully extracting relevant content from 2 out of 8 analyzed HTML files. The script found violin-related content in 'google_books_search_1.html' (4 violin terms, 4 historical terms, 6 relevant links) and 'content_verification_search_4.html' (8 violin terms, 3 historical terms, 9 relevant links). However, the execution failed at the final book extraction step with 'NameError: name 'link' is not defined', preventing the complete list of potential book titles from being displayed. **PLAN** alignment: 75% - successfully identified relevant sources including books on violin technique and performance practice, German violin schools, and historical violin studies, but couldn't complete the final book candidate extraction. The analysis results were saved to 'workspace/properly_fixed_html_analysis_results.json'. Most promising findings include links to 'Violin Technique and Performance Practice', 'Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools', and Cambridge articles on German Classical School of Violin. Immediate fix needed: Replace the problematic generator expression in the book extraction section with explicit loops to avoid variable scoping issues, similar to how the main analysis was corrected.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import re import time print('=== FINAL WORKING HTML ANALYSIS FOR VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Successfully extract content from saved HTML files with proper implementation\n') # Get list of all HTML files saved during the search workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} HTML files to analyze:') for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:10], 1): # Show first 10 print(f' {i}. {filename}') if len(workspace_files) > 10: print(f' ... and {len(workspace_files) - 10} more files') if not workspace_files: print('‚ùå No HTML files found to analyze') exit() print('\n=== WORKING HTML CONTENT ANALYSIS ===') print('=' * 45) # Define search terms clearly violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance', 'german', 'school', 'thumb', 'pinkie', 'grip', 'hold'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'baroque', 'classical', 'romantic', 'period'] book_indicators = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'technique', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] # Storage for extracted content all_extracted_content = [] # Analyze each HTML file for i, filename in enumerate(workspace_files[:8], 1): # Analyze first 8 files filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) print(f'\n--- ANALYZING FILE {i}: {filename} ---') try: # Read HTML file with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'File size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract page title title_elem = soup.find('title') page_title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' print(f'Page title: {page_title[:100]}...') # Get all text content and convert to lowercase for searching full_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Count violin-related terms violin_count = 0 found_violin_terms = [] for term in violin_terms: if term in full_text: violin_count += 1 found_violin_terms.append(term) # Count historical terms historical_count = 0 found_historical_terms = [] for term in historical_terms: if term in full_text: historical_count += 1 found_historical_terms.append(term) print(f'Violin-related terms found: {violin_count}/{len(violin_terms)} - {found_violin_terms}') print(f'Historical terms found: {historical_count}/{len(historical_terms)} - {found_historical_terms}') # If we found relevant terms, extract detailed information if violin_count > 0 or historical_count > 0: print('üéª RELEVANT CONTENT DETECTED - Extracting details...') # Extract relevant links relevant_links = [] all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link_elem in all_links: link_text = link_elem.get_text().strip() link_href = link_elem.get('href') if len(link_text) > 10: # Only consider substantial link text link_text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for violin terms in link link_violin_terms = [] for term in violin_terms: if term in link_text_lower: link_violin_terms.append(term) # Check for book indicators in link link_book_indicators = [] for indicator in book_indicators: if indicator in link_text_lower: link_book_indicators.append(indicator) # If link has violin content and either book indicators or is substantial if link_violin_terms and (link_book_indicators or len(link_text) > 30): relevant_links.append({ 'text': link_text[:150], 'href': link_href[:100], 'violin_terms': link_violin_terms, 'book_indicators': link_book_indicators }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:') for j, link_data in enumerate(relevant_links[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f' {j}. {link_data["text"]}...') print(f' Violin terms: {link_data["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link_data["book_indicators"]}') print(f' URL: {link_data["href"]}...') print() # Extract relevant text snippets relevant_snippets = [] text_elements = soup.find_all(['p', 'div', 'span', 'h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'li']) for element in text_elements: element_text = element.get_text().strip() if len(element_text) > 50: # Only consider substantial text element_text_lower = element_text.lower() # Count matching terms in this element element_matched_terms = [] for term in violin_terms + historical_terms: if term in element_text_lower: element_matched_terms.append(term) # If element has multiple relevant terms if len(element_matched_terms) >= 3: relevant_snippets.append({ 'text': element_text[:200], 'term_count': len(element_matched_terms), 'matched_terms': element_matched_terms }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_snippets)} relevant text snippets:') for j, snippet_data in enumerate(relevant_snippets[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Terms ({snippet_data["term_count"]}): {snippet_data["matched_terms"]}') print(f' Text: {snippet_data["text"]}...') print() # Determine source type source_type = 'general' # default if 'academic' in filename: source_type = 'academic' elif 'dissertation' in filename: source_type = 'dissertation' elif 'books' in filename: source_type = 'books' elif 'music' in filename: source_type = 'music' # Store findings for this file if we found anything if relevant_links or relevant_snippets: all_extracted_content.append({ 'filename': filename, 'source_type': source_type, 'page_title': page_title, 'violin_term_matches': violin_count, 'historical_term_matches': historical_count, 'found_violin_terms': found_violin_terms, 'found_historical_terms': found_historical_terms, 'relevant_links': relevant_links, 'relevant_snippets': relevant_snippets }) else: print('‚ùå No relevant content detected in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) print(f'Files with relevant content: {len(all_extracted_content)}') if all_extracted_content: print('\nüìö DETAILED FINDINGS BY SOURCE TYPE:') print('-' * 50) # Group by source type by_source_type = {} for content in all_extracted_content: source_type = content['source_type'] if source_type not in by_source_type: by_source_type[source_type] = [] by_source_type[source_type].append(content) for source_type, contents in by_source_type.items(): print(f'\n{source_type.upper()} SOURCES ({len(contents)} files):') for content in contents: print(f'\n üìÑ {content["filename"]}:') print(f' Page title: {content["page_title"][:80]}...') print(f' Violin terms ({content["violin_term_matches"]}): {content["found_violin_terms"]}') print(f' Historical terms ({content["historical_term_matches"]}): {content["found_historical_terms"]}') print(f' Relevant links: {len(content["relevant_links"])}') print(f' Text snippets: {len(content["relevant_snippets"])}') # Show most promising links if content['relevant_links']: print(' Top links:') for i, link_data in enumerate(content['relevant_links'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {link_data["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Violin terms: {link_data["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {link_data["book_indicators"]}') # Show most promising snippets if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Top snippets:') for i, snippet_data in enumerate(content['relevant_snippets'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {snippet_data["text"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {snippet_data["matched_terms"][:5]}') # Score and rank sources print('\nüéØ MOST PROMISING SOURCES:') print('-' * 30) scored_sources = [] for content in all_extracted_content: score = (content['violin_term_matches'] * 2 + content['historical_term_matches'] + len(content['relevant_links']) * 3 + len(content['relevant_snippets']) * 2) scored_sources.append({ 'filename': content['filename'], 'score': score, 'content': content }) # Sort by score scored_sources.sort(key=lambda x: x['score'], reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(scored_sources[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. {source["filename"]} (Score: {source["score"]})') content = source['content'] if content['relevant_links']: # Find best link best_link = None best_link_score = 0 for link_data in content['relevant_links']: link_score = len(link_data['violin_terms']) + len(link_data['book_indicators']) if link_score > best_link_score: best_link_score = link_score best_link = link_data if best_link: print(' Best link:') print(f' üìñ {best_link["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms: {best_link["violin_terms"]} + {best_link["book_indicators"]}') if content['relevant_snippets']: # Find best snippet best_snippet = max(content['relevant_snippets'], key=lambda x: x['term_count']) print(' Best snippet:') print(f' üìù {best_snippet["text"][:120]}...') print(f' Terms ({best_snippet["term_count"]}): {best_snippet["matched_terms"][:6]}') # Extract book candidates print('\nüìñ POTENTIAL BOOK TITLES EXTRACTED:') print('-' * 40) book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link_data in content['relevant_links']: # Check if link has book indicators has_book_indicator = any(indicator in link_data['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']) if has_book_indicator: book_candidates.append({ 'title': link_data['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link_data['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link_data['book_indicators'], 'url': link_data['href'] }) # Remove duplicates unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) print(f'Found {len(unique_books)} unique book candidates:') for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:10], 1): # Show top 10 print(f'\n{i}. "{book["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {book["source_file"]}') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book indicators: {book["book_indicators"]}') print(f' URL: {book["url"]}...') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content found in any HTML files') print('\nPOSSIBLE REASONS:') print('1. Search engines returned mostly empty or blocked results') print('2. The topic is extremely specialized with very limited online presence') print('3. Relevant sources exist but use different terminology') print('4. Academic sources are behind paywalls and not indexed by search engines') # Save results analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'files_analyzed': len(workspace_files), 'files_with_content': len(all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(c['relevant_links']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_snippets': sum(len(c['relevant_snippets']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'detailed_findings': all_extracted_content } # Add book candidates if they exist if all_extracted_content: # Recalculate book candidates for saving book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link_data in content['relevant_links']: has_book_indicator = any(indicator in link_data['book_indicators'] for indicator in ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'guide']) if has_book_indicator: book_candidates.append({ 'title': link_data['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link_data['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link_data['book_indicators'], 'url': link_data['href'] }) unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:50].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = unique_books else: analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = [] with open('workspace/final_working_html_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ FINAL ANALYSIS RESULTS SAVED TO: workspace/final_working_html_analysis.json') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('NEXT STEPS AND RECOMMENDATIONS') print('=' * 80) if all_extracted_content: print('\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found relevant content in HTML files!') print('\nRECOMMENDED ACTIONS:') print('1. üìñ Investigate the specific book candidates identified') print('2. üîó Follow the relevant links found in the HTML files') print('3. üìö Access full texts through academic libraries or publishers') print('4. üîç Use the extracted titles for more targeted searches') print('5. üìß Contact authors or institutions mentioned in the findings') print('6. üéØ Focus on the highest-scoring sources for detailed investigation') else: print('\nüîÑ ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGIES NEEDED:') print('\n1. üîÑ TERMINOLOGY ALTERNATIVES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ "bowing technique" instead of "bow hold"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "string technique" instead of "violin technique"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "historical performance practice" instead of "19th century performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "violin pedagogy" instead of "violin performance"') print(' ‚Ä¢ "Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" comparison') print('\n2. üìö SPECIFIC PUBLISHER SEARCHES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Publications') print(' ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer') print(' ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition') print(' ‚Ä¢ B√§renreiter') print(' ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music') print('\n3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print(' ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print(' ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print(' ‚Ä¢ Dissertation Abstracts International') print('\n4. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL RESOURCES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Vienna Conservatory Archives') print('\n=== FINAL WORKING HTML ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===')

Code Execution - Plan #3 (Iteration 6)

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import requests import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH FOR ALTERNATIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Search for specialized books on 19th-century violin techniques with focus on German school and vibrato practices\n') # Based on the successful HTML analysis that found relevant sources, let's expand the search # First, let's check what we found in the previous analysis analysis_file = 'workspace/final_working_html_analysis.json' if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print('üìÑ REVIEWING PREVIOUS ANALYSIS RESULTS:') print('=' * 50) with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: previous_results = json.load(f) print(f'Previous analysis found:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files with content: {previous_results.get("files_with_content", 0)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant links: {previous_results.get("total_relevant_links", 0)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total text snippets: {previous_results.get("total_relevant_snippets", 0)}') # Extract the most promising findings if 'detailed_findings' in previous_results: print('\nüéØ KEY FINDINGS FROM PREVIOUS ANALYSIS:') for finding in previous_results['detailed_findings']: print(f'\n üìÑ {finding["filename"]}:') print(f' Violin terms found: {finding["found_violin_terms"]}') print(f' Historical terms: {finding["found_historical_terms"]}') print(f' Links found: {len(finding["relevant_links"])}') # Show top links if finding['relevant_links']: print(' Key links:') for i, link in enumerate(finding['relevant_links'][:3], 1): print(f' {i}. {link["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') if 'url' in link: print(f' URL: {link["url"][:60]}...') else: print('‚ùå Previous analysis file not found') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('TARGETED SEARCH FOR SPECIALIZED VIOLIN PEDAGOGY SOURCES') print('=' * 80) # Based on the successful findings, let's search for more specific sources # Focus on the terminology and sources that showed promise # Enhanced search terms based on successful findings specialized_queries = [ # Academic and historical sources '"violin pedagogy" "German school" "bow hold" 19th century', '"historical violin technique" "vibrato" "national schools" comparison', '"bowing technique" "bent thumb" "curved pinkie" violin method', '"Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" violin technique', '"violin performance practice" "repertoire influence" vibrato usage', # Specific publisher and academic sources 'site:cambridge.org "violin technique" "German school" "bow grip"', 'site:oxford.org "historical violin performance" "bowing technique"', 'site:jstor.org "violin pedagogy" "19th century" "national schools"', # Book-specific searches '"Robin Stowell" "Violin Technique and Performance Practice" alternatives', '"Carl Flesch" "Art of Violin Playing" German school technique', '"Ivan Galamian" violin method bow hold technique analysis', # Dissertation and thesis searches 'dissertation "violin bow hold" "German school" "bent thumb"', 'thesis "violin vibrato" "repertoire influence" "national schools"', 'PhD "historical violin performance" "19th century" technique' ] print(f'Conducting {len(specialized_queries)} targeted searches...\n') # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } # Storage for all search results all_search_results = { 'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find alternative books on 19th-century violin performance practices', 'focus_areas': [ 'German school violin techniques', 'Vibrato usage influenced by repertoire vs national schools', 'Bow hold techniques (bent thumb, curved pinkie)' ], 'search_queries': specialized_queries, 'search_methods': [], 'all_findings': [], 'book_candidates': [], 'academic_sources': [] } # Conduct targeted searches for i, query in enumerate(specialized_queries[:10], 1): # Limit to first 10 queries print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Use Google search search_url = f'https://www.google.com/search?q={quote_plus(query)}' print(f'URL: {search_url[:100]}...') response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save HTML for later analysis filename = f'specialized_search_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Quick analysis of results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links and titles result_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_results = [] for link in result_links: link_text = link.get_text().strip() href = link.get('href') if len(link_text) > 20 and href: text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for violin-related content violin_terms = ['violin', 'bow', 'technique', 'performance', 'school', 'method'] book_terms = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'guide', 'manual', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] violin_matches = [term for term in violin_terms if term in text_lower] book_matches = [term for term in book_terms if term in text_lower] if violin_matches and (book_matches or len(link_text) > 40): relevant_results.append({ 'text': link_text[:150], 'href': href, 'violin_terms': violin_matches, 'book_terms': book_matches, 'query': query }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_results)} relevant results') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. {result["text"]}...') print(f' Terms: {result["violin_terms"]} + {result["book_terms"]}') # Store results all_search_results['all_findings'].extend(relevant_results) all_search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Google search {i}: {query} - Status {response.status_code}') else: print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}') all_search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Google search {i}: {query} - FAILED {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') all_search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Google search {i}: {query} - ERROR {str(e)}') print() time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting print('=' * 80) print('ANALYSIS OF SEARCH RESULTS') print('=' * 80) total_findings = len(all_search_results['all_findings']) print(f'Total findings collected: {total_findings}') print(f'Search methods attempted: {len(all_search_results["search_methods"])}') if total_findings > 0: print('\nüìö CATEGORIZING FINDINGS:') print('-' * 40) # Categorize findings book_candidates = [] academic_sources = [] dissertation_sources = [] for finding in all_search_results['all_findings']: text_lower = finding['text'].lower() # Categorize by type if any(term in text_lower for term in ['book', 'manual', 'guide', 'method']): book_candidates.append(finding) elif any(term in text_lower for term in ['dissertation', 'thesis', 'phd']): dissertation_sources.append(finding) elif any(term in text_lower for term in ['journal', 'article', 'study', 'analysis']): academic_sources.append(finding) print(f'Book candidates: {len(book_candidates)}') print(f'Academic sources: {len(academic_sources)}') print(f'Dissertation sources: {len(dissertation_sources)}') # Show top book candidates if book_candidates: print('\nüìñ TOP BOOK CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 30) # Sort by relevance (number of matching terms) book_candidates.sort(key=lambda x: len(x['violin_terms']) + len(x['book_terms']), reverse=True) for i, book in enumerate(book_candidates[:10], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{book["text"]}"') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book terms: {book["book_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {book["query"][:50]}...') print(f' URL: {book["href"][:80]}...') all_search_results['book_candidates'] = book_candidates # Show top academic sources if academic_sources: print('\nüéì TOP ACADEMIC SOURCES:') print('-' * 25) academic_sources.sort(key=lambda x: len(x['violin_terms']), reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(academic_sources[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{source["text"]}"') print(f' Violin terms: {source["violin_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {source["query"][:50]}...') print(f' URL: {source["href"][:80]}...') all_search_results['academic_sources'] = academic_sources # Show dissertation sources if dissertation_sources: print('\nüìã DISSERTATION SOURCES:') print('-' * 22) for i, diss in enumerate(dissertation_sources[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{diss["text"]}"') print(f' Violin terms: {diss["violin_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {diss["query"][:50]}...') print(f' URL: {diss["href"][:80]}...') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant findings collected') print('\nPOSSIBLE REASONS:') print('1. Search engines are blocking automated requests') print('2. The topic is extremely specialized with limited online presence') print('3. Sources exist but use different terminology') print('4. Academic sources are behind paywalls') # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'specialized_violin_book_search.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(all_search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FURTHER RESEARCH') print('=' * 80) if total_findings > 0: print('\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found relevant sources!') print('\nNEXT STEPS:') print('1. üìñ Investigate the specific book candidates identified') print('2. üîó Access full texts through academic libraries') print('3. üìö Contact publishers for availability of specialized texts') print('4. üéì Review academic articles for additional references') print('5. üìã Follow up on dissertation sources for comprehensive coverage') if book_candidates: print('\nüéØ PRIORITY BOOKS TO INVESTIGATE:') for i, book in enumerate(book_candidates[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. {book["text"][:80]}...') else: print('\nüîÑ ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES:') print('\n1. üìö DIRECT PUBLISHER CONTACT:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music Division') print(' ‚Ä¢ Cambridge University Press') print(' ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer/Hal Leonard') print(' ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Music') print(' ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition') print('\n2. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL LIBRARIES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Vienna University of Music Library') print('\n3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print(' ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print(' ‚Ä¢ ProQuest Dissertations & Theses Global') print(' ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print('\n4. üë• EXPERT CONSULTATION:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Contact violin pedagogy professors') print(' ‚Ä¢ Reach out to historical performance specialists') print(' ‚Ä¢ Consult with music librarians at major conservatories') print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOK SEARCH COMPLETE ===')
Execution Output

Execution failed - Code encountered a critical error during the specialized search execution that prevented any meaningful content extraction from the 10 attempted searches. The script successfully started the comprehensive search process and attempted 10 targeted Google searches with specialized queries (violin pedagogy German school, historical violin technique, bowing technique, etc.), but all searches returned 0 relevant results despite receiving HTTP 200 status codes and saving HTML files to the workspace. The searches covered important areas like German school techniques, vibrato usage, bow hold methods, and academic sources from Cambridge/Oxford/JSTOR, but the parsing logic failed to extract any violin-related content from the downloaded HTML files (ranging from 84K to 366K characters). **PLAN** alignment: 30% - search infrastructure worked and HTML files were saved, but core content extraction completely failed. The code did save comprehensive results to 'workspace/specialized_violin_book_search.json' and provided excellent alternative search recommendations. However, based on HISTORY showing that previous HTML analysis attempts found relevant content in files like 'google_books_search_1.html' and 'content_verification_search_4.html', this suggests the current search may have encountered different HTML structures or the content extraction logic needs refinement. Recommendation: Save the lengthy output to a file for detailed review and consider using the successful HTML analysis approach from HISTORY to process the newly downloaded search results.
Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import requests import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH FOR ALTERNATIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Search for specialized books on 19th-century violin techniques with focus on German school and vibrato practices\n') # Based on the successful HTML analysis that found relevant sources, let's expand the search # First, let's check what we found in the previous analysis analysis_file = 'workspace/final_working_html_analysis.json' if os.path.exists(analysis_file): print('üìÑ REVIEWING PREVIOUS ANALYSIS RESULTS:') print('=' * 50) with open(analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: previous_results = json.load(f) print(f'Previous analysis found:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files with content: {previous_results.get("files_with_content", 0)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total relevant links: {previous_results.get("total_relevant_links", 0)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total text snippets: {previous_results.get("total_relevant_snippets", 0)}') # Extract the most promising findings if 'detailed_findings' in previous_results: print('\nüéØ KEY FINDINGS FROM PREVIOUS ANALYSIS:') for finding in previous_results['detailed_findings']: print(f'\n üìÑ {finding["filename"]}:') print(f' Violin terms found: {finding["found_violin_terms"]}') print(f' Historical terms: {finding["found_historical_terms"]}') print(f' Links found: {len(finding["relevant_links"])}') # Show top links if finding['relevant_links']: print(' Key links:') for i, link in enumerate(finding['relevant_links'][:3], 1): print(f' {i}. {link["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Terms: {link["violin_terms"]}') if 'url' in link: print(f' URL: {link["url"][:60]}...') else: print('‚ùå Previous analysis file not found') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('TARGETED SEARCH FOR SPECIALIZED VIOLIN PEDAGOGY SOURCES') print('=' * 80) # Based on the successful findings, let's search for more specific sources # Focus on the terminology and sources that showed promise # Enhanced search terms based on successful findings specialized_queries = [ # Academic and historical sources '"violin pedagogy" "German school" "bow hold" 19th century', '"historical violin technique" "vibrato" "national schools" comparison', '"bowing technique" "bent thumb" "curved pinkie" violin method', '"Franco-Belgian school" vs "German school" violin technique', '"violin performance practice" "repertoire influence" vibrato usage', # Specific publisher and academic sources 'site:cambridge.org "violin technique" "German school" "bow grip"', 'site:oxford.org "historical violin performance" "bowing technique"', 'site:jstor.org "violin pedagogy" "19th century" "national schools"', # Book-specific searches '"Robin Stowell" "Violin Technique and Performance Practice" alternatives', '"Carl Flesch" "Art of Violin Playing" German school technique', '"Ivan Galamian" violin method bow hold technique analysis', # Dissertation and thesis searches 'dissertation "violin bow hold" "German school" "bent thumb"', 'thesis "violin vibrato" "repertoire influence" "national schools"', 'PhD "historical violin performance" "19th century" technique' ] print(f'Conducting {len(specialized_queries)} targeted searches...\n') # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive' } # Storage for all search results all_search_results = { 'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find alternative books on 19th-century violin performance practices', 'focus_areas': [ 'German school violin techniques', 'Vibrato usage influenced by repertoire vs national schools', 'Bow hold techniques (bent thumb, curved pinkie)' ], 'search_queries': specialized_queries, 'search_methods': [], 'all_findings': [], 'book_candidates': [], 'academic_sources': [] } # Conduct targeted searches for i, query in enumerate(specialized_queries[:10], 1): # Limit to first 10 queries print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Use Google search search_url = f'https://www.google.com/search?q={quote_plus(query)}' print(f'URL: {search_url[:100]}...') response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save HTML for later analysis filename = f'specialized_search_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath}') # Quick analysis of results soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Look for result links and titles result_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) relevant_results = [] for link in result_links: link_text = link.get_text().strip() href = link.get('href') if len(link_text) > 20 and href: text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for violin-related content violin_terms = ['violin', 'bow', 'technique', 'performance', 'school', 'method'] book_terms = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'guide', 'manual', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] violin_matches = [term for term in violin_terms if term in text_lower] book_matches = [term for term in book_terms if term in text_lower] if violin_matches and (book_matches or len(link_text) > 40): relevant_results.append({ 'text': link_text[:150], 'href': href, 'violin_terms': violin_matches, 'book_terms': book_matches, 'query': query }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_results)} relevant results') for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. {result["text"]}...') print(f' Terms: {result["violin_terms"]} + {result["book_terms"]}') # Store results all_search_results['all_findings'].extend(relevant_results) all_search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Google search {i}: {query} - Status {response.status_code}') else: print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}') all_search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Google search {i}: {query} - FAILED {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') all_search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Google search {i}: {query} - ERROR {str(e)}') print() time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting print('=' * 80) print('ANALYSIS OF SEARCH RESULTS') print('=' * 80) total_findings = len(all_search_results['all_findings']) print(f'Total findings collected: {total_findings}') print(f'Search methods attempted: {len(all_search_results["search_methods"])}') if total_findings > 0: print('\nüìö CATEGORIZING FINDINGS:') print('-' * 40) # Categorize findings book_candidates = [] academic_sources = [] dissertation_sources = [] for finding in all_search_results['all_findings']: text_lower = finding['text'].lower() # Categorize by type if any(term in text_lower for term in ['book', 'manual', 'guide', 'method']): book_candidates.append(finding) elif any(term in text_lower for term in ['dissertation', 'thesis', 'phd']): dissertation_sources.append(finding) elif any(term in text_lower for term in ['journal', 'article', 'study', 'analysis']): academic_sources.append(finding) print(f'Book candidates: {len(book_candidates)}') print(f'Academic sources: {len(academic_sources)}') print(f'Dissertation sources: {len(dissertation_sources)}') # Show top book candidates if book_candidates: print('\nüìñ TOP BOOK CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 30) # Sort by relevance (number of matching terms) book_candidates.sort(key=lambda x: len(x['violin_terms']) + len(x['book_terms']), reverse=True) for i, book in enumerate(book_candidates[:10], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{book["text"]}"') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' Book terms: {book["book_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {book["query"][:50]}...') print(f' URL: {book["href"][:80]}...') all_search_results['book_candidates'] = book_candidates # Show top academic sources if academic_sources: print('\nüéì TOP ACADEMIC SOURCES:') print('-' * 25) academic_sources.sort(key=lambda x: len(x['violin_terms']), reverse=True) for i, source in enumerate(academic_sources[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{source["text"]}"') print(f' Violin terms: {source["violin_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {source["query"][:50]}...') print(f' URL: {source["href"][:80]}...') all_search_results['academic_sources'] = academic_sources # Show dissertation sources if dissertation_sources: print('\nüìã DISSERTATION SOURCES:') print('-' * 22) for i, diss in enumerate(dissertation_sources[:3], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{diss["text"]}"') print(f' Violin terms: {diss["violin_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {diss["query"][:50]}...') print(f' URL: {diss["href"][:80]}...') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant findings collected') print('\nPOSSIBLE REASONS:') print('1. Search engines are blocking automated requests') print('2. The topic is extremely specialized with limited online presence') print('3. Sources exist but use different terminology') print('4. Academic sources are behind paywalls') # Save comprehensive results results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'specialized_violin_book_search.json') with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(all_search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FURTHER RESEARCH') print('=' * 80) if total_findings > 0: print('\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found relevant sources!') print('\nNEXT STEPS:') print('1. üìñ Investigate the specific book candidates identified') print('2. üîó Access full texts through academic libraries') print('3. üìö Contact publishers for availability of specialized texts') print('4. üéì Review academic articles for additional references') print('5. üìã Follow up on dissertation sources for comprehensive coverage') if book_candidates: print('\nüéØ PRIORITY BOOKS TO INVESTIGATE:') for i, book in enumerate(book_candidates[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. {book["text"][:80]}...') else: print('\nüîÑ ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES:') print('\n1. üìö DIRECT PUBLISHER CONTACT:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press Music Division') print(' ‚Ä¢ Cambridge University Press') print(' ‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer/Hal Leonard') print(' ‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Music') print(' ‚Ä¢ Peters Edition') print('\n2. üèõÔ∏è INSTITUTIONAL LIBRARIES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library') print(' ‚Ä¢ Vienna University of Music Library') print('\n3. üéì SPECIALIZED DATABASES:') print(' ‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print(' ‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print(' ‚Ä¢ ProQuest Dissertations & Theses Global') print(' ‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print('\n4. üë• EXPERT CONSULTATION:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Contact violin pedagogy professors') print(' ‚Ä¢ Reach out to historical performance specialists') print(' ‚Ä¢ Consult with music librarians at major conservatories') print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOK SEARCH COMPLETE ===')

import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import time print('=== ANALYZING NEWLY DOWNLOADED SPECIALIZED VIOLIN SEARCH FILES ===') print('Objective: Apply successful HTML analysis method to recently downloaded specialized search results\n') # First, inspect what files we have in workspace workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): if filename.endswith('.html'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} HTML files in workspace:') # Separate the newly downloaded specialized search files specialized_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'specialized_search_' in f] other_files = [f for f in workspace_files if 'specialized_search_' not in f] print(f'\nSpecialized search files: {len(specialized_files)}') for i, filename in enumerate(specialized_files, 1): print(f' {i}. {filename}') print(f'\nOther HTML files: {len(other_files)}') for i, filename in enumerate(other_files[:5], 1): # Show first 5 print(f' {i}. {filename}') if len(other_files) > 5: print(f' ... and {len(other_files) - 5} more files') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('DETAILED ANALYSIS OF SPECIALIZED SEARCH FILES') print('=' * 80) # Define comprehensive search terms for violin performance practice violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance', 'german', 'school', 'thumb', 'pinkie', 'grip', 'hold', 'pedagogy', 'method'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'baroque', 'classical', 'romantic', 'period', 'franco-belgian'] book_indicators = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'method', 'technique', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'handbook', 'encyclopedia'] # Storage for extracted content all_extracted_content = [] # Analyze each specialized search file for i, filename in enumerate(specialized_files[:10], 1): # Analyze up to 10 files filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) print(f'\n--- ANALYZING SPECIALIZED FILE {i}: {filename} ---') try: # Read HTML file with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() print(f'File size: {len(html_content):,} characters') # Parse with BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') # Extract page title title_elem = soup.find('title') page_title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' print(f'Page title: {page_title[:100]}...') # Get all text content and convert to lowercase for searching full_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Count violin-related terms violin_count = 0 found_violin_terms = [] for term in violin_terms: if term in full_text: violin_count += 1 found_violin_terms.append(term) # Count historical terms historical_count = 0 found_historical_terms = [] for term in historical_terms: if term in full_text: historical_count += 1 found_historical_terms.append(term) print(f'Violin-related terms found: {violin_count}/{len(violin_terms)} - {found_violin_terms[:8]}') print(f'Historical terms found: {historical_count}/{len(historical_terms)} - {found_historical_terms}') # If we found relevant terms, extract detailed information if violin_count > 0 or historical_count > 0: print('üéª RELEVANT CONTENT DETECTED - Extracting details...') # Extract relevant links with more comprehensive search relevant_links = [] all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) print(f'Total links found: {len(all_links)}') for link_elem in all_links: link_text = link_elem.get_text().strip() link_href = link_elem.get('href') if len(link_text) > 15: # Consider links with substantial text link_text_lower = link_text.lower() # Check for violin terms in link link_violin_terms = [] for term in violin_terms: if term in link_text_lower: link_violin_terms.append(term) # Check for book indicators in link link_book_indicators = [] for indicator in book_indicators: if indicator in link_text_lower: link_book_indicators.append(indicator) # Check for historical terms link_historical_terms = [] for term in historical_terms: if term in link_text_lower: link_historical_terms.append(term) # If link has violin content or book indicators if link_violin_terms or link_book_indicators or (link_historical_terms and len(link_text) > 25): relevant_links.append({ 'text': link_text[:200], 'href': link_href[:150] if link_href else '', 'violin_terms': link_violin_terms, 'book_indicators': link_book_indicators, 'historical_terms': link_historical_terms }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_links)} potentially relevant links:') for j, link_data in enumerate(relevant_links[:5], 1): # Show top 5 print(f' {j}. {link_data["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Violin: {link_data["violin_terms"][:3]}') print(f' Books: {link_data["book_indicators"][:3]}') print(f' Historical: {link_data["historical_terms"][:3]}') if link_data['href'] and not link_data['href'].startswith('/'): print(f' URL: {link_data["href"][:60]}...') print() # Extract relevant text snippets with broader criteria relevant_snippets = [] text_elements = soup.find_all(['p', 'div', 'span', 'h1', 'h2', 'h3', 'h4', 'li', 'td']) for element in text_elements: element_text = element.get_text().strip() if len(element_text) > 30: # Consider substantial text element_text_lower = element_text.lower() # Count matching terms in this element element_matched_terms = [] for term in violin_terms + historical_terms + book_indicators: if term in element_text_lower: element_matched_terms.append(term) # If element has multiple relevant terms or specific key combinations if (len(element_matched_terms) >= 2 or ('violin' in element_text_lower and any(term in element_text_lower for term in ['german', 'school', 'technique', 'bow']))): relevant_snippets.append({ 'text': element_text[:300], 'term_count': len(element_matched_terms), 'matched_terms': element_matched_terms }) print(f'Found {len(relevant_snippets)} relevant text snippets:') for j, snippet_data in enumerate(relevant_snippets[:3], 1): # Show top 3 print(f' {j}. Terms ({snippet_data["term_count"]}): {snippet_data["matched_terms"][:6]}') print(f' Text: {snippet_data["text"][:120]}...') print() # Store findings for this file if we found anything if relevant_links or relevant_snippets: all_extracted_content.append({ 'filename': filename, 'source_type': 'specialized_search', 'page_title': page_title, 'violin_term_matches': violin_count, 'historical_term_matches': historical_count, 'found_violin_terms': found_violin_terms, 'found_historical_terms': found_historical_terms, 'relevant_links': relevant_links, 'relevant_snippets': relevant_snippets }) else: print('‚ùå No relevant content detected in this file') except Exception as e: print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}') import traceback traceback.print_exc() print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS') print('=' * 80) print(f'Specialized files with relevant content: {len(all_extracted_content)}') if all_extracted_content: print('\nüìö DETAILED FINDINGS FROM SPECIALIZED SEARCHES:') print('-' * 55) for content in all_extracted_content: print(f'\nüìÑ {content["filename"]}:') print(f' Page title: {content["page_title"][:80]}...') print(f' Violin terms ({content["violin_term_matches"]}): {content["found_violin_terms"][:8]}') print(f' Historical terms ({content["historical_term_matches"]}): {content["found_historical_terms"]}') print(f' Relevant links: {len(content["relevant_links"])}') print(f' Text snippets: {len(content["relevant_snippets"])}') # Show most promising links if content['relevant_links']: print(' Top links:') for i, link_data in enumerate(content['relevant_links'][:3], 1): print(f' {i}. {link_data["text"][:70]}...') print(f' Violin: {link_data["violin_terms"][:3]}') print(f' Books: {link_data["book_indicators"][:3]}') if link_data['href'] and 'http' in link_data['href']: print(f' URL: {link_data["href"][:50]}...') # Show most promising snippets if content['relevant_snippets']: print(' Top snippets:') for i, snippet_data in enumerate(content['relevant_snippets'][:2], 1): print(f' {i}. {snippet_data["text"][:100]}...') print(f' Terms: {snippet_data["matched_terms"][:6]}') # Extract and categorize book candidates print('\nüìñ BOOK CANDIDATES FROM SPECIALIZED SEARCHES:') print('-' * 50) book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link_data in content['relevant_links']: # Check if link has strong book indicators strong_book_indicators = ['book', 'manual', 'guide', 'method', 'handbook', 'treatise'] has_strong_book_indicator = any(indicator in link_data['book_indicators'] for indicator in strong_book_indicators) # Or has violin terms with academic indicators academic_indicators = ['study', 'analysis', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] has_academic_indicator = any(indicator in link_data['book_indicators'] for indicator in academic_indicators) if (has_strong_book_indicator or (link_data['violin_terms'] and has_academic_indicator) or (link_data['violin_terms'] and link_data['historical_terms'] and len(link_data['text']) > 40)): book_candidates.append({ 'title': link_data['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link_data['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link_data['book_indicators'], 'historical_terms': link_data['historical_terms'], 'url': link_data['href'] }) # Remove duplicates unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:60].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) print(f'Found {len(unique_books)} unique book candidates:') for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:15], 1): # Show top 15 print(f'\n{i}. "{book["title"][:120]}..."') print(f' Source: {book["source_file"]}') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"][:4]}') print(f' Book indicators: {book["book_indicators"][:3]}') print(f' Historical terms: {book["historical_terms"][:3]}') if book['url'] and 'http' in book['url']: print(f' URL: {book["url"][:80]}...') else: print('\n‚ùå No relevant content found in specialized search files') print('\nLet me also check some of the previously successful files...') # Check a few of the other files that were successful before successful_files = ['google_books_search_1.html', 'content_verification_search_4.html'] for filename in successful_files: if filename in other_files: filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) print(f'\n--- QUICK CHECK: {filename} ---') try: with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser') full_text = soup.get_text().lower() # Quick term count violin_matches = sum(1 for term in violin_terms if term in full_text) historical_matches = sum(1 for term in historical_terms if term in full_text) print(f' File size: {len(html_content):,} characters') print(f' Violin terms: {violin_matches}/{len(violin_terms)}') print(f' Historical terms: {historical_matches}/{len(historical_terms)}') if violin_matches > 0 or historical_matches > 0: print(' ‚úÖ This file still contains relevant content!') else: print(' ‚ùå No relevant content detected') except Exception as e: print(f' Error: {str(e)}') # Save results analysis_results = { 'analysis_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'specialized_files_analyzed': len(specialized_files), 'files_with_content': len(all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_links': sum(len(c['relevant_links']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'total_relevant_snippets': sum(len(c['relevant_snippets']) for c in all_extracted_content), 'detailed_findings': all_extracted_content } # Add book candidates if they exist if all_extracted_content: book_candidates = [] for content in all_extracted_content: for link_data in content['relevant_links']: strong_book_indicators = ['book', 'manual', 'guide', 'method', 'handbook', 'treatise'] has_strong_book_indicator = any(indicator in link_data['book_indicators'] for indicator in strong_book_indicators) academic_indicators = ['study', 'analysis', 'dissertation', 'thesis'] has_academic_indicator = any(indicator in link_data['book_indicators'] for indicator in academic_indicators) if (has_strong_book_indicator or (link_data['violin_terms'] and has_academic_indicator) or (link_data['violin_terms'] and link_data['historical_terms'] and len(link_data['text']) > 40)): book_candidates.append({ 'title': link_data['text'], 'source_file': content['filename'], 'violin_terms': link_data['violin_terms'], 'book_indicators': link_data['book_indicators'], 'historical_terms': link_data['historical_terms'], 'url': link_data['href'] }) unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in book_candidates: title_key = book['title'][:60].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = unique_books else: analysis_results['unique_book_candidates'] = [] with open('workspace/specialized_search_analysis.json', 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ SPECIALIZED SEARCH ANALYSIS SAVED TO: workspace/specialized_search_analysis.json') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('SUMMARY AND NEXT STEPS') print('=' * 80) if all_extracted_content: print('\n‚úÖ SUCCESS: Found relevant content in specialized searches!') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Files with content: {len(all_extracted_content)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total links found: {sum(len(c["relevant_links"]) for c in all_extracted_content)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total snippets: {sum(len(c["relevant_snippets"]) for c in all_extracted_content)}') if 'unique_books' in locals() and unique_books: print(f' ‚Ä¢ Unique book candidates: {len(unique_books)}') print('\nüéØ TOP PRIORITY BOOKS TO INVESTIGATE:') for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:5], 1): print(f' {i}. {book["title"][:80]}...') print(f' Terms: {book["violin_terms"][:3]} + {book["book_indicators"][:2]}') else: print('\n‚ö†Ô∏è LIMITED SUCCESS: Specialized searches may need different approach') print('\nRECOMMENDED ALTERNATIVE STRATEGIES:') print('1. üîç Try different search engines (Bing, DuckDuckGo)') print('2. üìö Direct access to academic databases (RILM, JSTOR)') print('3. üèõÔ∏è Contact music libraries directly') print('4. üë• Reach out to violin pedagogy experts') print('5. üìñ Search for specific author names and known works') print('\n=== SPECIALIZED VIOLIN SEARCH
