Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import requests import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== COMPREHENSIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOK RESEARCH ===') print('Objective: Save previous findings and conduct additional specialized searches for alternative books\n') # First, save the valuable findings from the previous extraction to preserve them print('üìÑ SAVING PREVIOUS EXTRACTION FINDINGS:') print('=' * 50) # Document the successful findings from HISTORY previous_findings = { 'extraction_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Alternative books on 19th-century violin performance practices focusing on German school techniques and vibrato usage influenced by repertoire', 'successful_sources_identified': [ { 'title': 'Violin Technique and Performance Practice in the Late...', 'source': 'Google Books', 'url': 'https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=bqmRIdqZ4yYC&pg=PA373', 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'technique', 'performance'], 'book_terms': ['book', 'technique'], 'relevance': 'High - directly addresses violin technique and performance practice' }, { 'title': 'Performance Practice: A Dictionary-guide for Musicians', 'source': 'Google Books', 'url': 'https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=_w32_CqDNWkC&pg=PA448', 'violin_terms': ['performance'], 'book_terms': ['book', 'guide'], 'relevance': 'Medium - general performance practice reference' }, { 'title': 'Romantic Violin Performing Practices: A Handbook', 'source': 'Google Books', 'url': 'https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=mAo7EAAAQBAJ&pg=PA36', 'violin_terms': ['violin'], 'book_terms': ['book', 'handbook'], 'relevance': 'High - specifically addresses Romantic period violin practices' }, { 'title': 'Teaching Violin, Viola, Cello, and Double Bass: Historical...', 'source': 'Google Books', 'url': 'https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=B9veEAAAQBAJ&pg=PT44', 'violin_terms': ['violin'], 'book_terms': ['book'], 'relevance': 'High - historical teaching methods for violin' }, { 'title': 'Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin...', 'source': 'Cambridge University Press', 'url': 'https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/nineteenth-century-music-review/article/practice-and-princip', 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'german', 'school'], 'book_terms': [], 'relevance': 'Very High - directly addresses German Classical School of Violin' }, { 'title': 'Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools', 'source': 'ResearchGate', 'url': 'https://www.researchgate.net/publication/303862083_Study_and_Analysis_of_Various_Violin_Playing_Scho', 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'school'], 'book_terms': ['study', 'analysis'], 'relevance': 'Very High - comparative analysis of violin schools' }, { 'title': 'Analysis of Contemporary Violin Recordings of 19th...', 'source': 'Frontiers', 'url': 'https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/psychology/articles/10.3389/fpsyg.2018.02233/full', 'violin_terms': ['violin'], 'book_terms': ['analysis'], 'relevance': 'High - 19th century violin analysis' }, { 'title': 'Carl Flesch\'s Violin Method Has Guided Generations of...', 'source': 'Strings Magazine', 'url': 'https://stringsmagazine.com/carl-fleschs-violin-method-has-guided-generations-of-students-toward-tec', 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'string', 'method'], 'book_terms': ['method', 'guide'], 'relevance': 'High - German school violin method (Carl Flesch)' } ], 'key_topics_covered': [ 'German Classical School of Violin techniques', 'Romantic period violin performing practices', '19th century violin performance analysis', 'Comparative analysis of violin schools', 'Historical violin teaching methods', 'Carl Flesch German school method' ], 'research_gaps_to_address': [ 'Specific focus on vibrato usage influenced by repertoire vs national schools', 'Detailed analysis of bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold techniques', 'More specialized musicology publications on German school comparison', 'Doctoral dissertations on 19th-century violin technique evolution' ] } # Save the documented findings findings_file = 'workspace/violin_research_findings_summary.json' with open(findings_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(previous_findings, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'‚úÖ Previous findings saved to: {findings_file}') print(f'Total sources identified: {len(previous_findings["successful_sources_identified"])}') print(f'Key topics covered: {len(previous_findings["key_topics_covered"])}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('TARGETED SEARCH FOR ADDITIONAL SPECIALIZED SOURCES') print('=' * 80) # Based on the research gaps, conduct more targeted searches specialized_queries = [ # Focus on vibrato and repertoire influence '"violin vibrato" "repertoire influence" "national schools" "performance practice"', '"vibrato technique" "German school" "Franco-Belgian" violin comparison', '"historical vibrato" "19th century" violin "repertoire dependent"', # Focus on bow hold techniques '"violin bow hold" "bent thumb" "curved pinkie" "German technique"', '"bow grip" "thumb position" violin "historical technique"', '"bowing technique" "German school" "Russian school" comparison', # Focus on specific German school sources '"Joseph Joachim" violin school technique "bow hold" method', '"Ludwig Spohr" violin method "German school" technique', '"Ferdinand David" violin pedagogy "German technique"', # Academic and dissertation sources 'dissertation "violin technique" "19th century" "German school"', 'PhD thesis "violin performance practice" "national schools" comparison', '"doctoral dissertation" "violin pedagogy" "historical technique"' ] print(f'Conducting {len(specialized_queries)} additional targeted searches...\n') # Enhanced headers for better success headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Storage for new search results new_search_results = { 'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find additional specialized sources on violin vibrato/repertoire influence and German school bow techniques', 'search_queries': specialized_queries, 'search_results': [], 'book_candidates': [], 'academic_sources': [] } # Execute specialized searches for i, query in enumerate(specialized_queries[:8], 1): # Focus on first 8 most targeted print(f'--- SPECIALIZED SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: search_url = f'https://www.google.com/search?q={quote_plus(query)}&num=15' print(f'URL: {search_url[:100]}...') response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=25) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save HTML for analysis filename = f'additional_violin_search_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath} ({len(response.text):,} characters)') # Quick content analysis soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Extract search results with comprehensive term matching search_findings = [] # Look for result links all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link_elem in all_links: link_text = link_elem.get_text().strip() link_href = link_elem.get('href', '') if len(link_text) > 25 and link_href and not link_href.startswith('/search'): text_lower = link_text.lower() # Define comprehensive term matching violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'technique', 'performance', 'method'] german_terms = ['german', 'joachim', 'spohr', 'david', 'flesch', 'auer'] school_terms = ['school', 'pedagogy', 'method', 'technique', 'approach'] book_terms = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'handbook', 'guide', 'manual'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'romantic', 'classical'] # Count matches violin_matches = [term for term in violin_terms if term in text_lower] german_matches = [term for term in german_terms if term in text_lower] school_matches = [term for term in school_terms if term in text_lower] book_matches = [term for term in book_terms if term in text_lower] historical_matches = [term for term in historical_terms if term in text_lower] # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = (len(violin_matches) * 3 + len(german_matches) * 4 + len(school_matches) * 2 + len(book_matches) * 3 + len(historical_matches) * 2) # Only include highly relevant results if relevance_score >= 6 or (violin_matches and german_matches): search_findings.append({ 'text': link_text[:200], 'href': link_href, 'violin_terms': violin_matches, 'german_terms': german_matches, 'school_terms': school_matches, 'book_terms': book_matches, 'historical_terms': historical_matches, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'query': query, 'search_number': i }) print(f'Found {len(search_findings)} highly relevant results') # Display top results for j, result in enumerate(search_findings[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Violin: {result["violin_terms"][:3]}') print(f' German: {result["german_terms"]}') print(f' Books: {result["book_terms"][:3]}') if result['href'] and 'http' in result['href']: print(f' URL: {result["href"][:70]}...') print() # Store results new_search_results['search_results'].extend(search_findings) else: print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') print() time.sleep(4) # Rate limiting print('=' * 80) print('ANALYSIS OF ADDITIONAL SEARCH RESULTS') print('=' * 80) total_new_findings = len(new_search_results['search_results']) print(f'Total new findings collected: {total_new_findings}') if total_new_findings > 0: print('\nüìö ANALYZING NEW FINDINGS:') print('-' * 35) # Sort by relevance score sorted_new_findings = sorted(new_search_results['search_results'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Categorize new findings new_books = [] new_academic = [] for finding in sorted_new_findings: book_indicators = ['book', 'handbook', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise'] academic_indicators = ['dissertation', 'thesis', 'study', 'analysis', 'journal'] has_book_indicator = any(indicator in finding['book_terms'] for indicator in book_indicators) has_academic_indicator = any(indicator in finding['book_terms'] for indicator in academic_indicators) if has_book_indicator: new_books.append(finding) elif has_academic_indicator or finding['relevance_score'] >= 10: new_academic.append(finding) print(f'New book candidates: {len(new_books)}') print(f'New academic sources: {len(new_academic)}') # Display new book candidates if new_books: print('\nüìñ NEW BOOK CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 25) for i, book in enumerate(new_books[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{book["text"]}" (Score: {book["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' German terms: {book["german_terms"]}') print(f' Book terms: {book["book_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {book["query"][:70]}...') if book['href'] and 'http' in book['href']: print(f' URL: {book["href"][:90]}...') # Display new academic sources if new_academic: print('\nüéì NEW ACADEMIC SOURCES:') print('-' * 25) for i, source in enumerate(new_academic[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{source["text"]}" (Score: {source["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {source["violin_terms"]}') print(f' German terms: {source["german_terms"]}') print(f' School terms: {source["school_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {source["query"][:70]}...') if source['href'] and 'http' in source['href']: print(f' URL: {source["href"][:90]}...') new_search_results['book_candidates'] = new_books new_search_results['academic_sources'] = new_academic else: print('\n‚ùå No new highly relevant findings from additional searches') # Save comprehensive new search results new_results_file = 'workspace/additional_violin_search_results.json' with open(new_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(new_search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ NEW SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {new_results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SUMMARY AND RECOMMENDATIONS') print('=' * 80) # Combine all findings for comprehensive summary print('\nüìä COMPLETE RESEARCH SUMMARY:') print('-' * 35) print(f'‚Ä¢ Previous successful sources identified: {len(previous_findings["successful_sources_identified"])}') print(f'‚Ä¢ New sources from additional searches: {total_new_findings}') print(f'‚Ä¢ Total sources for investigation: {len(previous_findings["successful_sources_identified"]) + total_new_findings}') print('\nüéØ TOP PRIORITY BOOK CANDIDATES FOR PLAN OBJECTIVES:') print('-' * 55) # Highlight the most relevant sources for the PLAN top_priority_sources = [ { 'title': 'Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin...', 'source': 'Cambridge University Press', 'priority_reason': 'Directly addresses German Classical School techniques - core to PLAN', 'plan_relevance': 'Very High - German school comparison' }, { 'title': 'Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools', 'source': 'ResearchGate/Atlantis Press', 'priority_reason': 'Comparative analysis of different violin schools including German', 'plan_relevance': 'Very High - national schools comparison' }, { 'title': 'Romantic Violin Performing Practices: A Handbook', 'source': 'Google Books', 'priority_reason': '19th century focus with performance practice details', 'plan_relevance': 'High - historical performance practices' }, { 'title': 'Carl Flesch\'s Violin Method Has Guided Generations...', 'source': 'Strings Magazine', 'priority_reason': 'German school method with detailed technique analysis', 'plan_relevance': 'High - German school bow techniques' }, { 'title': 'Analysis of Contemporary Violin Recordings of 19th...', 'source': 'Frontiers Journal', 'priority_reason': '19th century violin analysis with performance practice insights', 'plan_relevance': 'High - 19th century technique analysis' } ] for i, source in enumerate(top_priority_sources, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{source["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {source["source"]}') print(f' Priority Reason: {source["priority_reason"]}') print(f' PLAN Relevance: {source["plan_relevance"]}') print('\nüîç SPECIFIC RESEARCH ACTIONS FOR PLAN OBJECTIVES:') print('-' * 50) print('\n1. üéª VIBRATO USAGE INFLUENCED BY REPERTOIRE VS NATIONAL SCHOOLS:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Access "Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools" for comparative analysis') print(' ‚Ä¢ Review "Perspectives upon the German Classical School" for German-specific techniques') print(' ‚Ä¢ Search within "Romantic Violin Performing Practices" for repertoire-specific vibrato') print('\n2. üèπ GERMAN SCHOOL BOW HOLD TECHNIQUES (BENT THUMB/CURVED PINKIE):') print(' ‚Ä¢ Investigate Carl Flesch method materials for detailed bow hold descriptions') print(' ‚Ä¢ Access Cambridge article on German Classical School for technical comparisons') print(' ‚Ä¢ Search for Joseph Joachim, Ludwig Spohr, and Ferdinand David method books') print('\n3. üìö ALTERNATIVE MUSICOLOGY PUBLICATIONS:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Follow up on ResearchGate and Atlantis Press academic publications') print(' ‚Ä¢ Access Frontiers journal article for contemporary analysis methods') print(' ‚Ä¢ Search Cambridge University Press catalog for additional violin pedagogy titles') print('\n4. üéì DOCTORAL DISSERTATIONS AND SPECIALIZED TEXTS:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Use ProQuest Dissertations database with identified keywords') print(' ‚Ä¢ Contact music libraries at major conservatories for specialized holdings') print(' ‚Ä¢ Search RILM database for comprehensive musicology literature') print('\nüìã IMMEDIATE NEXT STEPS:') print('-' * 25) print('1. Access the Cambridge University Press article on German Classical School') print('2. Download the ResearchGate study on various violin playing schools') print('3. Obtain "Romantic Violin Performing Practices: A Handbook" through library') print('4. Research Carl Flesch method books for German school bow techniques') print('5. Search for additional sources by Joseph Joachim, Spohr, and David') print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE RESEARCH COMPLETE ===') # Create final comprehensive summary file final_summary = { 'research_completion_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'plan_objective': 'Find alternative books on 19th-century violin performance practices focusing on vibrato usage influenced by repertoire vs national schools and German school bow techniques', 'total_sources_identified': len(previous_findings['successful_sources_identified']) + total_new_findings, 'previous_successful_sources': previous_findings['successful_sources_identified'], 'new_sources_from_additional_search': new_search_results.get('search_results', []), 'top_priority_for_plan': top_priority_sources, 'research_gaps_addressed': [ 'German Classical School violin techniques', 'Comparative analysis of violin schools', '19th century violin performance practices', 'Historical violin teaching methods', 'Romantic period performing practices' ], 'immediate_action_items': [ 'Access Cambridge University Press article on German Classical School', 'Download ResearchGate study on violin playing schools', 'Obtain Romantic Violin Performing Practices handbook', 'Research Carl Flesch German school method books', 'Search for Joachim, Spohr, and David method materials' ] } final_summary_file = 'workspace/violin_research_comprehensive_summary.json' with open(final_summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ FINAL COMPREHENSIVE SUMMARY SAVED TO: {final_summary_file}')

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import requests import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== COMPREHENSIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOK RESEARCH ===') print('Objective: Save previous findings and conduct additional specialized searches for alternative books\n') # First, save the valuable findings from the previous extraction to preserve them print('üìÑ SAVING PREVIOUS EXTRACTION FINDINGS:') print('=' * 50) # Document the successful findings from HISTORY previous_findings = { 'extraction_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Alternative books on 19th-century violin performance practices focusing on German school techniques and vibrato usage influenced by repertoire', 'successful_sources_identified': [ { 'title': 'Violin Technique and Performance Practice in the Late...', 'source': 'Google Books', 'url': 'https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=bqmRIdqZ4yYC&pg=PA373', 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'technique', 'performance'], 'book_terms': ['book', 'technique'], 'relevance': 'High - directly addresses violin technique and performance practice' }, { 'title': 'Performance Practice: A Dictionary-guide for Musicians', 'source': 'Google Books', 'url': 'https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=_w32_CqDNWkC&pg=PA448', 'violin_terms': ['performance'], 'book_terms': ['book', 'guide'], 'relevance': 'Medium - general performance practice reference' }, { 'title': 'Romantic Violin Performing Practices: A Handbook', 'source': 'Google Books', 'url': 'https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=mAo7EAAAQBAJ&pg=PA36', 'violin_terms': ['violin'], 'book_terms': ['book', 'handbook'], 'relevance': 'High - specifically addresses Romantic period violin practices' }, { 'title': 'Teaching Violin, Viola, Cello, and Double Bass: Historical...', 'source': 'Google Books', 'url': 'https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=B9veEAAAQBAJ&pg=PT44', 'violin_terms': ['violin'], 'book_terms': ['book'], 'relevance': 'High - historical teaching methods for violin' }, { 'title': 'Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin...', 'source': 'Cambridge University Press', 'url': 'https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/nineteenth-century-music-review/article/practice-and-princip', 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'german', 'school'], 'book_terms': [], 'relevance': 'Very High - directly addresses German Classical School of Violin' }, { 'title': 'Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools', 'source': 'ResearchGate', 'url': 'https://www.researchgate.net/publication/303862083_Study_and_Analysis_of_Various_Violin_Playing_Scho', 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'school'], 'book_terms': ['study', 'analysis'], 'relevance': 'Very High - comparative analysis of violin schools' }, { 'title': 'Analysis of Contemporary Violin Recordings of 19th...', 'source': 'Frontiers', 'url': 'https://www.frontiersin.org/journals/psychology/articles/10.3389/fpsyg.2018.02233/full', 'violin_terms': ['violin'], 'book_terms': ['analysis'], 'relevance': 'High - 19th century violin analysis' }, { 'title': 'Carl Flesch\'s Violin Method Has Guided Generations of...', 'source': 'Strings Magazine', 'url': 'https://stringsmagazine.com/carl-fleschs-violin-method-has-guided-generations-of-students-toward-tec', 'violin_terms': ['violin', 'string', 'method'], 'book_terms': ['method', 'guide'], 'relevance': 'High - German school violin method (Carl Flesch)' } ], 'key_topics_covered': [ 'German Classical School of Violin techniques', 'Romantic period violin performing practices', '19th century violin performance analysis', 'Comparative analysis of violin schools', 'Historical violin teaching methods', 'Carl Flesch German school method' ], 'research_gaps_to_address': [ 'Specific focus on vibrato usage influenced by repertoire vs national schools', 'Detailed analysis of bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold techniques', 'More specialized musicology publications on German school comparison', 'Doctoral dissertations on 19th-century violin technique evolution' ] } # Save the documented findings findings_file = 'workspace/violin_research_findings_summary.json' with open(findings_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(previous_findings, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'‚úÖ Previous findings saved to: {findings_file}') print(f'Total sources identified: {len(previous_findings["successful_sources_identified"])}') print(f'Key topics covered: {len(previous_findings["key_topics_covered"])}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('TARGETED SEARCH FOR ADDITIONAL SPECIALIZED SOURCES') print('=' * 80) # Based on the research gaps, conduct more targeted searches specialized_queries = [ # Focus on vibrato and repertoire influence '"violin vibrato" "repertoire influence" "national schools" "performance practice"', '"vibrato technique" "German school" "Franco-Belgian" violin comparison', '"historical vibrato" "19th century" violin "repertoire dependent"', # Focus on bow hold techniques '"violin bow hold" "bent thumb" "curved pinkie" "German technique"', '"bow grip" "thumb position" violin "historical technique"', '"bowing technique" "German school" "Russian school" comparison', # Focus on specific German school sources '"Joseph Joachim" violin school technique "bow hold" method', '"Ludwig Spohr" violin method "German school" technique', '"Ferdinand David" violin pedagogy "German technique"', # Academic and dissertation sources 'dissertation "violin technique" "19th century" "German school"', 'PhD thesis "violin performance practice" "national schools" comparison', '"doctoral dissertation" "violin pedagogy" "historical technique"' ] print(f'Conducting {len(specialized_queries)} additional targeted searches...\n') # Enhanced headers for better success headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Storage for new search results new_search_results = { 'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find additional specialized sources on violin vibrato/repertoire influence and German school bow techniques', 'search_queries': specialized_queries, 'search_results': [], 'book_candidates': [], 'academic_sources': [] } # Execute specialized searches for i, query in enumerate(specialized_queries[:8], 1): # Focus on first 8 most targeted print(f'--- SPECIALIZED SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: search_url = f'https://www.google.com/search?q={quote_plus(query)}&num=15' print(f'URL: {search_url[:100]}...') response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=25) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save HTML for analysis filename = f'additional_violin_search_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath} ({len(response.text):,} characters)') # Quick content analysis soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Extract search results with comprehensive term matching search_findings = [] # Look for result links all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link_elem in all_links: link_text = link_elem.get_text().strip() link_href = link_elem.get('href', '') if len(link_text) > 25 and link_href and not link_href.startswith('/search'): text_lower = link_text.lower() # Define comprehensive term matching violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'technique', 'performance', 'method'] german_terms = ['german', 'joachim', 'spohr', 'david', 'flesch', 'auer'] school_terms = ['school', 'pedagogy', 'method', 'technique', 'approach'] book_terms = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'dissertation', 'thesis', 'handbook', 'guide', 'manual'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'romantic', 'classical'] # Count matches violin_matches = [term for term in violin_terms if term in text_lower] german_matches = [term for term in german_terms if term in text_lower] school_matches = [term for term in school_terms if term in text_lower] book_matches = [term for term in book_terms if term in text_lower] historical_matches = [term for term in historical_terms if term in text_lower] # Calculate relevance score relevance_score = (len(violin_matches) * 3 + len(german_matches) * 4 + len(school_matches) * 2 + len(book_matches) * 3 + len(historical_matches) * 2) # Only include highly relevant results if relevance_score >= 6 or (violin_matches and german_matches): search_findings.append({ 'text': link_text[:200], 'href': link_href, 'violin_terms': violin_matches, 'german_terms': german_matches, 'school_terms': school_matches, 'book_terms': book_matches, 'historical_terms': historical_matches, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'query': query, 'search_number': i }) print(f'Found {len(search_findings)} highly relevant results') # Display top results for j, result in enumerate(search_findings[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["text"][:80]}...') print(f' Violin: {result["violin_terms"][:3]}') print(f' German: {result["german_terms"]}') print(f' Books: {result["book_terms"][:3]}') if result['href'] and 'http' in result['href']: print(f' URL: {result["href"][:70]}...') print() # Store results new_search_results['search_results'].extend(search_findings) else: print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') print() time.sleep(4) # Rate limiting print('=' * 80) print('ANALYSIS OF ADDITIONAL SEARCH RESULTS') print('=' * 80) total_new_findings = len(new_search_results['search_results']) print(f'Total new findings collected: {total_new_findings}') if total_new_findings > 0: print('\nüìö ANALYZING NEW FINDINGS:') print('-' * 35) # Sort by relevance score sorted_new_findings = sorted(new_search_results['search_results'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Categorize new findings new_books = [] new_academic = [] for finding in sorted_new_findings: book_indicators = ['book', 'handbook', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise'] academic_indicators = ['dissertation', 'thesis', 'study', 'analysis', 'journal'] has_book_indicator = any(indicator in finding['book_terms'] for indicator in book_indicators) has_academic_indicator = any(indicator in finding['book_terms'] for indicator in academic_indicators) if has_book_indicator: new_books.append(finding) elif has_academic_indicator or finding['relevance_score'] >= 10: new_academic.append(finding) print(f'New book candidates: {len(new_books)}') print(f'New academic sources: {len(new_academic)}') # Display new book candidates if new_books: print('\nüìñ NEW BOOK CANDIDATES:') print('-' * 25) for i, book in enumerate(new_books[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{book["text"]}" (Score: {book["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' German terms: {book["german_terms"]}') print(f' Book terms: {book["book_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {book["query"][:70]}...') if book['href'] and 'http' in book['href']: print(f' URL: {book["href"][:90]}...') # Display new academic sources if new_academic: print('\nüéì NEW ACADEMIC SOURCES:') print('-' * 25) for i, source in enumerate(new_academic[:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{source["text"]}" (Score: {source["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {source["violin_terms"]}') print(f' German terms: {source["german_terms"]}') print(f' School terms: {source["school_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {source["query"][:70]}...') if source['href'] and 'http' in source['href']: print(f' URL: {source["href"][:90]}...') new_search_results['book_candidates'] = new_books new_search_results['academic_sources'] = new_academic else: print('\n‚ùå No new highly relevant findings from additional searches') # Save comprehensive new search results new_results_file = 'workspace/additional_violin_search_results.json' with open(new_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(new_search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ NEW SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {new_results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SUMMARY AND RECOMMENDATIONS') print('=' * 80) # Combine all findings for comprehensive summary print('\nüìä COMPLETE RESEARCH SUMMARY:') print('-' * 35) print(f'‚Ä¢ Previous successful sources identified: {len(previous_findings["successful_sources_identified"])}') print(f'‚Ä¢ New sources from additional searches: {total_new_findings}') print(f'‚Ä¢ Total sources for investigation: {len(previous_findings["successful_sources_identified"]) + total_new_findings}') print('\nüéØ TOP PRIORITY BOOK CANDIDATES FOR PLAN OBJECTIVES:') print('-' * 55) # Highlight the most relevant sources for the PLAN top_priority_sources = [ { 'title': 'Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin...', 'source': 'Cambridge University Press', 'priority_reason': 'Directly addresses German Classical School techniques - core to PLAN', 'plan_relevance': 'Very High - German school comparison' }, { 'title': 'Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools', 'source': 'ResearchGate/Atlantis Press', 'priority_reason': 'Comparative analysis of different violin schools including German', 'plan_relevance': 'Very High - national schools comparison' }, { 'title': 'Romantic Violin Performing Practices: A Handbook', 'source': 'Google Books', 'priority_reason': '19th century focus with performance practice details', 'plan_relevance': 'High - historical performance practices' }, { 'title': 'Carl Flesch\'s Violin Method Has Guided Generations...', 'source': 'Strings Magazine', 'priority_reason': 'German school method with detailed technique analysis', 'plan_relevance': 'High - German school bow techniques' }, { 'title': 'Analysis of Contemporary Violin Recordings of 19th...', 'source': 'Frontiers Journal', 'priority_reason': '19th century violin analysis with performance practice insights', 'plan_relevance': 'High - 19th century technique analysis' } ] for i, source in enumerate(top_priority_sources, 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{source["title"]}"') print(f' Source: {source["source"]}') print(f' Priority Reason: {source["priority_reason"]}') print(f' PLAN Relevance: {source["plan_relevance"]}') print('\nüîç SPECIFIC RESEARCH ACTIONS FOR PLAN OBJECTIVES:') print('-' * 50) print('\n1. üéª VIBRATO USAGE INFLUENCED BY REPERTOIRE VS NATIONAL SCHOOLS:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Access "Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools" for comparative analysis') print(' ‚Ä¢ Review "Perspectives upon the German Classical School" for German-specific techniques') print(' ‚Ä¢ Search within "Romantic Violin Performing Practices" for repertoire-specific vibrato') print('\n2. üèπ GERMAN SCHOOL BOW HOLD TECHNIQUES (BENT THUMB/CURVED PINKIE):') print(' ‚Ä¢ Investigate Carl Flesch method materials for detailed bow hold descriptions') print(' ‚Ä¢ Access Cambridge article on German Classical School for technical comparisons') print(' ‚Ä¢ Search for Joseph Joachim, Ludwig Spohr, and Ferdinand David method books') print('\n3. üìö ALTERNATIVE MUSICOLOGY PUBLICATIONS:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Follow up on ResearchGate and Atlantis Press academic publications') print(' ‚Ä¢ Access Frontiers journal article for contemporary analysis methods') print(' ‚Ä¢ Search Cambridge University Press catalog for additional violin pedagogy titles') print('\n4. üéì DOCTORAL DISSERTATIONS AND SPECIALIZED TEXTS:') print(' ‚Ä¢ Use ProQuest Dissertations database with identified keywords') print(' ‚Ä¢ Contact music libraries at major conservatories for specialized holdings') print(' ‚Ä¢ Search RILM database for comprehensive musicology literature') print('\nüìã IMMEDIATE NEXT STEPS:') print('-' * 25) print('1. Access the Cambridge University Press article on German Classical School') print('2. Download the ResearchGate study on various violin playing schools') print('3. Obtain "Romantic Violin Performing Practices: A Handbook" through library') print('4. Research Carl Flesch method books for German school bow techniques') print('5. Search for additional sources by Joseph Joachim, Spohr, and David') print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE RESEARCH COMPLETE ===') # Create final comprehensive summary file final_summary = { 'research_completion_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'plan_objective': 'Find alternative books on 19th-century violin performance practices focusing on vibrato usage influenced by repertoire vs national schools and German school bow techniques', 'total_sources_identified': len(previous_findings['successful_sources_identified']) + total_new_findings, 'previous_successful_sources': previous_findings['successful_sources_identified'], 'new_sources_from_additional_search': new_search_results.get('search_results', []), 'top_priority_for_plan': top_priority_sources, 'research_gaps_addressed': [ 'German Classical School violin techniques', 'Comparative analysis of violin schools', '19th century violin performance practices', 'Historical violin teaching methods', 'Romantic period performing practices' ], 'immediate_action_items': [ 'Access Cambridge University Press article on German Classical School', 'Download ResearchGate study on violin playing schools', 'Obtain Romantic Violin Performing Practices handbook', 'Research Carl Flesch German school method books', 'Search for Joachim, Spohr, and David method materials' ] } final_summary_file = 'workspace/violin_research_comprehensive_summary.json' with open(final_summary_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(final_summary, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ FINAL COMPREHENSIVE SUMMARY SAVED TO: {final_summary_file}')

Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import requests import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH FOR ALTERNATIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Search for specialized sources on German school techniques, vibrato usage, and bow hold methods\n') # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what files we have workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace') # Separate files by type to understand our resources json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f'JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f'HTML files: {len(html_files)}') # Let's inspect the most recent comprehensive summary if it exists if 'violin_research_comprehensive_summary.json' in json_files: print('\nüìÑ INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SUMMARY:') print('=' * 55) with open('workspace/violin_research_comprehensive_summary.json', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: summary_data = json.load(f) print('File structure inspection:') for key in summary_data.keys(): value = summary_data[key] print(f' ‚Ä¢ {key}: {type(value)}') if isinstance(value, list): print(f' - Length: {len(value)}') if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' - Sample keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:4]}') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' - Keys: {list(value.keys())[:4]}') elif isinstance(value, (str, int)): print(f' - Value: {str(value)[:80]}...' if len(str(value)) > 80 else f' - Value: {value}') # Extract key information total_sources = summary_data.get('total_sources_identified', 0) previous_sources = summary_data.get('previous_successful_sources', []) top_priority = summary_data.get('top_priority_for_plan', []) action_items = summary_data.get('immediate_action_items', []) print(f'\nüìä SUMMARY ANALYSIS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total sources identified: {total_sources}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Previous successful sources: {len(previous_sources)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Top priority sources: {len(top_priority)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Action items: {len(action_items)}') if top_priority: print('\nüéØ TOP PRIORITY SOURCES ALREADY IDENTIFIED:') for i, source in enumerate(top_priority[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. {source.get("title", "No title")[:80]}...') print(f' Source: {source.get("source", "Unknown")}') print(f' Relevance: {source.get("plan_relevance", "Unknown")}') print() else: print('\n‚ùå Comprehensive summary not found, will build from scratch') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('TARGETED SEARCH FOR ADDITIONAL VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE SOURCES') print('=' * 80) # Based on PLAN requirements, create highly specific search queries # Focus on: vibrato usage influenced by repertoire vs national schools, # German school techniques, bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold targeted_searches = [ # Vibrato and repertoire influence '"violin vibrato" "repertoire dependent" "national schools" "performance practice"', '"vibrato usage" "German school" "Franco-Belgian school" violin comparison', '"historical vibrato" "19th century" violin "repertoire influence"', # German school bow techniques '"German violin school" "bow hold" "bent thumb" "curved pinkie" technique', '"violin bow grip" "thumb position" "German technique" historical', '"bowing technique" "German school" "Russian school" violin comparison', # Specific German school masters '"Joseph Joachim" violin method "bow technique" "German school"', '"Ludwig Spohr" violin technique "German method" bow hold', '"Ferdinand David" violin pedagogy "German school" technique', # Academic and specialized sources 'dissertation "violin performance practice" "19th century" "German school"', '"violin pedagogy" "historical technique" "national schools" comparison', 'site:cambridge.org "violin technique" "German school" "performance practice"' ] print(f'Executing {len(targeted_searches)} specialized searches for violin performance practice sources...\n') # Enhanced headers for better request success headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Storage for comprehensive search results search_results = { 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find alternative books on 19th-century violin performance practices focusing on German school techniques and vibrato usage', 'plan_requirements': [ 'Vibrato usage influenced by repertoire rather than national schools', 'German school violin techniques comparison', 'Bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold techniques', 'Alternative musicology publications and doctoral dissertations' ], 'search_queries': targeted_searches, 'search_results': [], 'book_candidates': [], 'academic_sources': [], 'dissertation_sources': [] } # Execute targeted searches with comprehensive analysis for i, query in enumerate(targeted_searches[:10], 1): # Focus on first 10 searches print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Construct search URL search_url = f'https://www.google.com/search?q={quote_plus(query)}&num=20' print(f'URL: {search_url[:100]}...') # Make request response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=25) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save HTML for analysis filename = f'violin_alternative_search_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath} ({len(response.text):,} characters)') # Parse and analyze content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Extract search result links with comprehensive term matching found_results = [] # Look for result containers all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link_elem in all_links: link_text = link_elem.get_text().strip() link_href = link_elem.get('href', '') # Filter for substantial, relevant content if len(link_text) > 30 and link_href and not link_href.startswith('/search'): text_lower = link_text.lower() # Define comprehensive term categories violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance'] german_terms = ['german', 'joachim', 'spohr', 'david', 'flesch', 'auer'] school_terms = ['school', 'method', 'pedagogy', 'approach', 'technique', 'system'] book_terms = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise', 'handbook', 'method'] academic_terms = ['dissertation', 'thesis', 'journal', 'research', 'university', 'press'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'romantic', 'classical', 'period'] # Count term matches violin_matches = [term for term in violin_terms if term in text_lower] german_matches = [term for term in german_terms if term in text_lower] school_matches = [term for term in school_terms if term in text_lower] book_matches = [term for term in book_terms if term in text_lower] academic_matches = [term for term in academic_terms if term in text_lower] historical_matches = [term for term in historical_terms if term in text_lower] # Calculate relevance score with emphasis on PLAN requirements relevance_score = (len(violin_matches) * 3 + len(german_matches) * 4 + # High weight for German school len(school_matches) * 2 + len(book_matches) * 3 + len(academic_matches) * 2 + len(historical_matches) * 2) # Only include highly relevant results if relevance_score >= 6 or (violin_matches and german_matches) or (violin_matches and book_matches and len(violin_matches) >= 2): found_results.append({ 'text': link_text[:250], 'href': link_href, 'violin_terms': violin_matches, 'german_terms': german_matches, 'school_terms': school_matches, 'book_terms': book_matches, 'academic_terms': academic_matches, 'historical_terms': historical_matches, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'query': query, 'search_number': i }) print(f'Found {len(found_results)} highly relevant results') # Display top results for this search for j, result in enumerate(found_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["text"][:90]}...') print(f' Violin: {result["violin_terms"][:4]}') print(f' German: {result["german_terms"]}') print(f' Books: {result["book_terms"][:3]}') if result['href'] and 'http' in result['href']: print(f' URL: {result["href"][:80]}...') print() # Store results search_results['search_results'].extend(found_results) else: print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') print() time.sleep(4) # Rate limiting print('=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF SEARCH RESULTS') print('=' * 80) total_findings = len(search_results['search_results']) print(f'Total findings collected: {total_findings}') if total_findings > 0: print('\nüìö CATEGORIZING FINDINGS BY TYPE:') print('-' * 40) # Sort all findings by relevance score sorted_findings = sorted(search_results['search_results'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Categorize findings for finding in sorted_findings: # Determine category based on content book_indicators = ['book', 'manual', 'guide', 'handbook', 'treatise', 'method'] academic_indicators = ['journal', 'research', 'university', 'press', 'study', 'analysis'] dissertation_indicators = ['dissertation', 'thesis', 'phd'] has_book_indicator = any(indicator in finding['book_terms'] for indicator in book_indicators) has_academic_indicator = any(indicator in finding['academic_terms'] for indicator in academic_indicators) or any(indicator in finding['book_terms'] for indicator in academic_indicators) has_dissertation_indicator = any(indicator in finding['academic_terms'] for indicator in dissertation_indicators) if has_book_indicator: search_results['book_candidates'].append(finding) elif has_dissertation_indicator: search_results['dissertation_sources'].append(finding) elif has_academic_indicator or finding['relevance_score'] >= 10: search_results['academic_sources'].append(finding) print(f'üìñ Book candidates: {len(search_results["book_candidates"])}') print(f'üéì Academic sources: {len(search_results["academic_sources"])}') print(f'üìã Dissertation sources: {len(search_results["dissertation_sources"])}') # Display book candidates if search_results['book_candidates']: print('\nüìñ BOOK CANDIDATES FOR PLAN OBJECTIVES:') print('-' * 45) # Remove duplicates unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in search_results['book_candidates']: title_key = book['text'][:60].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles and title_key: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:8], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{book["text"]}" (Score: {book["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' German terms: {book["german_terms"]}') print(f' Book terms: {book["book_terms"]}') print(f' Historical terms: {book["historical_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {book["query"][:80]}...') if book['href'] and 'http' in book['href']: print(f' URL: {book["href"][:100]}...') # Display academic sources if search_results['academic_sources']: print('\nüéì ACADEMIC SOURCES:') print('-' * 20) for i, source in enumerate(search_results['academic_sources'][:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{source["text"]}" (Score: {source["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {source["violin_terms"]}') print(f' German terms: {source["german_terms"]}') print(f' Academic terms: {source["academic_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {source["query"][:80]}...') if source['href'] and 'http' in source['href']: print(f' URL: {source["href"][:100]}...') # Display dissertation sources if search_results['dissertation_sources']: print('\nüìã DISSERTATION SOURCES:') print('-' * 25) for i, diss in enumerate(search_results['dissertation_sources'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{diss["text"]}" (Score: {diss["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {diss["violin_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {diss["query"][:80]}...') if diss['href'] and 'http' in diss['href']: print(f' URL: {diss["href"][:100]}...') else: print('\n‚ùå No highly relevant findings from current searches') print('\nThis may indicate:') print('1. Search engines are blocking automated requests') print('2. The specific topic combination is extremely specialized') print('3. Need to try alternative search strategies') # Save comprehensive search results results_file = 'workspace/alternative_violin_books_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('ALTERNATIVE RESEARCH STRATEGIES FOR PLAN OBJECTIVES') print('=' * 80) print('\nüéØ SPECIFIC PLAN REQUIREMENTS TO ADDRESS:') print('-' * 45) print('1. üéª Vibrato usage influenced by repertoire rather than national schools') print('2. üèπ German school techniques with bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold') print('3. üìö Alternative musicology publications and doctoral dissertations') print('4. üîÑ Comparison between different violin schools and techniques') print('\nüìö RECOMMENDED SPECIALIZED PUBLISHERS TO CONTACT:') print('-' * 50) print('‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press - Music Division') print('‚Ä¢ Cambridge University Press - Music & Performing Arts') print('‚Ä¢ University of Rochester Press - Eastman Studies in Music') print('‚Ä¢ Indiana University Press - Music & Performing Arts') print('‚Ä¢ Scarecrow Press - Music Reference Collection') print('‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Music Publisher') print('‚Ä¢ G. Schirmer/Hal Leonard Corporation') print('‚Ä¢ Peters Edition - Classical Music Publishers') print('\nüèõÔ∏è SPECIALIZED MUSIC LIBRARIES FOR DIRECT CONSULTATION:') print('-' * 55) print('‚Ä¢ Juilliard School Library (New York)') print('‚Ä¢ Curtis Institute of Music Library (Philadelphia)') print('‚Ä¢ Royal College of Music Library (London)') print('‚Ä¢ Vienna University of Music and Performing Arts Library') print('‚Ä¢ New England Conservatory Library (Boston)') print('‚Ä¢ Eastman School of Music Library (Rochester)') print('‚Ä¢ Yale School of Music Library') print('‚Ä¢ Indiana University Jacobs School of Music Library') print('\nüéì ACADEMIC DATABASES FOR COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH:') print('-' * 50) print('‚Ä¢ RILM (R√©pertoire International de Litt√©rature Musicale)') print('‚Ä¢ Music Index Online') print('‚Ä¢ ProQuest Dissertations & Theses Global') print('‚Ä¢ International Index to Music Periodicals') print('‚Ä¢ JSTOR Music Collection') print('‚Ä¢ Project MUSE - Execution Output

The output contains contradictory information - while the code was designed to search for German school violin techniques and vibrato usage, the actual results discuss Li Qingshan corruption investigations from 2013. **PLAN** alignment: 10% - the search infrastructure worked but completely failed to deliver relevant content about 19th-century violin performance practices, German school bow hold techniques, or vibrato usage influenced by repertoire vs national schools. Python Code python
import os import json from bs4 import BeautifulSoup import requests import time from urllib.parse import quote_plus print('=== COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH FOR ALTERNATIVE VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE BOOKS ===') print('Objective: Search for specialized sources on German school techniques, vibrato usage, and bow hold methods\n') # First, let's inspect the workspace to understand what files we have workspace_files = [] if os.path.exists('workspace'): for filename in os.listdir('workspace'): workspace_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(workspace_files)} files in workspace') # Separate files by type to understand our resources json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] html_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.html')] print(f'JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f'HTML files: {len(html_files)}') # Let's inspect the most recent comprehensive summary if it exists if 'violin_research_comprehensive_summary.json' in json_files: print('\nüìÑ INSPECTING COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH SUMMARY:') print('=' * 55) with open('workspace/violin_research_comprehensive_summary.json', 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: summary_data = json.load(f) print('File structure inspection:') for key in summary_data.keys(): value = summary_data[key] print(f' ‚Ä¢ {key}: {type(value)}') if isinstance(value, list): print(f' - Length: {len(value)}') if len(value) > 0 and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' - Sample keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:4]}') elif isinstance(value, dict): print(f' - Keys: {list(value.keys())[:4]}') elif isinstance(value, (str, int)): print(f' - Value: {str(value)[:80]}...' if len(str(value)) > 80 else f' - Value: {value}') # Extract key information total_sources = summary_data.get('total_sources_identified', 0) previous_sources = summary_data.get('previous_successful_sources', []) top_priority = summary_data.get('top_priority_for_plan', []) action_items = summary_data.get('immediate_action_items', []) print(f'\nüìä SUMMARY ANALYSIS:') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total sources identified: {total_sources}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Previous successful sources: {len(previous_sources)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Top priority sources: {len(top_priority)}') print(f' ‚Ä¢ Action items: {len(action_items)}') if top_priority: print('\nüéØ TOP PRIORITY SOURCES ALREADY IDENTIFIED:') for i, source in enumerate(top_priority[:3], 1): print(f' {i}. {source.get("title", "No title")[:80]}...') print(f' Source: {source.get("source", "Unknown")}') print(f' Relevance: {source.get("plan_relevance", "Unknown")}') print() else: print('\n‚ùå Comprehensive summary not found, will build from scratch') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('TARGETED SEARCH FOR ADDITIONAL VIOLIN PERFORMANCE PRACTICE SOURCES') print('=' * 80) # Based on PLAN requirements, create highly specific search queries # Focus on: vibrato usage influenced by repertoire vs national schools, # German school techniques, bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold targeted_searches = [ # Vibrato and repertoire influence '"violin vibrato" "repertoire dependent" "national schools" "performance practice"', '"vibrato usage" "German school" "Franco-Belgian school" violin comparison', '"historical vibrato" "19th century" violin "repertoire influence"', # German school bow techniques '"German violin school" "bow hold" "bent thumb" "curved pinkie" technique', '"violin bow grip" "thumb position" "German technique" historical', '"bowing technique" "German school" "Russian school" violin comparison', # Specific German school masters '"Joseph Joachim" violin method "bow technique" "German school"', '"Ludwig Spohr" violin technique "German method" bow hold', '"Ferdinand David" violin pedagogy "German school" technique', # Academic and specialized sources 'dissertation "violin performance practice" "19th century" "German school"', '"violin pedagogy" "historical technique" "national schools" comparison', 'site:cambridge.org "violin technique" "German school" "performance practice"' ] print(f'Executing {len(targeted_searches)} specialized searches for violin performance practice sources...\n') # Enhanced headers for better request success headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/120.0.0.0 Safari/537.36', 'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8', 'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br', 'Connection': 'keep-alive', 'Upgrade-Insecure-Requests': '1' } # Storage for comprehensive search results search_results = { 'search_timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), 'objective': 'Find alternative books on 19th-century violin performance practices focusing on German school techniques and vibrato usage', 'plan_requirements': [ 'Vibrato usage influenced by repertoire rather than national schools', 'German school violin techniques comparison', 'Bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold techniques', 'Alternative musicology publications and doctoral dissertations' ], 'search_queries': targeted_searches, 'search_results': [], 'book_candidates': [], 'academic_sources': [], 'dissertation_sources': [] } # Execute targeted searches with comprehensive analysis for i, query in enumerate(targeted_searches[:10], 1): # Focus on first 10 searches print(f'--- SEARCH {i}: {query} ---') try: # Construct search URL search_url = f'https://www.google.com/search?q={quote_plus(query)}&num=20' print(f'URL: {search_url[:100]}...') # Make request response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=25) print(f'Status: {response.status_code}') if response.status_code == 200: # Save HTML for analysis filename = f'violin_alternative_search_{i}.html' filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f'Saved: {filepath} ({len(response.text):,} characters)') # Parse and analyze content soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser') # Extract search result links with comprehensive term matching found_results = [] # Look for result containers all_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True) for link_elem in all_links: link_text = link_elem.get_text().strip() link_href = link_elem.get('href', '') # Filter for substantial, relevant content if len(link_text) > 30 and link_href and not link_href.startswith('/search'): text_lower = link_text.lower() # Define comprehensive term categories violin_terms = ['violin', 'violinist', 'bow', 'bowing', 'vibrato', 'string', 'technique', 'performance'] german_terms = ['german', 'joachim', 'spohr', 'david', 'flesch', 'auer'] school_terms = ['school', 'method', 'pedagogy', 'approach', 'technique', 'system'] book_terms = ['book', 'study', 'analysis', 'guide', 'manual', 'treatise', 'handbook', 'method'] academic_terms = ['dissertation', 'thesis', 'journal', 'research', 'university', 'press'] historical_terms = ['19th', 'century', 'historical', 'romantic', 'classical', 'period'] # Count term matches violin_matches = [term for term in violin_terms if term in text_lower] german_matches = [term for term in german_terms if term in text_lower] school_matches = [term for term in school_terms if term in text_lower] book_matches = [term for term in book_terms if term in text_lower] academic_matches = [term for term in academic_terms if term in text_lower] historical_matches = [term for term in historical_terms if term in text_lower] # Calculate relevance score with emphasis on PLAN requirements relevance_score = (len(violin_matches) * 3 + len(german_matches) * 4 + # High weight for German school len(school_matches) * 2 + len(book_matches) * 3 + len(academic_matches) * 2 + len(historical_matches) * 2) # Only include highly relevant results if relevance_score >= 6 or (violin_matches and german_matches) or (violin_matches and book_matches and len(violin_matches) >= 2): found_results.append({ 'text': link_text[:250], 'href': link_href, 'violin_terms': violin_matches, 'german_terms': german_matches, 'school_terms': school_matches, 'book_terms': book_matches, 'academic_terms': academic_matches, 'historical_terms': historical_matches, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'query': query, 'search_number': i }) print(f'Found {len(found_results)} highly relevant results') # Display top results for this search for j, result in enumerate(found_results[:3], 1): print(f' {j}. Score {result["relevance_score"]}: {result["text"][:90]}...') print(f' Violin: {result["violin_terms"][:4]}') print(f' German: {result["german_terms"]}') print(f' Books: {result["book_terms"][:3]}') if result['href'] and 'http' in result['href']: print(f' URL: {result["href"][:80]}...') print() # Store results search_results['search_results'].extend(found_results) else: print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}') except Exception as e: print(f'Error: {str(e)}') print() time.sleep(4) # Rate limiting print('=' * 80) print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF SEARCH RESULTS') print('=' * 80) total_findings = len(search_results['search_results']) print(f'Total findings collected: {total_findings}') if total_findings > 0: print('\nüìö CATEGORIZING FINDINGS BY TYPE:') print('-' * 40) # Sort all findings by relevance score sorted_findings = sorted(search_results['search_results'], key=lambda x: x['relevance_score'], reverse=True) # Categorize findings for finding in sorted_findings: # Determine category based on content book_indicators = ['book', 'manual', 'guide', 'handbook', 'treatise', 'method'] academic_indicators = ['journal', 'research', 'university', 'press', 'study', 'analysis'] dissertation_indicators = ['dissertation', 'thesis', 'phd'] has_book_indicator = any(indicator in finding['book_terms'] for indicator in book_indicators) has_academic_indicator = any(indicator in finding['academic_terms'] for indicator in academic_indicators) or any(indicator in finding['book_terms'] for indicator in academic_indicators) has_dissertation_indicator = any(indicator in finding['academic_terms'] for indicator in dissertation_indicators) if has_book_indicator: search_results['book_candidates'].append(finding) elif has_dissertation_indicator: search_results['dissertation_sources'].append(finding) elif has_academic_indicator or finding['relevance_score'] >= 10: search_results['academic_sources'].append(finding) print(f'üìñ Book candidates: {len(search_results["book_candidates"])}') print(f'üéì Academic sources: {len(search_results["academic_sources"])}') print(f'üìã Dissertation sources: {len(search_results["dissertation_sources"])}') # Display book candidates if search_results['book_candidates']: print('\nüìñ BOOK CANDIDATES FOR PLAN OBJECTIVES:') print('-' * 45) # Remove duplicates unique_books = [] seen_titles = set() for book in search_results['book_candidates']: title_key = book['text'][:60].lower().strip() if title_key not in seen_titles and title_key: seen_titles.add(title_key) unique_books.append(book) for i, book in enumerate(unique_books[:8], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{book["text"]}" (Score: {book["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {book["violin_terms"]}') print(f' German terms: {book["german_terms"]}') print(f' Book terms: {book["book_terms"]}') print(f' Historical terms: {book["historical_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {book["query"][:80]}...') if book['href'] and 'http' in book['href']: print(f' URL: {book["href"][:100]}...') # Display academic sources if search_results['academic_sources']: print('\nüéì ACADEMIC SOURCES:') print('-' * 20) for i, source in enumerate(search_results['academic_sources'][:5], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{source["text"]}" (Score: {source["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {source["violin_terms"]}') print(f' German terms: {source["german_terms"]}') print(f' Academic terms: {source["academic_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {source["query"][:80]}...') if source['href'] and 'http' in source['href']: print(f' URL: {source["href"][:100]}...') # Display dissertation sources if search_results['dissertation_sources']: print('\nüìã DISSERTATION SOURCES:') print('-' * 25) for i, diss in enumerate(search_results['dissertation_sources'], 1): print(f'\n{i}. "{diss["text"]}" (Score: {diss["relevance_score"]})') print(f' Violin terms: {diss["violin_terms"]}') print(f' From query: {diss["query"][:80]}...') if diss['href'] and 'http' in diss['href']: print(f' URL: {diss["href"][:100]}...') else: print('\n‚ùå No highly relevant findings from current searches') print('\nThis may indicate:') print('1. Search engines are blocking automated requests') print('2. The specific topic combination is extremely specialized') print('3. Need to try alternative search strategies') # Save comprehensive search results results_file = 'workspace/alternative_violin_books_search_results.json' with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f'\nüíæ SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}') print('\n' + '=' * 80) print('ALTERNATIVE RESEARCH STRATEGIES FOR PLAN OBJECTIVES') print('=' * 80) print('\nüéØ SPECIFIC PLAN REQUIREMENTS TO ADDRESS:') print('-' * 45) print('1. üéª Vibrato usage influenced by repertoire rather than national schools') print('2. üèπ German school techniques with bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold') print('3. üìö Alternative musicology publications and doctoral dissertations') print('4. üîÑ Comparison between different violin schools and techniques') print('\nüìö RECOMMENDED SPECIALIZED PUBLISHERS TO CONTACT:') print('-' * 50) print('‚Ä¢ Oxford University Press - Music Division') print('‚Ä¢ Cambridge University Press - Music & Performing Arts') print('‚Ä¢ University of Rochester Press - Eastman Studies in Music') print('‚Ä¢ Indiana University Press - Music & Performing Arts') print('‚Ä¢ Scarecrow Press - Music Reference Collection') print('‚Ä¢ Carl Fischer Music Publisher') print('‚Ä¢ G. Development Plan #4
Plan Content:
Access and examine the specific content of 'Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin' from Cambridge University Press, which was identified as a high-priority source that directly addresses German school techniques. Additionally, retrieve and analyze the 'Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools' from ResearchGate that focuses on comparative analysis of violin schools. Extract detailed information about vibrato usage arguments (repertoire vs national schools) and specific bow hold techniques (bent thumb/curved pinkie) to verify which source contains the exact claims described in the TASK and determine its publication year.

Plan Description:
This focused verification approach is optimal because: (1) Previous searches identified multiple high-priority candidate sources but need content verification to find the specific book with the unique vibrato and bow hold arguments, (2) The Cambridge and ResearchGate sources were specifically flagged as directly addressing German school techniques and comparative violin school analysis, (3) Expected outcome is to access the actual content of these promising sources to verify which contains the specific claims about repertoire-influenced vibrato and bent thumb/curved pinkie bow hold comparison, (4) This will either confirm one of these sources or provide clearer direction for identifying the correct publication and its year
