Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print('=== EXAMINING WORKSPACE FOR VIOLIN SCHOOL SOURCES ===') print('Objective: Access and analyze identified high-priority sources about German violin school techniques\n') # First, inspect what files are available in workspace if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f'Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)}):') for file in sorted(workspace_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print() else: print('No workspace directory found') os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory\n') # Look for any existing search results or source files that might contain the violin school information # Fixed the variable scope issue from previous attempt violin_related_files = [] if 'workspace_files' in locals(): for file in workspace_files: if any(keyword in file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'german', 'school', 'technique', 'bow', 'vibrato']): violin_related_files.append(file) if violin_related_files: print(f'Found {len(violin_related_files)} violin-related files:') for file in violin_related_files: print(f' - {file}') print() else: print('No violin-related files found in workspace\n') # Check for any JSON files that might contain search results or source information json_files = [] if 'workspace_files' in locals(): json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] if json_files: print(f'Found {len(json_files)} JSON files - inspecting structure first:') # Focus on the most promising JSON files first priority_json_files = [] for json_file in json_files: if any(keyword in json_file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'stowell', 'book', 'comprehensive']): priority_json_files.append(json_file) print(f'Priority JSON files ({len(priority_json_files)}): {priority_json_files}\n') # First, let's inspect the structure of the most comprehensive file target_file = 'violin_book_comprehensive_analysis.json' if target_file in json_files: print(f'=== INSPECTING STRUCTURE OF {target_file} ===') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_file) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'‚úì File loaded successfully') print(f'Data type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Dictionary with {len(data)} top-level keys:') for key in data.keys(): value = data[key] print(f' - "{key}": {type(value)}') # Show structure of complex values if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict with {len(value)} keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:3]}...') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') print(f' Preview: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' Value: {value}') print() # Now examine the content based on the structure we found print(f'=== DETAILED CONTENT ANALYSIS ===') # Look for sources information if 'sources' in data: sources = data['sources'] print(f'üìö SOURCES SECTION ({len(sources)} sources):') cambridge_found = False researchgate_found = False for i, source in enumerate(sources[:10], 1): # Check first 10 sources if isinstance(source, dict): title = source.get('title', 'No title') publisher = source.get('publisher', 'No publisher') url = source.get('url', 'No URL') year = source.get('year', 'No year') print(f'\n Source {i}:') print(f' Title: {title[:80]}...' if len(title) > 80 else f' Title: {title}') print(f' Publisher: {publisher}') print(f' Year: {year}') # Check for our target sources title_lower = title.lower() publisher_lower = publisher.lower() url_lower = url.lower() if ('cambridge' in publisher_lower and 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin' in title_lower: print(f' *** üéØ CAMBRIDGE TARGET FOUND ***') cambridge_found = True # Extract all available information about this source print(f' Full details:') for key, value in source.items(): print(f' {key}: {value}') elif ('researchgate' in url_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools' in title_lower: print(f' *** üéØ RESEARCHGATE TARGET FOUND ***') researchgate_found = True # Extract all available information about this source print(f' Full details:') for key, value in source.items(): print(f' {key}: {value}') elif 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower: print(f' üìñ Related German violin source') print(f'\nüìã TARGET SOURCE STATUS:') print(f' Cambridge source found: {cambridge_found}') print(f' ResearchGate source found: {researchgate_found}') # Look for extracted content or analysis if 'extracted_content' in data: print(f'\nüìÑ EXTRACTED CONTENT SECTION:') content = data['extracted_content'] if isinstance(content, str): print(f' Content type: String ({len(content):,} characters)') # Search for technique-specific information content_lower = content.lower() # Search for bow hold techniques bow_terms = ['bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'thumb position', 'finger position'] bow_found = [term for term in bow_terms if term in content_lower] if bow_found: print(f'\n üèπ BOW HOLD TECHNIQUES FOUND: {bow_found}') # Extract context for bow hold information for term in bow_found[:2]: # Show first 2 terms term_pos = content_lower.find(term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 200) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 400) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{term}":') print(f' {"-"*60}') print(f' {context.replace(chr(10), chr(10) + " ")}') print(f' {"-"*60}') # Search for vibrato information vibrato_terms = ['vibrato usage', 'vibrato debate', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools', 'vibrato argument'] vibrato_found = [term for term in vibrato_terms if term in content_lower] if vibrato_found: print(f'\n üéµ VIBRATO INFORMATION FOUND: {vibrato_found}') # Extract context for vibrato information for term in vibrato_found[:2]: # Show first 2 terms term_pos = content_lower.find(term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 200) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 400) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{term}":') print(f' {"-"*60}') print(f' {context.replace(chr(10), chr(10) + " ")}') print(f' {"-"*60}') # If no specific terms found, show a sample of the content if not bow_found and not vibrato_found: print(f' No specific technique terms found. Content preview:') print(f' {content[:300]}...') elif isinstance(content, dict): print(f' Content type: Dictionary with keys: {list(content.keys())}') # Look for source-specific content for key in content.keys(): if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['cambridge', 'german', 'researchgate', 'violin']): print(f'\n üìñ Relevant content in "{key}":') source_content = content[key] if isinstance(source_content, str): print(f' Length: {len(source_content):,} characters') print(f' Preview: {source_content[:200]}...') else: print(f' Type: {type(source_content)}') print(f' Content: {source_content}') # Look for analysis results if 'analysis_results' in data: print(f'\nüîç ANALYSIS RESULTS SECTION:') analysis = data['analysis_results'] if isinstance(analysis, dict): print(f' Analysis keys: {list(analysis.keys())}') for key, value in analysis.items(): if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['technique', 'bow', 'vibrato', 'german']): print(f'\n {key}: {value}') else: print(f' Analysis content: {analysis}') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON decode error: {e}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading file: {e}') else: print(f'‚ö†Ô∏è {target_file} not found in workspace') print(f'Available JSON files: {json_files[:5]}...') # Show first 5 # Also examine the Robin Stowell book verification file if it exists stowell_file = 'robin_stowell_book_verification.json' if stowell_file in json_files: print(f'\n=== INSPECTING {stowell_file} ===') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', stowell_file) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: stowell_data = json.load(f) print(f'‚úì Stowell data loaded successfully') print(f'Data type: {type(stowell_data)}') if isinstance(stowell_data, dict): print(f'Dictionary keys: {list(stowell_data.keys())}') # Examine each key's content for key, value in stowell_data.items(): print(f'\n "{key}": {type(value)}') if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict keys: {list(value.keys())}') # Show some content if it looks relevant if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['book', 'info', 'verification', 'content']): for subkey, subvalue in value.items(): print(f' {subkey}: {subvalue}') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') if len(value) < 200: print(f' Content: {value}') else: print(f' Preview: {value[:150]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value: print(f' First item: {value[0]}') else: print(f' Value: {value}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading Stowell file: {e}') # Summary of findings print(f'\n{"="*80}') print('WORKSPACE INSPECTION SUMMARY') print(f'{"="*80}') print(f'Objective: Locate and access Cambridge "Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin"') print(f' and ResearchGate "Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools"') print(f'\nWorkspace Status:') if 'workspace_files' in locals(): print(f' - Total files: {len(workspace_files)}') print(f' - Violin-related files: {len(violin_related_files)}') print(f' - JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f' - Priority JSON files examined: {len(priority_json_files) if priority_json_files else 0}') else: print(f' - Workspace not accessible') print(f'\nTarget Information Needed:') print(f' ‚úì Vibrato usage arguments (repertoire vs national schools)') print(f' ‚úì Bow hold techniques (bent thumb/curved pinkie)') print(f' ‚úì Publication years for source verification') print(f' ‚úì Exact content from Cambridge and ResearchGate sources') print(f'\nNext Steps Based on Findings:') if target_file in json_files if 'json_files' in locals() else []: print(f' 1. ‚úì Found comprehensive analysis file - extract source details') print(f' 2. Search for specific technique information in extracted content') print(f' 3. Verify publication years and access methods for target sources') else: print(f' 1. Examine other JSON files for source information') print(f' 2. Check text files for book recommendations') print(f' 3. Search for alternative access to target sources') print(f'\n‚úÖ WORKSPACE STRUCTURE INSPECTION COMPLETED') print(f'Timestamp: {datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")}')

Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError on line 28 due to undefined variable 'file' in the list comprehension. Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print('=== EXAMINING WORKSPACE FOR VIOLIN SCHOOL SOURCES ===') print('Objective: Access and analyze identified high-priority sources about German violin school techniques\n') # First, inspect what files are available in workspace if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f'Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)}):') for file in sorted(workspace_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print() else: print('No workspace directory found') os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory\n') # Look for any existing search results or source files that might contain the violin school information # Fixed the variable scope issue from previous attempt violin_related_files = [] if 'workspace_files' in locals(): for file in workspace_files: if any(keyword in file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'german', 'school', 'technique', 'bow', 'vibrato']): violin_related_files.append(file) if violin_related_files: print(f'Found {len(violin_related_files)} violin-related files:') for file in violin_related_files: print(f' - {file}') print() else: print('No violin-related files found in workspace\n') # Check for any JSON files that might contain search results or source information json_files = [] if 'workspace_files' in locals(): json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] if json_files: print(f'Found {len(json_files)} JSON files - inspecting structure first:') # Focus on the most promising JSON files first priority_json_files = [] for json_file in json_files: if any(keyword in json_file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'stowell', 'book', 'comprehensive']): priority_json_files.append(json_file) print(f'Priority JSON files ({len(priority_json_files)}): {priority_json_files}\n') # First, let's inspect the structure of the most comprehensive file target_file = 'violin_book_comprehensive_analysis.json' if target_file in json_files: print(f'=== INSPECTING STRUCTURE OF {target_file} ===') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_file) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'‚úì File loaded successfully') print(f'Data type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Dictionary with {len(data)} top-level keys:') for key in data.keys(): value = data[key] print(f' - "{key}": {type(value)}') # Show structure of complex values if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict with {len(value)} keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:3]}...') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') print(f' Preview: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' Value: {value}') print() # Now examine the content based on the structure we found print(f'=== DETAILED CONTENT ANALYSIS ===') # Look for sources information if 'sources' in data: sources = data['sources'] print(f'üìö SOURCES SECTION ({len(sources)} sources):') cambridge_found = False researchgate_found = False for i, source in enumerate(sources[:10], 1): # Check first 10 sources if isinstance(source, dict): title = source.get('title', 'No title') publisher = source.get('publisher', 'No publisher') url = source.get('url', 'No URL') year = source.get('year', 'No year') print(f'\n Source {i}:') print(f' Title: {title[:80]}...' if len(title) > 80 else f' Title: {title}') print(f' Publisher: {publisher}') print(f' Year: {year}') # Check for our target sources title_lower = title.lower() publisher_lower = publisher.lower() url_lower = url.lower() if ('cambridge' in publisher_lower and 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin' in title_lower: print(f' *** üéØ CAMBRIDGE TARGET FOUND ***') cambridge_found = True # Extract all available information about this source print(f' Full details:') for key, value in source.items(): print(f' {key}: {value}') elif ('researchgate' in url_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools' in title_lower: print(f' *** üéØ RESEARCHGATE TARGET FOUND ***') researchgate_found = True # Extract all available information about this source print(f' Full details:') for key, value in source.items(): print(f' {key}: {value}') elif 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower: print(f' üìñ Related German violin source') print(f'\nüìã TARGET SOURCE STATUS:') print(f' Cambridge source found: {cambridge_found}') print(f' ResearchGate source found: {researchgate_found}') # Look for extracted content or analysis if 'extracted_content' in data: print(f'\nüìÑ EXTRACTED CONTENT SECTION:') content = data['extracted_content'] if isinstance(content, str): print(f' Content type: String ({len(content):,} characters)') # Search for technique-specific information content_lower = content.lower() # Search for bow hold techniques bow_terms = ['bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'thumb position', 'finger position'] bow_found = [term for term in bow_terms if term in content_lower] if bow_found: print(f'\n üèπ BOW HOLD TECHNIQUES FOUND: {bow_found}') # Extract context for bow hold information for term in bow_found[:2]: # Show first 2 terms term_pos = content_lower.find(term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 200) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 400) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{term}":') print(f' {"-"*60}') print(f' {context.replace(chr(10), chr(10) + " ")}') print(f' {"-"*60}') # Search for vibrato information vibrato_terms = ['vibrato usage', 'vibrato debate', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools', 'vibrato argument'] vibrato_found = [term for term in vibrato_terms if term in content_lower] if vibrato_found: print(f'\n üéµ VIBRATO INFORMATION FOUND: {vibrato_found}') # Extract context for vibrato information for term in vibrato_found[:2]: # Show first 2 terms term_pos = content_lower.find(term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 200) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 400) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{term}":') print(f' {"-"*60}') print(f' {context.replace(chr(10), chr(10) + " ")}') print(f' {"-"*60}') # If no specific terms found, show a sample of the content if not bow_found and not vibrato_found: print(f' No specific technique terms found. Content preview:') print(f' {content[:300]}...') elif isinstance(content, dict): print(f' Content type: Dictionary with keys: {list(content.keys())}') # Look for source-specific content for key in content.keys(): if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['cambridge', 'german', 'researchgate', 'violin']): print(f'\n üìñ Relevant content in "{key}":') source_content = content[key] if isinstance(source_content, str): print(f' Length: {len(source_content):,} characters') print(f' Preview: {source_content[:200]}...') else: print(f' Type: {type(source_content)}') print(f' Content: {source_content}') # Look for analysis results if 'analysis_results' in data: print(f'\nüîç ANALYSIS RESULTS SECTION:') analysis = data['analysis_results'] if isinstance(analysis, dict): print(f' Analysis keys: {list(analysis.keys())}') for key, value in analysis.items(): if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['technique', 'bow', 'vibrato', 'german']): print(f'\n {key}: {value}') else: print(f' Analysis content: {analysis}') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON decode error: {e}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading file: {e}') else: print(f'‚ö†Ô∏è {target_file} not found in workspace') print(f'Available JSON files: {json_files[:5]}...') # Show first 5 # Also examine the Robin Stowell book verification file if it exists stowell_file = 'robin_stowell_book_verification.json' if stowell_file in json_files: print(f'\n=== INSPECTING {stowell_file} ===') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', stowell_file) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: stowell_data = json.load(f) print(f'‚úì Stowell data loaded successfully') print(f'Data type: {type(stowell_data)}') if isinstance(stowell_data, dict): print(f'Dictionary keys: {list(stowell_data.keys())}') # Examine each key's content for key, value in stowell_data.items(): print(f'\n "{key}": {type(value)}') if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict keys: {list(value.keys())}') # Show some content if it looks relevant if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['book', 'info', 'verification', 'content']): for subkey, subvalue in value.items(): print(f' {subkey}: {subvalue}') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') if len(value) < 200: print(f' Content: {value}') else: print(f' Preview: {value[:150]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value: print(f' First item: {value[0]}') else: print(f' Value: {value}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading Stowell file: {e}') # Summary of findings print(f'\n{"="*80}') print('WORKSPACE INSPECTION SUMMARY') print(f'{"="*80}') print(f'Objective: Locate and access Cambridge "Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin"') print(f' and ResearchGate "Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools"') print(f'\nWorkspace Status:') if 'workspace_files' in locals(): print(f' - Total files: {len(workspace_files)}') print(f' - Violin-related files: {len(violin_related_files)}') print(f' - JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f' - Priority JSON files examined: {len(priority_json_files) if priority_json_files else 0}') else: print(f' - Workspace not accessible') print(f'\nTarget Information Needed:') print(f' ‚úì Vibrato usage arguments (repertoire vs national schools)') print(f' ‚úì Bow hold techniques (bent thumb/curved pinkie)') print(f' ‚úì Publication years for source verification') print(f' ‚úì Exact content from Cambridge and ResearchGate sources') print(f'\nNext Steps Based on Findings:') if target_file in json_files if 'json_files' in locals() else []: print(f' 1. ‚úì Found comprehensive analysis file - extract source details') print(f' 2. Search for specific technique information in extracted content') print(f' 3. Verify publication years and access methods for target sources') else: print(f' 1. Examine other JSON files for source information') print(f' 2. Check text files for book recommendations') print(f' 3. Search for alternative access to target sources') print(f'\n‚úÖ WORKSPACE STRUCTURE INSPECTION COMPLETED') print(f'Timestamp: {datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")}')

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print('=== EXAMINING WORKSPACE FOR VIOLIN SCHOOL SOURCES ===') print('Objective: Access and analyze identified high-priority sources about German violin school techniques\n') # First, inspect what files are available in workspace if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f'Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)}):') for file in sorted(workspace_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print() else: print('No workspace directory found') os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory\n') # Look for violin-related files - fixed variable scope issue violin_related_files = [] for file in workspace_files: if any(keyword in file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'german', 'school', 'technique', 'bow', 'vibrato']): violin_related_files.append(file) print(f'Found {len(violin_related_files)} violin-related files:') for file in violin_related_files: print(f' - {file}') print() # Identify JSON files for analysis json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Found {len(json_files)} JSON files total') # Focus on the most promising JSON files first priority_json_files = [] for json_file in json_files: if any(keyword in json_file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'stowell', 'book', 'comprehensive']): priority_json_files.append(json_file) print(f'Priority JSON files ({len(priority_json_files)}): {priority_json_files}\n') # First, let's inspect the structure of the comprehensive analysis file target_file = 'violin_book_comprehensive_analysis.json' if target_file in json_files: print(f'=== INSPECTING STRUCTURE OF {target_file} ===\n') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_file) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'‚úì File loaded successfully') print(f'Data type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Dictionary with {len(data)} top-level keys:') for key in data.keys(): value = data[key] print(f' - "{key}": {type(value)}') # Show structure of complex values if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict with {len(value)} keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:3]}...') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') if len(value) < 100: print(f' Content: {value}') else: print(f' Preview: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' Value: {value}') print() # Now examine the content for our target sources print(f'=== SEARCHING FOR TARGET SOURCES ===\n') # Convert entire data to string for comprehensive search data_str = str(data).lower() # Search for Cambridge source cambridge_indicators = [ 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin', 'cambridge university press', 'cambridge', 'german classical school' ] cambridge_found = [] for indicator in cambridge_indicators: if indicator in data_str: cambridge_found.append(indicator) if cambridge_found: print(f'üéØ CAMBRIDGE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {cambridge_found}') else: print('‚ùå No Cambridge source indicators found') # Search for ResearchGate source researchgate_indicators = [ 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools', 'researchgate', 'various violin playing schools' ] researchgate_found = [] for indicator in researchgate_indicators: if indicator in data_str: researchgate_found.append(indicator) if researchgate_found: print(f'üéØ RESEARCHGATE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {researchgate_found}') else: print('‚ùå No ResearchGate source indicators found') # Search for technique-specific terms technique_indicators = [ 'bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'vibrato usage', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools' ] technique_found = [] for indicator in technique_indicators: if indicator in data_str: technique_found.append(indicator) if technique_found: print(f'üéº TECHNIQUE INDICATORS FOUND: {technique_found}') else: print('‚ùå No specific technique indicators found') print() # If we found relevant content, extract it if cambridge_found or researchgate_found or technique_found: print(f'=== EXTRACTING RELEVANT CONTENT ===\n') # Look for sources section if 'sources' in data: sources = data['sources'] print(f'üìö EXAMINING SOURCES SECTION ({len(sources)} sources):') relevant_sources = [] for i, source in enumerate(sources, 1): if isinstance(source, dict): title = source.get('title', 'No title') publisher = source.get('publisher', 'No publisher') url = source.get('url', 'No URL') year = source.get('year', 'No year') # Check if this source matches our targets title_lower = title.lower() publisher_lower = publisher.lower() url_lower = url.lower() is_relevant = False source_type = '' if ('cambridge' in publisher_lower and 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'CAMBRIDGE TARGET' elif ('researchgate' in url_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'RESEARCHGATE TARGET' elif 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'GERMAN VIOLIN RELATED' if is_relevant: print(f'\n *** {source_type} - Source {i} ***') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' Publisher: {publisher}') print(f' Year: {year}') print(f' URL: {url}') # Extract all available fields print(f' All fields:') for key, value in source.items(): if key not in ['title', 'publisher', 'year', 'url']: print(f' {key}: {value}') relevant_sources.append({ 'source_type': source_type, 'index': i, 'data': source }) print(f'\nüìã RELEVANT SOURCES SUMMARY:') print(f' Total relevant sources found: {len(relevant_sources)}') cambridge_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'CAMBRIDGE' in s['source_type']] researchgate_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'RESEARCHGATE' in s['source_type']] print(f' Cambridge sources: {len(cambridge_sources)}') print(f' ResearchGate sources: {len(researchgate_sources)}') # Look for extracted content if 'extracted_content' in data: print(f'\nüìÑ EXAMINING EXTRACTED CONTENT SECTION:') content = data['extracted_content'] if isinstance(content, str): print(f' Content type: String ({len(content):,} characters)') # Search for specific technique information content_lower = content.lower() # Search for bow hold techniques bow_terms = ['bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'thumb position'] bow_found_terms = [term for term in bow_terms if term in content_lower] if bow_found_terms: print(f'\n üèπ BOW HOLD TECHNIQUES FOUND: {bow_found_terms}') # Extract context for first bow hold term first_term = bow_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # Search for vibrato information vibrato_terms = ['vibrato usage', 'vibrato debate', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools'] vibrato_found_terms = [term for term in vibrato_terms if term in content_lower] if vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n üéµ VIBRATO INFORMATION FOUND: {vibrato_found_terms}') # Extract context for first vibrato term first_term = vibrato_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # If no specific terms found, show general content sample if not bow_found_terms and not vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n No specific technique terms found. General content sample:') print(f' {content[:400]}...') elif isinstance(content, dict): print(f' Content type: Dictionary with keys: {list(content.keys())}') # Look for source-specific content for key in content.keys(): if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['cambridge', 'german', 'researchgate', 'violin']): print(f'\n üìñ Relevant content in "{key}":') source_content = content[key] if isinstance(source_content, str): print(f' Length: {len(source_content):,} characters') if len(source_content) < 300: print(f' Content: {source_content}') else: print(f' Preview: {source_content[:250]}...') else: print(f' Type: {type(source_content)}') print(f' Content: {source_content}') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON decode error: {e}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading file: {e}') else: print(f'‚ö†Ô∏è {target_file} not found in workspace') print(f'Available JSON files: {json_files[:5]}...') # Show first 5 print(f'\n{"="*80}') print('WORKSPACE EXAMINATION SUMMARY') print(f'{"="*80}') print(f'Objective: Locate Cambridge "Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin"') print(f' and ResearchGate "Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools"') print(f'\nWorkspace Status:') print(f' - Total files: {len(workspace_files)}') print(f' - Violin-related files: {len(violin_related_files)}') print(f' - JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f' - Priority JSON files: {len(priority_json_files)}') print(f'\nTarget Information Needed:') print(f' ‚úì Vibrato usage arguments (repertoire vs national schools)') print(f' ‚úì Bow hold techniques (bent thumb/curved pinkie)') print(f' ‚úì Publication years for source verification') print(f' ‚úì Exact content from Cambridge and ResearchGate sources') print(f'\nNext Steps:') if target_file in json_files: print(f' 1. ‚úì Examined comprehensive analysis file') print(f' 2. Continue with other priority JSON files if needed') print(f' 3. Extract specific technique information and publication details') else: print(f' 1. Examine other JSON files for source information') print(f' 2. Check text files for book recommendations') print(f' 3. Search for alternative access to target sources') print(f'\n‚úÖ WORKSPACE EXAMINATION COMPLETED') print(f'Timestamp: {datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")}')

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print('=== EXAMINING WORKSPACE FOR VIOLIN SCHOOL SOURCES ===') print('Objective: Access and analyze identified high-priority sources about German violin school techniques\n') # First, inspect what files are available in workspace if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f'Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)}):') for file in sorted(workspace_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file) if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print() else: print('No workspace directory found') os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory\n') # Look for violin-related files - fixed variable scope issue violin_related_files = [] for file in workspace_files: if any(keyword in file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'german', 'school', 'technique', 'bow', 'vibrato']): violin_related_files.append(file) print(f'Found {len(violin_related_files)} violin-related files:') for file in violin_related_files: print(f' - {file}') print() # Identify JSON files for analysis json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Found {len(json_files)} JSON files total') # Focus on the most promising JSON files first priority_json_files = [] for json_file in json_files: if any(keyword in json_file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'stowell', 'book', 'comprehensive']): priority_json_files.append(json_file) print(f'Priority JSON files ({len(priority_json_files)}): {priority_json_files}\n') # First, let's inspect the structure of the comprehensive analysis file target_file = 'violin_book_comprehensive_analysis.json' if target_file in json_files: print(f'=== INSPECTING STRUCTURE OF {target_file} ===\n') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_file) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: data = json.load(f) print(f'‚úì File loaded successfully') print(f'Data type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Dictionary with {len(data)} top-level keys:') for key in data.keys(): value = data[key] print(f' - "{key}": {type(value)}') # Show structure of complex values if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict with {len(value)} keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:3]}...') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') if len(value) < 100: print(f' Content: {value}') else: print(f' Preview: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' Value: {value}') print() # Now examine the content for our target sources print(f'=== SEARCHING FOR TARGET SOURCES ===\n') # Convert entire data to string for comprehensive search data_str = str(data).lower() # Search for Cambridge source cambridge_indicators = [ 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin', 'cambridge university press', 'cambridge', 'german classical school' ] cambridge_found = [] for indicator in cambridge_indicators: if indicator in data_str: cambridge_found.append(indicator) if cambridge_found: print(f'üéØ CAMBRIDGE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {cambridge_found}') else: print('‚ùå No Cambridge source indicators found') # Search for ResearchGate source researchgate_indicators = [ 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools', 'researchgate', 'various violin playing schools' ] researchgate_found = [] for indicator in researchgate_indicators: if indicator in data_str: researchgate_found.append(indicator) if researchgate_found: print(f'üéØ RESEARCHGATE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {researchgate_found}') else: print('‚ùå No ResearchGate source indicators found') # Search for technique-specific terms technique_indicators = [ 'bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'vibrato usage', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools' ] technique_found = [] for indicator in technique_indicators: if indicator in data_str: technique_found.append(indicator) if technique_found: print(f'üéº TECHNIQUE INDICATORS FOUND: {technique_found}') else: print('‚ùå No specific technique indicators found') print() # If we found relevant content, extract it if cambridge_found or researchgate_found or technique_found: print(f'=== EXTRACTING RELEVANT CONTENT ===\n') # Look for sources section if 'sources' in data: sources = data['sources'] print(f'üìö EXAMINING SOURCES SECTION ({len(sources)} sources):') relevant_sources = [] for i, source in enumerate(sources, 1): if isinstance(source, dict): title = source.get('title', 'No title') publisher = source.get('publisher', 'No publisher') url = source.get('url', 'No URL') year = source.get('year', 'No year') # Check if this source matches our targets title_lower = title.lower() publisher_lower = publisher.lower() url_lower = url.lower() is_relevant = False source_type = '' if ('cambridge' in publisher_lower and 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'CAMBRIDGE TARGET' elif ('researchgate' in url_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'RESEARCHGATE TARGET' elif 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'GERMAN VIOLIN RELATED' if is_relevant: print(f'\n *** {source_type} - Source {i} ***') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' Publisher: {publisher}') print(f' Year: {year}') print(f' URL: {url}') # Extract all available fields print(f' All fields:') for key, value in source.items(): if key not in ['title', 'publisher', 'year', 'url']: print(f' {key}: {value}') relevant_sources.append({ 'source_type': source_type, 'index': i, 'data': source }) print(f'\nüìã RELEVANT SOURCES SUMMARY:') print(f' Total relevant sources found: {len(relevant_sources)}') cambridge_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'CAMBRIDGE' in s['source_type']] researchgate_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'RESEARCHGATE' in s['source_type']] print(f' Cambridge sources: {len(cambridge_sources)}') print(f' ResearchGate sources: {len(researchgate_sources)}') # Look for extracted content if 'extracted_content' in data: print(f'\nüìÑ EXAMINING EXTRACTED CONTENT SECTION:') content = data['extracted_content'] if isinstance(content, str): print(f' Content type: String ({len(content):,} characters)') # Search for specific technique information content_lower = content.lower() # Search for bow hold techniques bow_terms = ['bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'thumb position'] bow_found_terms = [term for term in bow_terms if term in content_lower] if bow_found_terms: print(f'\n üèπ BOW HOLD TECHNIQUES FOUND: {bow_found_terms}') # Extract context for first bow hold term first_term = bow_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # Search for vibrato information vibrato_terms = ['vibrato usage', 'vibrato debate', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools'] vibrato_found_terms = [term for term in vibrato_terms if term in content_lower] if vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n üéµ VIBRATO INFORMATION FOUND: {vibrato_found_terms}') # Extract context for first vibrato term first_term = vibrato_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # If no specific terms found, show general content sample if not bow_found_terms and not vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n No specific technique terms found. General content sample:') print(f' {content[:400]}...') elif isinstance(content, dict): print(f' Content type: Dictionary with keys: {list(content.keys())}') # Look for source-specific content for key in content.keys(): if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['cambridge', 'german', 'researchgate', 'violin']): print(f'\n üìñ Relevant content in "{key}":') source_content = content[key] if isinstance(source_content, str): print(f' Length: {len(source_content):,} characters') if len(source_content) < 300: print(f' Content: {source_content}') else: print(f' Preview: {source_content[:250]}...') else: print(f' Type: {type(source_content)}') print(f' Content: {source_content}') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON decode error: {e}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading file: {e}') else: print(f'‚ö†Ô∏è {target_file} not found in workspace') print(f'Available JSON files: {json_files[:5]}...') # Show first 5 print(f'\n{"="*80}') print('WORKSPACE EXAMINATION SUMMARY') print(f'{"="*80}') print(f'Objective: Locate Cambridge "Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin"') print(f' and ResearchGate "Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools"') print(f'\nWorkspace Status:') print(f' - Total files: {len(workspace_files)}') print(f' - Violin-related files: {len(violin_related_files)}') print(f' - JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f' - Priority JSON files: {len(priority_json_files)}') print(f'\nTarget Information Needed:') print(f' ‚úì Vibrato usage arguments (repertoire vs national schools)') print(f' ‚úì Bow hold techniques (bent thumb/curved pinkie)') print(f' ‚úì Publication years for source verification') print(f' ‚úì Exact content from Cambridge and ResearchGate sources') print(f'\nNext Steps:') if target_file in json_files: print(f' 1. ‚úì Examined comprehensive analysis file') print(f' 2. Continue with other priority JSON files if needed') print(f' 3. Extract specific technique information and publication details') else: print(f' 1. Examine other JSON files for source information') print(f' 2. Check text files for book recommendations') print(f' 3. Search for alternative access to target sources') print(f'\n‚úÖ WORKSPACE EXAMINATION COMPLETED') print(f'Timestamp: {datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")}')

Code Execution - Plan #4 (Iteration 5)

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print('=== EXAMINING WORKSPACE FOR VIOLIN SCHOOL SOURCES ===') print('Objective: Access and analyze identified high-priority sources about German violin school techniques\n') # First, inspect what files are available in workspace if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f'Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)}):') for filename in sorted(workspace_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', filename) if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print() else: print('No workspace directory found') os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory\n') # Look for violin-related files - properly scoped variables violin_related_files = [] for filename in workspace_files: if any(keyword in filename.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'german', 'school', 'technique', 'bow', 'vibrato']): violin_related_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(violin_related_files)} violin-related files:') for filename in violin_related_files: print(f' - {filename}') print() # Identify JSON files for analysis json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Found {len(json_files)} JSON files total') # Focus on the most promising JSON files first priority_json_files = [] for json_file in json_files: if any(keyword in json_file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'stowell', 'book', 'comprehensive']): priority_json_files.append(json_file) print(f'Priority JSON files ({len(priority_json_files)}): {priority_json_files}\n') # First, let's inspect the structure of the comprehensive analysis file target_file = 'violin_book_comprehensive_analysis.json' if target_file in json_files: print(f'=== INSPECTING STRUCTURE OF {target_file} ===\n') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_file) try: # First, just peek at the file structure without assuming content with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: raw_content = f.read() print(f'‚úì File read successfully') print(f'Raw file size: {len(raw_content):,} characters') print(f'First 200 characters: {raw_content[:200]}...') print() # Now try to parse as JSON try: data = json.loads(raw_content) print(f'‚úì JSON parsing successful') print(f'Data type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Dictionary with {len(data)} top-level keys:') for key in data.keys(): value = data[key] print(f' - "{key}": {type(value)}') # Show structure of complex values if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict with {len(value)} keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:3]}...') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') if len(value) < 100: print(f' Content: {value}') else: print(f' Preview: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' Value: {value}') print() # Now examine the content for our target sources print(f'=== SEARCHING FOR TARGET SOURCES ===\n') # Convert entire data to string for comprehensive search data_str = str(data).lower() # Search for Cambridge source cambridge_indicators = [ 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin', 'cambridge university press', 'cambridge', 'german classical school' ] cambridge_found = [] for indicator in cambridge_indicators: if indicator in data_str: cambridge_found.append(indicator) if cambridge_found: print(f'üéØ CAMBRIDGE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {cambridge_found}') else: print('‚ùå No Cambridge source indicators found') # Search for ResearchGate source researchgate_indicators = [ 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools', 'researchgate', 'various violin playing schools' ] researchgate_found = [] for indicator in researchgate_indicators: if indicator in data_str: researchgate_found.append(indicator) if researchgate_found: print(f'üéØ RESEARCHGATE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {researchgate_found}') else: print('‚ùå No ResearchGate source indicators found') # Search for technique-specific terms technique_indicators = [ 'bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'vibrato usage', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools' ] technique_found = [] for indicator in technique_indicators: if indicator in data_str: technique_found.append(indicator) if technique_found: print(f'üéº TECHNIQUE INDICATORS FOUND: {technique_found}') else: print('‚ùå No specific technique indicators found') print() # If we found relevant content, extract it based on the structure we discovered if cambridge_found or researchgate_found or technique_found: print(f'=== EXTRACTING RELEVANT CONTENT ===\n') # Look for sources section if it exists if 'sources' in data: sources = data['sources'] print(f'üìö EXAMINING SOURCES SECTION ({len(sources)} sources):') relevant_sources = [] for i, source in enumerate(sources, 1): if isinstance(source, dict): # Get available fields without assuming structure available_fields = list(source.keys()) print(f'\n Source {i} fields: {available_fields}') # Extract common fields if they exist title = source.get('title', 'No title') publisher = source.get('publisher', 'No publisher') url = source.get('url', 'No URL') year = source.get('year', 'No year') # Check if this source matches our targets title_lower = title.lower() publisher_lower = publisher.lower() url_lower = url.lower() is_relevant = False source_type = '' if ('cambridge' in publisher_lower and 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'CAMBRIDGE TARGET' elif ('researchgate' in url_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'RESEARCHGATE TARGET' elif 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'GERMAN VIOLIN RELATED' if is_relevant: print(f'\n *** {source_type} - Source {i} ***') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' Publisher: {publisher}') print(f' Year: {year}') print(f' URL: {url}') # Extract all available fields print(f' All available fields:') for key, value in source.items(): if key not in ['title', 'publisher', 'year', 'url']: print(f' {key}: {value}') relevant_sources.append({ 'source_type': source_type, 'index': i, 'data': source }) print(f'\nüìã RELEVANT SOURCES SUMMARY:') print(f' Total relevant sources found: {len(relevant_sources)}') cambridge_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'CAMBRIDGE' in s['source_type']] researchgate_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'RESEARCHGATE' in s['source_type']] print(f' Cambridge sources: {len(cambridge_sources)}') print(f' ResearchGate sources: {len(researchgate_sources)}') # Look for extracted content if it exists if 'extracted_content' in data: print(f'\nüìÑ EXAMINING EXTRACTED CONTENT SECTION:') content = data['extracted_content'] if isinstance(content, str): print(f' Content type: String ({len(content):,} characters)') # Search for specific technique information content_lower = content.lower() # Search for bow hold techniques bow_terms = ['bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'thumb position'] bow_found_terms = [term for term in bow_terms if term in content_lower] if bow_found_terms: print(f'\n üèπ BOW HOLD TECHNIQUES FOUND: {bow_found_terms}') # Extract context for first bow hold term first_term = bow_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # Search for vibrato information vibrato_terms = ['vibrato usage', 'vibrato debate', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools'] vibrato_found_terms = [term for term in vibrato_terms if term in content_lower] if vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n üéµ VIBRATO INFORMATION FOUND: {vibrato_found_terms}') # Extract context for first vibrato term first_term = vibrato_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # If no specific terms found, show general content sample if not bow_found_terms and not vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n No specific technique terms found. General content sample:') print(f' {content[:400]}...') elif isinstance(content, dict): print(f' Content type: Dictionary with keys: {list(content.keys())}') # Look for source-specific content for key in content.keys(): if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['cambridge', 'german', 'researchgate', 'violin']): print(f'\n üìñ Relevant content in "{key}":') source_content = content[key] if isinstance(source_content, str): print(f' Length: {len(source_content):,} characters') if len(source_content) < 300: print(f' Content: {source_content}') else: print(f' Preview: {source_content[:250]}...') else: print(f' Type: {type(source_content)}') print(f' Content: {source_content}') elif isinstance(data, list): print(f'Data is a list with {len(data)} items') if data: print(f'First item type: {type(data[0])}') if isinstance(data[0], dict): print(f'First item keys: {list(data[0].keys())}') else: print(f'Data is of type: {type(data)}') print(f'Content preview: {str(data)[:300]}...') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON decode error: {e}') print('File content is not valid JSON') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading file: {e}') else: print(f'‚ö†Ô∏è {target_file} not found in workspace') print(f'Available JSON files: {json_files[:5]}...') # Show first 5 print(f'\n{"="*80}') print('WORKSPACE EXAMINATION SUMMARY') print(f'{"="*80}') print(f'Objective: Locate Cambridge "Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin"') print(f' and ResearchGate "Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools"') print(f'\nWorkspace Status:') print(f' - Total files: {len(workspace_files)}') print(f' - Violin-related files: {len(violin_related_files)}') print(f' - JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f' - Priority JSON files: {len(priority_json_files)}') print(f'\nTarget Information Needed:') print(f' ‚úì Vibrato usage arguments (repertoire vs national schools)') print(f' ‚úì Bow hold techniques (bent thumb/curved pinkie)') print(f' ‚úì Publication years for source verification') print(f' ‚úì Exact content from Cambridge and ResearchGate sources') print(f'\nNext Steps:') if target_file in json_files: print(f' 1. ‚úì Examined comprehensive analysis file structure') print(f' 2. Continue with other priority JSON files if needed') print(f' 3. Extract specific technique information and publication details') else: print(f' 1. Examine other JSON files for source information') print(f' 2. Check text files for book recommendations') print(f' 3. Search for alternative access to target sources') print(f'\n‚úÖ WORKSPACE EXAMINATION COMPLETED') print(f'Timestamp: {datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")}')

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError on line 26 due to undefined variable 'filename' in the list comprehension. The code successfully listed 100 files in the workspace directory, showing extensive violin-related research files including the target 'violin_book_comprehensive_analysis.json' (6,970 bytes), 'robin_stowell_book_verification.json' (6,049 bytes), and multiple other relevant files. However, execution stopped when filtering violin-related files because the variable 'filename' wasn't properly defined in the generator expression scope. **PLAN** alignment: 15% - workspace inventory completed but file analysis couldn't proceed due to variable scope error. The workspace clearly contains the research data needed to locate the Cambridge and ResearchGate sources. Recommended fix: Replace the problematic list comprehension on line 26 with a proper for loop using the correct variable name from the workspace_files iteration, or fix the variable reference to use 'file' consistently throughout the filtering logic.
Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print('=== EXAMINING WORKSPACE FOR VIOLIN SCHOOL SOURCES ===') print('Objective: Access and analyze identified high-priority sources about German violin school techniques\n') # First, inspect what files are available in workspace if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f'Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)}):') for filename in sorted(workspace_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', filename) if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print() else: print('No workspace directory found') os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory\n') # Look for violin-related files - properly scoped variables violin_related_files = [] for filename in workspace_files: if any(keyword in filename.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'german', 'school', 'technique', 'bow', 'vibrato']): violin_related_files.append(filename) print(f'Found {len(violin_related_files)} violin-related files:') for filename in violin_related_files: print(f' - {filename}') print() # Identify JSON files for analysis json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Found {len(json_files)} JSON files total') # Focus on the most promising JSON files first priority_json_files = [] for json_file in json_files: if any(keyword in json_file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'stowell', 'book', 'comprehensive']): priority_json_files.append(json_file) print(f'Priority JSON files ({len(priority_json_files)}): {priority_json_files}\n') # First, let's inspect the structure of the comprehensive analysis file target_file = 'violin_book_comprehensive_analysis.json' if target_file in json_files: print(f'=== INSPECTING STRUCTURE OF {target_file} ===\n') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_file) try: # First, just peek at the file structure without assuming content with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: raw_content = f.read() print(f'‚úì File read successfully') print(f'Raw file size: {len(raw_content):,} characters') print(f'First 200 characters: {raw_content[:200]}...') print() # Now try to parse as JSON try: data = json.loads(raw_content) print(f'‚úì JSON parsing successful') print(f'Data type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Dictionary with {len(data)} top-level keys:') for key in data.keys(): value = data[key] print(f' - "{key}": {type(value)}') # Show structure of complex values if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict with {len(value)} keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:3]}...') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') if len(value) < 100: print(f' Content: {value}') else: print(f' Preview: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' Value: {value}') print() # Now examine the content for our target sources print(f'=== SEARCHING FOR TARGET SOURCES ===\n') # Convert entire data to string for comprehensive search data_str = str(data).lower() # Search for Cambridge source cambridge_indicators = [ 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin', 'cambridge university press', 'cambridge', 'german classical school' ] cambridge_found = [] for indicator in cambridge_indicators: if indicator in data_str: cambridge_found.append(indicator) if cambridge_found: print(f'üéØ CAMBRIDGE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {cambridge_found}') else: print('‚ùå No Cambridge source indicators found') # Search for ResearchGate source researchgate_indicators = [ 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools', 'researchgate', 'various violin playing schools' ] researchgate_found = [] for indicator in researchgate_indicators: if indicator in data_str: researchgate_found.append(indicator) if researchgate_found: print(f'üéØ RESEARCHGATE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {researchgate_found}') else: print('‚ùå No ResearchGate source indicators found') # Search for technique-specific terms technique_indicators = [ 'bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'vibrato usage', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools' ] technique_found = [] for indicator in technique_indicators: if indicator in data_str: technique_found.append(indicator) if technique_found: print(f'üéº TECHNIQUE INDICATORS FOUND: {technique_found}') else: print('‚ùå No specific technique indicators found') print() # If we found relevant content, extract it based on the structure we discovered if cambridge_found or researchgate_found or technique_found: print(f'=== EXTRACTING RELEVANT CONTENT ===\n') # Look for sources section if it exists if 'sources' in data: sources = data['sources'] print(f'üìö EXAMINING SOURCES SECTION ({len(sources)} sources):') relevant_sources = [] for i, source in enumerate(sources, 1): if isinstance(source, dict): # Get available fields without assuming structure available_fields = list(source.keys()) print(f'\n Source {i} fields: {available_fields}') # Extract common fields if they exist title = source.get('title', 'No title') publisher = source.get('publisher', 'No publisher') url = source.get('url', 'No URL') year = source.get('year', 'No year') # Check if this source matches our targets title_lower = title.lower() publisher_lower = publisher.lower() url_lower = url.lower() is_relevant = False source_type = '' if ('cambridge' in publisher_lower and 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'CAMBRIDGE TARGET' elif ('researchgate' in url_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'RESEARCHGATE TARGET' elif 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'GERMAN VIOLIN RELATED' if is_relevant: print(f'\n *** {source_type} - Source {i} ***') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' Publisher: {publisher}') print(f' Year: {year}') print(f' URL: {url}') # Extract all available fields print(f' All available fields:') for key, value in source.items(): if key not in ['title', 'publisher', 'year', 'url']: print(f' {key}: {value}') relevant_sources.append({ 'source_type': source_type, 'index': i, 'data': source }) print(f'\nüìã RELEVANT SOURCES SUMMARY:') print(f' Total relevant sources found: {len(relevant_sources)}') cambridge_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'CAMBRIDGE' in s['source_type']] researchgate_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'RESEARCHGATE' in s['source_type']] print(f' Cambridge sources: {len(cambridge_sources)}') print(f' ResearchGate sources: {len(researchgate_sources)}') # Look for extracted content if it exists if 'extracted_content' in data: print(f'\nüìÑ EXAMINING EXTRACTED CONTENT SECTION:') content = data['extracted_content'] if isinstance(content, str): print(f' Content type: String ({len(content):,} characters)') # Search for specific technique information content_lower = content.lower() # Search for bow hold techniques bow_terms = ['bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'thumb position'] bow_found_terms = [term for term in bow_terms if term in content_lower] if bow_found_terms: print(f'\n üèπ BOW HOLD TECHNIQUES FOUND: {bow_found_terms}') # Extract context for first bow hold term first_term = bow_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # Search for vibrato information vibrato_terms = ['vibrato usage', 'vibrato debate', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools'] vibrato_found_terms = [term for term in vibrato_terms if term in content_lower] if vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n üéµ VIBRATO INFORMATION FOUND: {vibrato_found_terms}') # Extract context for first vibrato term first_term = vibrato_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # If no specific terms found, show general content sample if not bow_found_terms and not vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n No specific technique terms found. General content sample:') print(f' {content[:400]}...') elif isinstance(content, dict): print(f' Content type: Dictionary with keys: {list(content.keys())}') # Look for source-specific content for key in content.keys(): if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['cambridge', 'german', 'researchgate', 'violin']): print(f'\n üìñ Relevant content in "{key}":') source_content = content[key] if isinstance(source_content, str): print(f' Length: {len(source_content):,} characters') if len(source_content) < 300: print(f' Content: {source_content}') else: print(f' Preview: {source_content[:250]}...') else: print(f' Type: {type(source_content)}') print(f' Content: {source_content}') elif isinstance(data, list): print(f'Data is a list with {len(data)} items') if data: print(f'First item type: {type(data[0])}') if isinstance(data[0], dict): print(f'First item keys: {list(data[0].keys())}') else: print(f'Data is of type: {type(data)}') print(f'Content preview: {str(data)[:300]}...') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON decode error: {e}') print('File content is not valid JSON') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading file: {e}') else: print(f'‚ö†Ô∏è {target_file} not found in workspace') print(f'Available JSON files: {json_files[:5]}...') # Show first 5 print(f'\n{"="*80}') print('WORKSPACE EXAMINATION SUMMARY') print(f'{"="*80}') print(f'Objective: Locate Cambridge "Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin"') print(f' and ResearchGate "Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools"') print(f'\nWorkspace Status:') print(f' - Total files: {len(workspace_files)}') print(f' - Violin-related files: {len(violin_related_files)}') print(f' - JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f' - Priority JSON files: {len(priority_json_files)}') print(f'\nTarget Information Needed:') print(f' ‚úì Vibrato usage arguments (repertoire vs national schools)') print(f' ‚úì Bow hold techniques (bent thumb/curved pinkie)') print(f' ‚úì Publication years for source verification') print(f' ‚úì Exact content from Cambridge and ResearchGate sources') print(f'\nNext Steps:') if target_file in json_files: print(f' 1. ‚úì Examined comprehensive analysis file structure') print(f' 2. Continue with other priority JSON files if needed') print(f' 3. Extract specific technique information and publication details') else: print(f' 1. Examine other JSON files for source information') print(f' 2. Check text files for book recommendations') print(f' 3. Search for alternative access to target sources') print(f'\n‚úÖ WORKSPACE EXAMINATION COMPLETED') print(f'Timestamp: {datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")}')

Python Code python
import os import json from datetime import datetime print('=== EXAMINING WORKSPACE FOR VIOLIN SCHOOL SOURCES ===') print('Objective: Access and analyze identified high-priority sources about German violin school techniques\n') # First, inspect what files are available in workspace if os.path.exists('workspace'): workspace_files = os.listdir('workspace') print(f'Files in workspace ({len(workspace_files)}):') for file_item in sorted(workspace_files): file_path = os.path.join('workspace', file_item) if os.path.isfile(file_path): file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f' - {file_item} ({file_size:,} bytes)') print() else: print('No workspace directory found') os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True) print('Created workspace directory\n') # Look for violin-related files - using correct variable scoping violin_related_files = [] for file_item in workspace_files: if any(keyword in file_item.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'german', 'school', 'technique', 'bow', 'vibrato']): violin_related_files.append(file_item) print(f'Found {len(violin_related_files)} violin-related files:') for file_item in violin_related_files: print(f' - {file_item}') print() # Identify JSON files for analysis json_files = [f for f in workspace_files if f.endswith('.json')] print(f'Found {len(json_files)} JSON files total') # Focus on the most promising JSON files first priority_json_files = [] for json_file in json_files: if any(keyword in json_file.lower() for keyword in ['violin', 'stowell', 'book', 'comprehensive']): priority_json_files.append(json_file) print(f'Priority JSON files ({len(priority_json_files)}): {priority_json_files}\n') # First, let's inspect the structure of the comprehensive analysis file target_file = 'violin_book_comprehensive_analysis.json' if target_file in json_files: print(f'=== INSPECTING STRUCTURE OF {target_file} ===\n') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', target_file) try: # First, just peek at the file structure without assuming content with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: raw_content = f.read() print(f'‚úì File read successfully') print(f'Raw file size: {len(raw_content):,} characters') print(f'First 300 characters: {raw_content[:300]}...') print() # Now try to parse as JSON try: data = json.loads(raw_content) print(f'‚úì JSON parsing successful') print(f'Data type: {type(data)}') if isinstance(data, dict): print(f'Dictionary with {len(data)} top-level keys:') for key in data.keys(): value = data[key] print(f' - "{key}": {type(value)}') # Show structure of complex values if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict with {len(value)} keys: {list(value.keys())[:5]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value and isinstance(value[0], dict): print(f' First item keys: {list(value[0].keys())[:3]}...') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') if len(value) < 100: print(f' Content: {value}') else: print(f' Preview: {value[:100]}...') else: print(f' Value: {value}') print() # Now examine the content for our target sources print(f'=== SEARCHING FOR TARGET SOURCES ===\n') # Convert entire data to string for comprehensive search data_str = str(data).lower() # Search for Cambridge source cambridge_indicators = [ 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin', 'cambridge university press', 'cambridge', 'german classical school' ] cambridge_found = [] for indicator in cambridge_indicators: if indicator in data_str: cambridge_found.append(indicator) if cambridge_found: print(f'üéØ CAMBRIDGE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {cambridge_found}') else: print('‚ùå No Cambridge source indicators found') # Search for ResearchGate source researchgate_indicators = [ 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools', 'researchgate', 'various violin playing schools' ] researchgate_found = [] for indicator in researchgate_indicators: if indicator in data_str: researchgate_found.append(indicator) if researchgate_found: print(f'üéØ RESEARCHGATE SOURCE INDICATORS FOUND: {researchgate_found}') else: print('‚ùå No ResearchGate source indicators found') # Search for technique-specific terms technique_indicators = [ 'bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'vibrato usage', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools' ] technique_found = [] for indicator in technique_indicators: if indicator in data_str: technique_found.append(indicator) if technique_found: print(f'üéº TECHNIQUE INDICATORS FOUND: {technique_found}') else: print('‚ùå No specific technique indicators found') print() # If we found relevant content, extract it based on the structure we discovered if cambridge_found or researchgate_found or technique_found: print(f'=== EXTRACTING RELEVANT CONTENT ===\n') # Look for sources section if it exists if 'sources' in data: sources = data['sources'] print(f'üìö EXAMINING SOURCES SECTION ({len(sources)} sources):') relevant_sources = [] for i, source in enumerate(sources, 1): if isinstance(source, dict): # Get available fields without assuming structure available_fields = list(source.keys()) # Extract common fields if they exist title = source.get('title', 'No title') publisher = source.get('publisher', 'No publisher') url = source.get('url', 'No URL') year = source.get('year', 'No year') # Check if this source matches our targets title_lower = title.lower() publisher_lower = publisher.lower() url_lower = url.lower() is_relevant = False source_type = '' if ('cambridge' in publisher_lower and 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'perspectives upon the german classical school of violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'CAMBRIDGE TARGET' elif ('researchgate' in url_lower and 'violin' in title_lower) or 'study and analysis of various violin playing schools' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'RESEARCHGATE TARGET' elif 'german' in title_lower and 'violin' in title_lower: is_relevant = True source_type = 'GERMAN VIOLIN RELATED' if is_relevant: print(f'\n *** {source_type} - Source {i} ***') print(f' Title: {title}') print(f' Publisher: {publisher}') print(f' Year: {year}') print(f' URL: {url}') # Extract all available fields print(f' All available fields:') for key, value in source.items(): if key not in ['title', 'publisher', 'year', 'url']: print(f' {key}: {value}') relevant_sources.append({ 'source_type': source_type, 'index': i, 'data': source }) print(f'\nüìã RELEVANT SOURCES SUMMARY:') print(f' Total relevant sources found: {len(relevant_sources)}') cambridge_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'CAMBRIDGE' in s['source_type']] researchgate_sources = [s for s in relevant_sources if 'RESEARCHGATE' in s['source_type']] print(f' Cambridge sources: {len(cambridge_sources)}') print(f' ResearchGate sources: {len(researchgate_sources)}') # Look for extracted content if it exists if 'extracted_content' in data: print(f'\nüìÑ EXAMINING EXTRACTED CONTENT SECTION:') content = data['extracted_content'] if isinstance(content, str): print(f' Content type: String ({len(content):,} characters)') # Search for specific technique information content_lower = content.lower() # Search for bow hold techniques bow_terms = ['bow hold', 'bent thumb', 'curved pinkie', 'thumb position'] bow_found_terms = [term for term in bow_terms if term in content_lower] if bow_found_terms: print(f'\n üèπ BOW HOLD TECHNIQUES FOUND: {bow_found_terms}') # Extract context for first bow hold term first_term = bow_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # Search for vibrato information vibrato_terms = ['vibrato usage', 'vibrato debate', 'repertoire vs national', 'national schools'] vibrato_found_terms = [term for term in vibrato_terms if term in content_lower] if vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n üéµ VIBRATO INFORMATION FOUND: {vibrato_found_terms}') # Extract context for first vibrato term first_term = vibrato_found_terms[0] term_pos = content_lower.find(first_term) if term_pos != -1: context_start = max(0, term_pos - 300) context_end = min(len(content), term_pos + 500) context = content[context_start:context_end] print(f'\n Context for "{first_term}":') print(f' {"-"*70}') print(f' {context}') print(f' {"-"*70}') # If no specific terms found, show general content sample if not bow_found_terms and not vibrato_found_terms: print(f'\n No specific technique terms found. General content sample:') print(f' {content[:400]}...') elif isinstance(content, dict): print(f' Content type: Dictionary with keys: {list(content.keys())}') # Look for source-specific content for key in content.keys(): if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['cambridge', 'german', 'researchgate', 'violin']): print(f'\n üìñ Relevant content in "{key}":') source_content = content[key] if isinstance(source_content, str): print(f' Length: {len(source_content):,} characters') if len(source_content) < 300: print(f' Content: {source_content}') else: print(f' Preview: {source_content[:250]}...') else: print(f' Type: {type(source_content)}') print(f' Content: {source_content}') else: print('No target sources or techniques found in this file.') print('Let\'s examine the actual content structure more carefully...') # Show the actual keys and some sample content print(f'\nActual data structure:') for key, value in data.items(): print(f' {key}: {type(value)}') if isinstance(value, str) and len(value) > 0: print(f' Sample: {value[:200]}...') elif isinstance(value, list) and len(value) > 0: print(f' First item: {value[0]}') elif isinstance(value, dict) and len(value) > 0: print(f' Keys: {list(value.keys())[:3]}...') elif isinstance(data, list): print(f'Data is a list with {len(data)} items') if data: print(f'First item type: {type(data[0])}') if isinstance(data[0], dict): print(f'First item keys: {list(data[0].keys())}') else: print(f'Data is of type: {type(data)}') print(f'Content preview: {str(data)[:300]}...') except json.JSONDecodeError as e: print(f'‚ùå JSON decode error: {e}') print('File content is not valid JSON') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading file: {e}') else: print(f'‚ö†Ô∏è {target_file} not found in workspace') print(f'Available JSON files: {json_files[:5]}...') # Show first 5 # Also examine the Robin Stowell book verification file if it exists stowell_file = 'robin_stowell_book_verification.json' if stowell_file in json_files: print(f'\n=== INSPECTING {stowell_file} ===\n') json_path = os.path.join('workspace', stowell_file) try: with open(json_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: stowell_data = json.load(f) print(f'‚úì Stowell data loaded successfully') print(f'Data type: {type(stowell_data)}') if isinstance(stowell_data, dict): print(f'Dictionary keys: {list(stowell_data.keys())}') # Examine each key's content for key, value in stowell_data.items(): print(f'\n "{key}": {type(value)}') if isinstance(value, dict): print(f' Dict keys: {list(value.keys())}') # Show some content if it looks relevant if any(keyword in key.lower() for keyword in ['book', 'info', 'verification', 'content']): for subkey, subvalue in value.items(): if isinstance(subvalue, str) and len(subvalue) < 200: print(f' {subkey}: {subvalue}') else: print(f' {subkey}: {type(subvalue)} ({len(str(subvalue))} chars)') elif isinstance(value, str): print(f' String length: {len(value):,} characters') if len(value) < 200: print(f' Content: {value}') else: print(f' Preview: {value[:150]}...') elif isinstance(value, list): print(f' List with {len(value)} items') if value: print(f' First item: {value[0]}') else: print(f' Value: {value}') except Exception as e: print(f'‚ùå Error reading Stowell file: {e}') print(f'\n{"="*80}') print('WORKSPACE EXAMINATION SUMMARY') print(f'{"="*80}') print(f'Objective: Locate Cambridge "Perspectives upon the German Classical School of Violin"') print(f' and ResearchGate "Study and Analysis of Various Violin Playing Schools"') print(f'\nWorkspace Status:') print(f' - Total files: {len(workspace_files)}') print(f' - Violin-related files: {len(violin_related_files)}') print(f' - JSON files: {len(json_files)}') print(f' - Priority JSON files: {len(priority_json_files)}') print(f'\nTarget Information Needed:') print(f' ‚úì Vibrato usage arguments (repertoire vs national schools)') print(f' ‚úì Bow hold techniques (bent thumb/curved pinkie)') print(f' ‚úì Publication years for source verification') print(f' ‚úì Exact content from Cambridge and ResearchGate sources') print(f'\nNext Steps:') if target_file in json_files: print(f' 1. ‚úì Examined comprehensive analysis file structure') print(f' 2. Continue with other priority JSON files if needed') print(f' 3. Extract specific technique information and publication details') else: print(f' 1. Examine other JSON files for source information') print(f' 2. Check text files for book recommendations') print(f' 3. Search for alternative access to target sources') print(f'\n‚úÖ WORKSPACE EXAMINATION COMPLETED') print(f'Timestamp: {datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")}')
